@<[Page 1]>@

#<A># or (before vowels) AN:
     I This article has no equiv. in Sanskrit and is expressed by the singular number alone: there is a large silk-cotton tree on the banks of the Godavari %<asti godàvarãtãre vi÷àlaþ ÷àlmalãtaruþ>% H. i.; there was a king named Cintamani %<abhådràjà cintàmaõirnàma>% Va.
     II But %<ka÷cit>% (%<kàcit ki¤cit>%) should be added when special attention is directed to the object: a (certain) Yaksha %<ka÷cid yakùaþ>%, Me. I 1.; A (certain) saint named Marichi %<ka÷cinmarãcirnàbha bhaharùiþ>%, D. iii.
     III When it means a species of, %<vi÷eùaþ bhedaþ>%, etc. should be added: Asoka is a tree %<a÷oko vçkùavi÷eùaþ>%.
     IV When used distributively, (a) expr. by avy. comp. with %<prati>%, or, by the repetition of the word in proper agreement with the verb: give (me) 500 sovereign a day %<pratyahaü suvarõapa¤ca÷atàni dehi>%, H. iii; (b) the simple gen. may be used in connection with num. adverbs: dinner twice a day %<dvirahno bhojanam>%, V. In O. E. sometimes=on, in, for: q. v.: the world runs awheel %<*cakrairjagaddhàvati>%.

#<ABAFT>#: %<pa÷càdbhàge>% (with gen.): abaft the mast %<*guõavçkùasya pa÷càdbhàge>%.

#<ABANDON>#:
     1 %<tyajati pari- saü->%, (%<tyaj>%, c. l.);
     2 %<jahàti vi- apa->%, (%<hà>%, c. 3.);
     3 %<ujbhkati sam- pra->%, (%<ujbhk>%, c. 6.);
     4 %<ut-sçjati vi->%, (%<sçj>%, c. 6.).

#<ABANDONED>#:
     I Lit. %<tyaktaþ>% (%<ktà ktaü>%): v. To abandon.
     II Fig.: extremely wicked: q. v.
     1 %<bhraùñaþ>% (%<ùñà ùñaü>%);
     2 %<khaõóitavçttaþ>% (%<ttà ttaü>%) (=of a character).

#<ABANDONMENT>#:
     1 %<tyàgaþ>%;
     2 %<parityàgaþ>%;
     3 %<utsargaþ>%; Ph: a. of wordly connexions: %<sannyàsaþ>%.

#<ABASE>#:
     1 %<abhi-bhavati>% (%<bhå>%, c. 1.);
     2 %<namayati>% (c. of %<nam>%): v. To humble, to lower.

#<ABASEMENT>#: %<abhibhavaþ>%: v. Humiliation.

#<ABASH>#:
     1 %<hepayati>% (c. of %<hrã>%);
     2 %<lajjayati>% (c. of %<lajj>%).

#<ABATE># (v. t.):
     I To lessen, diminish: q. v. %<laghayati>% (nomi.).
     II Leg. t. t., To put down: q. v.

#<ABATE># (v. i.):
     1 %<kùãyate>% (Pass. of %<kùi>%);
     2 %<pari-hãyate>%. (Pass. of %<hà>%);
     3 %<apa-cãyate>% (Pass. of %<ci>%): v. To decrease.

#<ABATEMENT>#:
     I Decrease, diminution: q. v.: %<hràsaþ>%.
     II Diminution of price: Ph. I will make an a. of five per cent %<*pa¤cakaü ÷ataü laghayàmi>%.
     III Leg. t. t.: v. Failure.

#<ABBESS>#:
     1 %<vihàrapàlinã>%;
     2 %<mañhàdhyakùà>%.

#<ABBEY>#:
     1 %<vihàraþ>%;
     2 %<mañhaþ>%.

#<ABBOT>#:
     1 %<vihàrapatiþ>%;
     2 %<mañhàdhyakùaþ>%;
     3 %<mañhàdhã÷aþ>%.

#<ABBREVIATE>#: %<sam-kùipati>% (%<kùip>% c. 6.): v. To contract, shorten.

#<ABBREVIATION>#:
     1 %<saükùepaþ>%;
     2 %<samàsaþ>%;
     3 %<saügrahaþ>%.

#<ABDICATE># (v. i.): %<*ràjyaü svàdhikàraü và tyajati parityajati>%.

#<ABDICATE># (v. t.): %<tyajati pari->%, (%<tyaj>%, c. i.): V. To resign.

#<ABDICATION>#:
     1 %<tyàgaþ parityàgaþ>% (when the sense is clear);
     2 %<ràjyatyàgaþ>% (=a. of a throne);
     3 %<padatyàgaþ>%; (of an office).

#<ABDOMEN>#:
     1 %<vastiþ>%;
     2 %<udaram>%: v. Belly.

#<ABDUCT>#: %<harati apa->%, (%<hç>%, c. 1.), Si. i. 51.

#<ABDUCTION>#:
     1 %<haraõam>%;
     2 %<apaharaõam>%.

#<ABERRATION>#:
     1 %<bhramaþ>%;
     2 %<vibhramaþ>%;
     3 %<unmàrgagamanam>%. Ph. a. of mind %<matibhramaþ>%, Sa. vi.: a. of light %<*tejobhràntiþ>%.

#<ABET>#: %<prot-sàhayati>% (c. of %<sah>%): v. To aid, instigate, encourage.

@<[Page 2]>@

#<ABETTOR>#:
     1 %<protsàhakaþ>%;
     2 %<pravartakaþ>%.

#<ABHOR>#: %<jugupptate>%: v. To hate.

#<ABHORRENCE>#:
     1 %<jugupsà>%;
     2 %<paramadveùaþ>%; N. B. Const. with loc.

#<ABHORRENT>#: v. Repugnant, discordant, inconsistent.

#<ABIDE># (v. i.):
     I To dwell: q. v.: %<vasati>% (%<vas>%, c. 1.).
     II To stay: q. v.: %<ava-tiùñhate>% (%<sthà>%, c. 1.).

#<ABIDE># (v. t.):
     1 To wait for: q. v.: %<pratiãkùate>% (%<ãkù>%, c. 1.).
     II To endure; q. v. %<sahate>% (%<sah>% c. 1.).

#<ABIDE BY>#:
     1 %<tiùñhati>% (%<sthà>%, c. 1.) (with loc.), B. iii. 53;
     2 %<avatiùñhate>% (%<sthà>%, c. l.)(with loc.), B. iii. 14.

#<ABIDING># (part. adj.):
     1 %<sthàyin>% (f. %<nã>%);
     2 %<sthàsnu>% (mfn.).

#<ABIDINGLY>#: v. Constantly, permanently.

#<ABILITY>#:
     I Power: q. v.
     1 %<÷aktiþ>%;
     2 %<sàmarthyam>%; Ph.: to the best or utmost of one's a.:
     1 %<yàvacchakyam>%;
     2 %<yàvacchaktitaþ>%.
     II Mental capacity
     1 %<naipuùyam>%;
     2 %<vaicakùaõyam>%;
     3 %<pàñavam>%.

#<ABJECT># (adj.):
     1 %<nikçùñaþ>% (%<ùñà ùñaü>%);
     2 %<apakçùñaþ>% (%<ùñà ùñaü>%): v. Base, vile.

#<ABJECTION, ABJECTNESS>#: %<apakçùñatà>%: v. Meanness, servility.

#<ABJURATION>#: %<*÷apathapurvakatyàgaþ tyàgaþ>% (when the sense is clear).

#<ABJURE># (v. t.): %<*÷apathapurvakam>% or %<saprati¤jam tyajati pari->%, (%<tyaj>%, c. 1.).

#<ABLATIVE CASE>#:
     1 %<apàdànam>%;
     2 %<apàdànakàrakam>%.

#<ABLE># (adj.):
     I Competent, having sufficient power:
     1 %<samarthaþ>% (%<rthà rthaü>%);
     2 %<÷aktaþ>% (%<ktà ktaü>%);
     3 %<kùamaþ>% (%<mà maü>%).
     II Possessing mental capacity:
     1 %<pañu>% (mfn.);
     2 %<nipuõaþ>% (%<õà õaü>%); v. Clever, skilful.

#<ABLE, BE>#:
     1 %<÷aknoti>% (%<÷ak>%, c. 5.);
     2 %<pàrayati>% (%<pç>%, c. 10.);
     3 %<pramavati>% (%<bhå>%, c. 1.);
     4 %<ãùñe>% (%<ã÷>%, c. 2.);
     5 %<kùamate>% (%<kùam>%, c. 1.): v. Can.

#<ABLE-BODIED>#:
     1 %<prabalakàyaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%);
     2 %<dçóhàïgaþ>% (%<ïgà ïgaü>%): v. Robust, strong.

#<ABLUTION>#:
     1 %<àcamanam>% (of the mouth);
     2 %<aïgasnànam>% (of the body);
     3 %<prakùàlanam>%: v. Washing.

#<ABLY>#: i. e. with ability:
     1 %<nipuõam>%;
     2 %<sapàñavam>%.

#<ABNEGATION>#: %<pratyàkhyànam>%: v. Denial, renunciation.

#<ABOARD>#: Ph. to get a. %<nàvamàrohati>%, RAJ.

#<ABODE>#:
     I Continuance in a place: %<avasthitiþ>%: v. Residence, stay.
     II Dwelling place:
     1 %<nivàsaþ>%;
     2 %<àlayaþ>%;
     3 %<niketanam>%: v. House.

#<ABOLISH># (v. t.): %<lumpati ava- vi->%, (%<lup>%, c. 6.) (?).

#<ABOLITION>#:
     1 %<lopaþ>%;
     2 %<avalopaþ>%;
     3 %<vilopaþ>% (?).

#<ABOMINABLE>#:
     1 %<gahiütaþ>% (%<tà taü>%);
     2 %<ghçõitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%);
     3 %<ghçõàkaraþ>% (%<rã raü>%).

#<ABOMINATE># (v. t.):
     1 %<dveùñi>%, (%<dviù>%; c. 2.);
     2 %<garhate>% (%<garh>%, c. 1.): v. To detest, execrate.

#<ABOMINATION>#:
     I Hatred: q. v. %<dveùaþ>%.
     II That which excites hatred:
     1 %<jugupsitam>%;
     2 %<garhitam>%;
     3 %<ghçõitam>%.

#<ABORIGINES>#: %<àdimavàsinaþ>% (m. pl.) (?).

#<ABORTION>#:
     1 %<garbhasràvaþ>%;
     2 %<garbhapàtaþ>%;
     3 %<garbhapatanam>%;
     4 %<garbhacyutiþ>%. To cause a.:
     1 %<garbhaü pàtayati>% (c. of %<pat>%);
     2 %<bhråõahatyàü karoti>% (%<kç>%, c. 8.) One who causes a.:
     1 %<bhråõahan>% (f. %<ghnã>%);
     2 %<bhråõahatyàkàrin>% (f. %<õã>%): Causing a.:
     1 %<garbhapàtanam>%;
     2 %<bhråõahatyà>%.

#<ABORTIVE>#:
     I Producing abortion:
     1 %<garbhapàtin>% (f. %<nã>%);
     2 %<garbhasràvin>% (f. %<õã>%);
     3 %<bhråõaghna>% (f. %<ghnã>%).
     II Born prematurely:
     1 %<akàlaprasåtaþ>% (%<tà taü>%);
     2 %<akàlajàtaþ>% (%<tà taü>%).
     III Fruitless, unsuccessful: q. v.: %<niùphala>%; (%<là laü>%).

#<ABORTIVELY>#:
     1 %<mudhà>%;
     2 %<vçthà>%: v. In vain.

#<ABOUND># (v. i.): No equiv: expr. by the corresp. adj s.: among those trees a. ing in good fruits %<bhåyiùñhasambhàvyaphaleùvamãùu pàdapeùu>%, R. xiii. 46; the country of Kimpurusha a. s in curiosities %<bahukutåhalaþ kimpuruùaviùayaþ>%, K.: v. Abundant, full of.

@<[Page 3]>@

#<ABOUT># (Prep.):
     I Around: q. v.: %<paritaþ>% (with acc.). Sometimes sim. by the loc.: a. one's neck %<kaõñhe>% or %<kaõñhade÷e>% (not %<kaõñhaü paritaþ>%). Ph.: a. these places %<itastataþ>%.
     II In attendance on: %<saha>% (with ins.): v. With.
     III Respecting, concerning: %<prati>% (with acc.) (rare in this sense): you have spoken one thing good a. Siva %<tvayaikamã÷aü prati sàdhu bhàùitam>%, Ku. v. 81. N. B. Note the following exx.: is there any mistake a. it %<kimatra kàcidbhràntiþ>%, Vi. iii.; whether mere knowledge a. God leads to emancipation %<kimã÷varaviùayaü ¤jànamàtraü nirvàõakàraõam>%, Ds.; conversing now a. his father, now a. his mother, now a. Sukanasa %<antarà pitçsaktamantarà màtçsambaddhadhmantarà ÷ukanàsamayaü kurvannàlàpama>%; K.; I also want to ask something a. your friend %<vayamapi mavatyoþ sakhãgataü kimapi pçcchàmaþ>%, Sa. i.; we had some conversation a. the news of the country %<saïkayà ca de÷avàrtànuviddhà kàcanàvayorabhåt>%; D. v.; a. the Lord of the Heavens %<divodhinàthamadhikçtya>%; a. the friend of the god of Wind %<pavanasya sakhàyaü nirdi÷ya>%; a. the Lord of the (south) quarter %<dikpatimuddi÷ya>%; a. many Nalas %<anekanalàvalambàü>%; N. xiii. 2. 9. 15. 26.
     IV Near (in time): v. About (adv.) (III) Ph. remained for a. a moment %<muhårtamivàsà¤cakre>%, K.; a. the same time %<tasminneva kùaõàntare>%, D. i.

#<ABOUT># (adv.):
     I Around: q. v.: %<paritaþ>%.
     II Here and there %<itastataþ>%. To go, walk, wander a. %<parikràmati>% (%<kram>%, c. 1.).
     III Nearly.
     1 by an altern. com.: we will reach (Patna) in a. a week (lit. in five or six days) %<pa¤caùairahobhirvayameva tatra gantàraþ>%, Mu. v.;
     2 by bah. comp. with %<upa àsanna adåra>% etc: a. ten %<upada÷à>%: (m. pl.); a. four %<upacaturàþ>%; a. twenty %<àsannaviü÷àþ>%; a. thirty %<adåratriü÷àþ>%;
     3 by %<pràyaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%) or %<kalpaþ>% (%<lpà lpaü>%) affixed: a. as high as the knee %<jànudadhnakalpaþ>% (%<lpà lpaü>%);
     4 of age, by %<de÷ãyaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%), affixed: a. 18 years of age %<aùñàda÷avarùade÷ãyaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%), D. vi.

#<ABOUT, BE>#: %<udyataþ>% (%<tà taü>%): v. Point of, on the; ready. Ph.: What is the king a. now %<atha sa ràjà kimàrambhaþ samprati>%, U. ii.

#<ABOVE># (adv.):
     I Overhead:
     1 %<upari>%;
     2 %<årddhvam>%;
     3 %<upariùñàt>%. From a.:
     1 %<upariùñàt>%;
     2 %<årddhvataþ>%, Ku. xiv. 37.
     II Before:
     1 %<pårvam>%;
     2 %<pràk>%.

#<ABOVE># (adj.): %<pårvaþ>% (%<rvà rvaü>%), in the a. aphorism %<pårveõa såtreõa>%, S.

#<ABOVE># (Prep.):
     I In a higher place: %<upari>% (with gen.) Just a.: %<uparyupari>% (with acc.), Just a. the village %<uparyupari gràmam>%.
     II In greater number:
     1 by tat. comp. with %<adhikaþ>% (%<kà kaü>%): in a. half a moment %<arddhàdhikamuhårtena>%, RAM.;
     2 by bah. comp. with %<adhika>%, a. forty %<adhikacatvàriü÷aþ>% (m. pl.);
     3 by comp. with %<paraþ>%, a. hundred (=hundreds) %<paraþ÷ataþ>% (%<tà taü>%); Ki. xiii. 26.
     III Beyond; v. Beyond (prep.) (III).

#<ABOVE, BE>#:
     1 %<ativartate>% (%<vçt>%, c. 1.) Vi. iv.;
     2 %<adhi>% or %<ati>% (with acc.) (rare): Krishna is a. the gods %<ati devàn kçùõaþ>%.

#<ABRADE>#: v. To rub, scrape.

#<ABREAST>#: %<pàr÷vàpàr÷iva>% (indec.)

#<ABRIDGE>#:
     1 %<saï kùipati>% (%<kùip>%, c. 6.);
     2 %<samà-harati>% (%<hç>%, c. 1.);
     3 %<sam-asyati>% (%<as>%, c. 4.); v. To lessen, shorten.

#<ABRIDGEMENT>#:
     1 %<saükùepaþ>%;
     2 %<pratyàhàraþ>%;
     3 %<samàhàraþ>%;
     4 %<samàsaþ>%.

#<ABROAD># (adv.):
     I In a foreign country:
     1 %<vide÷e>%;
     2 %<de÷àntare>%.
     II To a foreign country:
     1 %<vide÷aü>%;
     2 %<de÷àntaram>%.
     III Not at home %<bahis>%.
     IV Widely: q. v.: spreading his rays far a. %<dåraprasàritakaraþ>%, K.

#<ABROAD, LIVE>#:
     1 %<pravasati>% (%<vas>%, c. 1.);
     2 %<vide÷e vasati>% etc. One who is, or, is living a. %<proùitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%).

#<ABROGATE, ABROGATION>#: v. To repeal, etc.

#<ABRUPT># (adj.):
     I Steep, rugged: q. v.: %<viùamaþ>% (%<mà maü>%).
     II Hasty, sudden: q. v.:
     1 %<àkasmikaþ>% (%<kã kaü>%);
     2 %<akàõóaþ>% (%<õóà õóaü>%).
     III Of style: no equiv.: %<*bhagnaþ>% (%<bhagnà bhagnaü>%).

#<ABRUPTLY>#: %<sahasà>%: v. Suddenly, hastily.

#<ABRUPTNESS>#:
     I Steepness: q. v. Haste, Suddenness: q. v.

@<[Page 4]>@

#<ABSCESS>#: perh. %<vidradhiþ>%.

#<ABSCOND>#:
     1 %<àtmànaü nigåhati>% (%<guh>%, c. 1.): v. To hide;
     2 %<palàyate>%: v. To escape.

#<ABSENCE>#:
     I A not being present:
     1 %<anupasthitiþ>%;
     2 By the corresp. adj s v. ABSENT: Ph. how shall I live in his a. %<ahametasya virahe kathaü jãviùyàmi>%, Vet.
     II A being abroad:
     1 %<pravàsaþ>%;
     2 %<pravasanam>%.
     III Non-existence: %<abhàvaþ>%: first of all, the property goes to the brothers, in their a. to the mother, in mother's a. to the father, and in their a to the husband %<prathamaü sodaràõàü tadabhàve màtuþ màturabhàve pituþ eùàü punarabhàve taddhanaü bhartuþ>%, Da.
     IV Fig.: pl. a. of mind:
     1 %<anyamanaskatà>%;
     2 %<amanoyogaþ>%.

#<ABSENT>#: (adj.)
     I Not present:
     1 %<anupasthitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%);
     2 %<avidyamànaþ>% (%<nà naü>%);
     3 %<avartamànaþ>% (%<nà naü>%).
     II Heedless: q. v.: %<anyamanaskaþ>% (%<skà skaü>%).

#<ABSENT, BE>#: i. e. To be abroad: %<pra-vasati>% (%<vas>%, c. 1.).

#<ABSENT-MINDED>#: %<÷ånyahçdayaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%), Sa.
     IV

#<ABSENTEE>#:
     I One temporarily absent: %<anupasthitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%): v. Absent.
     II One being abroad:
     1 %<proùitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%);
     2 %<pravàsin>% (f. %<nã>%).

#<ABSOLUTE># (adj.):
     I Perfect: q. v.:
     1 %<nityaþ>% (%<tyà tyaü>%) (=eternal, sometimes used with the same force): it is admitted by all assertors of final emancipation that it is a. %<nitya÷ca mokùaþ sarvairmãkùavàdibhirupagamyate>%, S. I. 4.;
     2 %<paramaþ>% (%<mà maü>%) (=excellent, q. v.).
     II Unconditional, uncontrolled: q. v.: Ph.: for fate has a. power %<sarvathà pramavati hi magavàn vidhiþ>%, K. iii. Not relative: %<kevalaþ>% (%<là laü>%) (?) the recent philosophy of a. the %<*àdhunikakaivalyadar÷anam>% or %<-vi¤jànam>%.

#<ABSOLUTELY>#: i. e. Entirely:
     1 %<sarvathà>%;
     2 %<ekàntatas>%.

#<ABSOLUTION>#:
     I Acquittal: q. v.
     II Religious a.:
     1 %<nistàraþ>%;
     2 %<niùkçtiþ>%;
     3 %<uddhàraþ>%.

#<ABSOLVE>#:
     I To acquit, exonerate: q. v.: %<mocayati>% (c. of %<muc>%).
     II In religious sense:
     1 %<niù-tàrayati>% (c. of %<té>%,);

     I Assumed:

#<AFFECTEDLY>#:
     1 By the adj: v. Affected;
     2 %<sàñopaü>% (=boastfully)

     I Pleasing
     1 %<mano¤jaþ>% (%<¤jà ¤jaü>%);

     4 %<ramyaþ>% (%<myà myaü>%);
     5 %<rucikaraþ>% (%<rã raü>%)
     II Suitable, confirmable, consistent: q. v.

     2 by tat. comp.

#<AND>#:
     I In case of subs. and adj. s: (a) by dva. comp.: summer a. spring %<grãùmavasantau>%; father a. mother %<màtàpitarau>%; or, sim. %<pitarau>% [so brother a. sister %<bhràrarau>%; son a. daughter %<putrau>%; father-inlaw a. mother-in-law %<÷va÷urau>%]; with his superior birth, asceticism, erudition, valour a. deeds %<amijanatapovidyàkriyàti÷ayairnijaiþ>%, Vi. ii.; exhausted, tremulous, and (therefore) pleasant %<alasalalitamugdhàni>%, U. i.;
     6 by %<ca>% (enclitic): fresh youth, incomparable beauty, a. superhuman prowess %<abhinavayauvanatvamapratimaråpatvamamànuùa÷aktitvaü ca>%, K. II. In case of numerals:
     1 By a comp. with %<adhikaþ>% (%<kà kaü>%), or %<uttaraþ>% (%<rà raü>%): one hundred a. two %<dvadhikaü ÷ataü>% or sim., %<dvavàdhika÷ataü>%: three thousand a. sixty-eight %<aùñaùaùñayu ttaratrisahasraü>%;
     2 By a comp. with %<sa->%: after a reign of 18 years a. thirteen days %<so'ùñàda÷àbdàn kùamàü bhuktvà satrayoda÷avàsaràn>%, Raj.;
     3 by %<ca>% (very rare), Vi.
     III In case of verbs, generally by participles: go a. speak this to the minister %<gatvaivamamàtyaü brå hi>%, Sa. vi.; then he alighted (from the horse) a. tied it up to a. branch of a tree, a. then approached a. saluted Siva a. then again gazed on the same lady %<tato'vatãrya taru÷àkhàyàü baddhvà turagamupasçtya praõamya trilocanàya tàmeva yoùitaü cakùuùà punarniråpayàmàsa>%, K. v. (iv).
     IV In connecting sentences:
     1 By %<ca>% (never at the beginning): (these remembrances) burn my body a. rend my heart %<dehaü dahanti hçdayaü ca vidàrayanti>%; Ma. x.;
     2 Sometimes %<ca>% is omited: behave so that you will not be laughed at by men, will not be censured by the good, will not be reviled by the seniors %<tathà prayatethàþ yathà nopahasyase janaiþ na nindàse sàdhubhiþ na dhikkriyase guråbhiþ>%, K. V. In Interrogation, generally by %<và>% (enclitic): who is he, whose son, a. what is his name ? %<ko'sau kasya vàpatyaü kimabhidhàno và?>% K.; O. fair lady, who are you, whose spouse, a. what is your object for coming to me ? %<kà tvaü ÷ubhe kasya parigraho và kiü và madabhyàgamanakàraõaü te>%, R. xiv. 8.

#<AND THEN>#: denoting immediate sequence:
     1 %<tadanu>% in childhood a. then again in youth %<÷ai÷ave tadanu yauvane punaþ>% U. i.;
     2 %<tataþ>%, a. then allowed his son to go %<tato'nuj¤e gamanaü sutasya>% B. i. 23.;
     3 %<tadanu ca>% (very rare), Vi. ii. v. and (III).

#<ANOTHER>#:

     3 %<aparaþ>% (%<rà raü>%), a. dearer to you than myself %<mattaþpriyatarastavàparo janaþ>%, K.;

#<ANSWER># (v. t.):
     I To reply:
     1 %<kathayati>% (%<kath>%, c. 10.), (first) a. my these four questions and then drink water %<mamaitàn caturo pra÷nàn kathayitvà jalaü piva>%, Mah.;
     2 %<bravãti>% (%<brå>%, c. 2.), if you do not a. my questions,
     I will eat you %<na cedvåvãùi pra÷nàna÷nàmi tvàü>%, D. vi.;
     3 %<uttaraü dadàti>% (%<dà>%, c. 3.) (with gen.);
     4 %<pratilikhati>% ( =to write back, q. v.). N. B.
     1 and
     2 are not applicable to writing.
     II To refute: q. v.
     III To correspond to, suit: q. v.
     IV To pay: q. v. Ph: this will a. my object %<anena saphalasamohito bhavàmi>%.

#<ANSWER># (v. i.):
     I To make a reply: %<uttaraü dadàti>%.
     II To speak in reply:
     1 %<prativakti>% (%<vac>%, c. 1.);
     2 %<prativadati>% (%<vad>%, c. 1.);
     3 %<pratibhàùate>% (%<bhàù>%, c. 1.).
     III To render an account to: expressed by circumlo.: you will have to a. to your master for the sums received %<*tvayà yaddhanaü labdhaü tasya vi÷eùavçttàntaþ svàmine nivedayitavyaþ>%.
     IV To serve for.: q. v.

#<ANSWER># (subs):
     1 %<uttaraü>%;
     2 %<prativacanam>%;
     3 %<pratyuktiþ>%;
     4 %<prativàkyam>%. N. B. The last three words are applicable only to speaking in reply, while the first %<uttaraü>% is applicable also to legal replies and solutions of problems.

#<ANSWERABLE>#:
     I Refutable: %<khaõóanãyaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%).
     II Responsible, accountable: q. v.
     III Correspondent, proportionate, suited: q. v.

     1 %<ka÷cit>% (%<kàcit ki¤cit>%), have you got a. one named Vimardaka %<kimasti ka÷cidvimardako nàmàtrabhavataþ>%; D. ii.: is there a. doubt about it %<kimatra kàcidbhràntiþ>% Vi.: I could not find a. thing in the house %<gçhaü pravi÷yana ki¤cinmayà samàsàditam>%, Mr. iii.;

     3 %<ka÷cana>% (%<kàcana ki¤cana>%) (rare). #<APPLICATION># (subs).:
     I The act of putting to: %<prayogaþ samprayogaþ>%, by the a. of fire or heat %<agnyàtapasaüprayogàt>%, R. v. 54.
     II The thing applied: %<prayogaþ>%, should seize (them) by wet leather or by other a. s %<àrdra carmaõànyairvà prayogairgçhvãyàt>%, Sr.
     III Petition: q. v.:
     1 %<pràrthanà>%;
     2 %<yàc¤à>%.
     IV attention, assiduity: q. v.:
     1 %<abhinive÷aþ>%;
     2 %<manoyogaþ>%. V. Use, employment; %<prayogaþ>% Ki.
     VI Relation, reference: q. v.

     2 %<uppattiþ>% Ki. ii. 23.
     III A debate, discussion: q. v.: %<vàdànuvàdaþ>%.
     IV The subject of a discourse, etc.: Ph. I will give the a. (of the play) %<saükùepata itivçttamabhidhãyate>%, Tàrànàth: v. Subect. v. An abstract summary: q. v.

#<ARGUMENTATION>#: %<tarkaþ>%: v. Reasoning.

#<ARGUMENTATIVE>#: %<tàrkikaþ>% (%<kã kaü>%): Ph. it is a. of almighty power in the creator %<etadã÷varasya sarva÷aktitvaü pradar÷ayati>%.

     2 %<udgacchati>% (%<gam>%, c. 1): v. To rise, produce (iv). N. B. These two verbs are used in all the senses the English verb: a. ing from the seat %<àsanàdudvan>%, Ki. ii. 57.; the moon arose %<udagàt sudhàsåtiþ>%, K.; does (not) your fear a., maiden %<udeti te bhãrapi kinnu bàle>%, N. iii. 13.

#<ARTLESS>#:
     I Simple, frank, guileless: q. v.;
     1 %<amàyaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%);
     2 %<çju>% (mfn.).
     II Contrived without art:
     1 %<nãrasaþ>% (%<sà saü>%) (=devoid of taste);
     2 %<alaïkàrahãnaþ>% (%<nà naü>%) (=unadorned).

#<ARTLESSLY>#: i. e. Simply, frankly: q. v.:
     1 %<màyàü vinà>%;
     2 %<akapañena>%;
     3 %<àrjavena>%.

#<ARTLESSNESS>#:
     1 %<amàyità>%;
     2 %<saralatà>%;
     3 %<àrjavam>%: v. Simplicity.

#<AS>#:
     I As a particle of comparison:
     1 %<vat>% affixed, (he who looks on) other's wives as mothers, on other's things as clods %<màtçvat paradàreùu paradravyeùu loùñravat>%, H. i.; as before %<pårvavat>%;
     2 %<yathà>% (either in comp. to expr. sim. comparison, or with %<tathà>% or %<evaü>% to expr. as......so...... also to introduce illustrations): as ordered %<yathànide÷aü>%; as prescribed %<yathàvidhi>%; as before %<yathàpurà>%, Sa. vi.; as eating is inferred from nourishment or country from its language, so is knowable inferred from knowledge, %<yathà puùñayà bhojanamanumãyate yathà ca bhàùayà de÷aþ tathà j¤ànàkàreõa j¤eyamanumeyam>%. D. s. (see also R. iii. 23 and notice the repetition of %<yathà>% in such cases); as animals attempt to fly away when they see men with sticks, so.... %<yathà pa÷vàdayaþ daõóodyatakaraü puråùamabhimukhamupalabhya palàyitumàrabhante evaü.>%. S. i. p.; as for instance, fire is inferred from smoke %<yathà dhåmenàgniriti>%, N. d. As for instance: sometimes expr. by %<tathàhiþ>% he, as a rule, enjoyed the pleasures of youth as for instance, sometimes roamed over artificial mountains, sometimes walked through summer houses %<sa pràya÷o yauvanasukhamanubabhåva tathàhi kadàcit krãóàparvateùu vicacàra kadàcillatàgçheùu babhràma>%, K. II. While: expr. by the pres. part: as he went, he thought %<vrajaü÷ca samarthayàmàsa>%, K. III. Since, in as much as: q. v.:
     1 by the abl. and when the subs. ends in %<tà>% or %<à>% by the ins.: as the motion of the vessels (at sea) depends on wind %<vàtàdhãnapotagamanatvàt>%, K. b.; as there was much political work %<ràjakàryasya bahulatayà>% Sa. vi.;
     2 %<yataþ...tataþ.>%. Miscell: as long as one lives %<yàvajjãvaü>%; as far as the ocean %<à samudràt>%; as high as the knee %<jànudaghnaþ>% (%<ghnà ghnaü>%); as yet %<adyàpi>%. N. B. as, when it connects two subs. s in apposition is expr. by %<bhåtvà>% or %<kçtvà>%: I will remain as your queen %<tava mahiùã bhåtvà tiùñhàmi>%; sent me to you as his agent %<màü pratinidhiü kçtvà tvatsakà÷aü prerayàmàsa>%.

#<AS BEING>#: Expr. By the ins. of subs. s in %<tà>% or by the abl. in other cases: a. few %<alpatayà>%; a. a child %<bàlatayà>%; a. weak %<daurbalyàt>%; a. wonderful %<adbhutatvàt>%.

#<AS IF>#: %<iva>% (always after the word it governs): passed the night as if in a moment %<kùaõàdiva kùaõadàü kùapitavatã>%, K.; as if painted, as if engraved, as if paralyzed %<likhitamivotkãrõamiva stambhitamiva>%, K.; as if from hell to heaven %<narakàdiva svargam>%, D.

#<AS FOLLOWS>#: %<iti>% (at the end of the quotation, which is placed first in Sanskrit). see R. iii. 47., Ku. iv. 43. Ph.: began to speak as follows %<vaktumitthamupacakrame vacaþ>%, K. xiii. 36.; Bachaspati spoke a. %<vàcaspatiravàcedaü>%, Ku. ii. 30.

#<AS FOR, AS TO>#: %<viùayaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%) or %<viùayakaþ>% (%<kà kaü>%) in comp.: as for his valour, I will not say a word %<tasya ÷auryaviùayaü na ki¤cid vadàmi>%.

#<AS SOON AS>#:
     1 by a comp. adj. with %<màtraþ>% (%<trà traü>%), he who does not put down an enemy or a disease a. it appears %<jàtamàtraü na yaþ ÷atruü rogaü ca pra÷amaü nayet>%, P. i. 8.;
     2 %<yadà...tadaiva>%. Ph.: a. I spoke %<madvacanàntarameva>%, K.

#<AS WELL AS>#: %<ca......caþ>% anointed with nectar a. poison %<digdho'mçtena ca viùeõa ca>%, Ma. i.; as a mother a. as a father %<màtà ca pità ca bhåtvà>% D. v.

#<ATTENTIVE>#:

     1 %<avahitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%); %<dattàvadhànaþ>% or %<kçtàvadhànaþ>% (%<nà naü>%) (=paying attention);
     3 %<sàvadhànaþ>% (%<nà naü>%)
     4 %<samàhitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%);
     5 %<apramattaþ>% (%<ttà ttaü>%).
     II Attentive to a guest etc.:
     1 %<dar÷itàdaraþ>% (%<rà raü>%), K.;
     1 %<dakùiõaþ>% (%<õà õaü>%) (as a lover ?) V. iii.

#<ATTENTIVELY>#:
     1 %<avahitam>%;
     2 %<sàvadhànam>%;
     3 %<apramattam>%;
     4 %<manoyogena>%.

#<ATTENUANT># (adj. and subs.): %<vidràvakaþ>% or %<vilàyakaþ>% (%<kà kaü>%) (?).

@<[Page 48]>@

#<ATTENUATE>#:
     1 %<kç÷ãkaroti>%;
     2 %<tanåkaroti>%.

#<ATTENUATED>#:
     1 %<kç÷aþ>% (%<÷à ÷aü>%);
     2 %<kùãõaþ>% (%<õà õaü>%);
     3 %<apacitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%): v. Thin.

#<ATTEST>#:
     I To a deed: %<*patrasya vi÷uddhipradar÷anàya sàkùã bhavati>% or %<svanàma patre likhati>%: Ph. the will is a. ed by three witnesses %<*asyecchàpatrasya vi÷uddhipradar÷akàstrayaþ sàkùiõaþ santi>%.
     II To manifest: q. v.:
     1 %<prakañãkaroti>%;
     2 %<vyanakti>% (%<a¤j>%, c. 7.).

#<ATTESTATION>#:
     I Verbal: %<sàkùyam>%.
     II Written: Ph. the a. s of the will are all forged %<*icchàpatre yeùàü sàkùiõàü nàmàni likhitàni tat sarvaü kçtrimam>%.

#<AWAIT># (v. t.):
     I To wait for: q. v.
     1 %<pratãkùate>% (%<ãkù>% c. 1);
     2 %<pratipàlayati>% (%<pàl>%, c. 10).
     II To be in store for: %<à-sãdati pratyà->%, (%<sad>%, c. 1) (to be nigh), salvation a. s thee %<pratyàsãdati muktistvàü>%, Ki. xi. 36. Ph. death a. s every one %<maraõaü prakçtiþ ÷arãriõàm>%, R.; what a. s me next %<*kimataþ paraü me sambhaviùyati>%.

#<AWAKE># (v. i.):
     1 %<budhyate vi- pra- prati->%, (%<budh>% c. 4);
     2 %<uttiùñhati>% (%<sthà>%, c. 1) (=to get up);
     3 %<nidràü tyajati jahàti>% etc.; %<vinidraþ>% (%<drà draü>%) %<bhavati>% etc.

#<AWAKE># (v. t.):
     I From sleep:
     1 %<bodhayati pra- vi- prati- vipra->%, (c. of %<budh>%);
     2 %<jàgarayati>% (c. of %<jàgç>%);
     3 %<nidràü bhanakti>% (%<bhanj>%, c. 7) (with gen.).
     II From inattention, or inaction: v. To arouse, rouse.

#<AWAKE># (adj.):
     1 %<jàgrat>% (f. %<tã>%);
     2 %<jàgaraþ>% (%<rà raü>%);
     3 %<unnidraþ>% (%<drà draü>%) (without sleep);
     4 %<prabuddhaþ>% (%<ddhà ddhaü>%): v. To be awake.

#<AWAKE, BE>#: %<jàgarti pra->%, (%<jàgç>%, c. 2).

#<AWAKEN>#: v. To awake.

#<AWAKENING># (subs):
     1 %<prabodhaþ prabodhanam>%;
     2 %<bodhaþ>%;
     3 %<vibodhanam>%.

     2 %<vitarati>% (%<té>%, c. 1);

#<AWARD># (subs.): %<nirõayaþ>%: v. Judgment, sentence.

#<AWAY>#: v. the several verbs with which it is used. Ph.: a. with begging %<kçtameva yàc¤ayà>%, Ki. xiv. 20; a. with shame %<alaü hriyà>%, R. v. 58; a. (=begone; q. v.) %<antaramantaram>%, Mr. ii.; she is a. (=absent, q. v.).

#<AWE># (subs.):
     1 %<bhayam>%;
     2 %<tràsaþ>%;
     3 %<sàdhvasam>%;
     4 %<àdaraþ>%. N. B. There is no exact equiv. of awe: 1, 2 and 3 mean fear, 4 means respect. To stand in a. of: %<bibheti>% (%<bhã>%, c. 3) (with abl.). Ph.: he is known to me and not disagreeable, still
     I approach him with a %<na ca na paricito na càpyaramya÷cakitamupaimi tathàpi pàr÷vamasya>%, Mal. i.

     I Awe-inspiring:
     1 %<ghoraþ>% (%<rà raü>%) (=terrific: q. v.: not applicable to men);

#<BASTARD>#:
     1 %<jàrajaþ>% (%<jà jaü>%) (=child of a woman by her gallant);

#<BE>#:
     I As a logical copula:
     1 %<bhavati>% (%<bhå>%, c. 1), it is long-necked %<dãrdhagrãvaþ sa bhavati>%, U. iv.; the hearts of good men are always compassionate %<karuõàrdràõi satàü khalu bhavanti sadà cetàüsi>%, K. N. B. It is often understood: the end of aims is beyond comprehension %<duraghigamà hi gatiþ prayojanànàm>%, Ki. x. 40.
     II Denoting existence, presence: %<asti>%, there was formerly a king named øudraka %<àsãdràjà ÷ådrako nàma>%, K.; and there are heaps of gems %<santi ratnanicayà÷ca bhåri÷aþ>%, Ki. xiii. 55. N. B. Note (a) that this verb is exclusively used for there is-, there was-, etc.; (b) that in this sense, it is gen. placed at the beginning of the sentence; and (c) that this verb is defective and its non-conjugational tenses are supplied by those of %<bhå>% and hence we meet with phrases like %<abhånnçpaþ>% (-there was a king), B. i. 1.;
     2 %<vartate saü->%, (%<vçt>%, c. 1), in a moment you will be in your realm %<kùaõàt svàghikàrabhåmau vartiùyate>%, Sa. vii.: v. To be present. Ph.: here are we %<ime smaþ>%, Sa. iv.; be it so %<evamastu mavatu>%.
     III To become: q. v.: %<bhavati>%.

#<BE OVER>#: Ph. let the rain be over %<bhavatu vçùñherupa÷amaþ>%, H. iii.: v. To cease.

     3 %<ramaõãyatà>% (=pleasantness);
     4 %<÷obhà>% (splendour);
     5 %<råpam>% (=b. of person);
     6 %<làvaõyam>% (=prettiness);
     7 %<abhikhyà>% (rare). Ph.: a. b. (=beautiful girl) %<sundarã>%; the b. s of poem. %<kàvyasya madhåni>% (?); enchanted with the b. s of nature %<pràkçtika÷obhayàhçtacittaþ>% (%<ttà ttaü>%); attained the b. of a bed %<÷ayanãyalakùmãü babhàra>%, Ki. viii. 57.; vying with the b. of the ocean %<payodhilakùmãmuùi>%, N. i. 117.: N. B. In the same sense %<÷rã>%, which is more common in comps.

#<BEAVER>#:
     I An animal: %<*vivaraþ vivare÷aya÷catuùpàdajantubhedaþ>%.
     II A b. hat: %<*vivaralomanirmitamiyuråpãyajanabhçta÷iraskam>%.
     III Of a helmet: %<*÷iraskasyapa civukapracchàdakabhàgaþ>%.

#<BECAFICO>#: %<dràkùàdiphalabhakùako kùudrapakùimedaþ>%.

@<[Page 62]>@

#<BECALM># (v. t.): %<÷amayati pra- upa->%, (c. of %<÷am>%): v. To appease.

#<BECAUSE># (conj.):
     1 %<iti>%; poems are not good b. old, nor faultly b. new %<puràõamityeva na sàdhu sarvaü na càpi kàvyaü navamityavadyam>%, Mal. I. N. B. Note the position of %<iti>%;
     2 %<hi>% (never at the beginning of a sentence), b. you see that a rich man feels pain at the loss of his wealth (you cannot conclude that) he will have the same pain when he assumes mendicancy %<na hi dhanino dhanàpahàranimittaü duþkhaü dçùñamiti tasyaiva pravrajitasya tadeva duþkhaü bhavati>%, S. i. 4.: v. For. N. B. Observe that %<na hi>% is the best way of expressing because...not.
     3 %<kutaþ>% or %<kasmàt>% (=why) with abl.: here the word %<àyatana>% means something else, b. we hear that it is the bridge of ambrosia %<tatràrthàntaraü kimapyàyatanaü syàditi pràptam kasmàt? amçtasyaiùa seturiti ÷ravaõàt>%, S. iii. 1.

#<BECAUSE OF># (prep.): By ins. or abl. etc.: v. Account of, on.

#<BECK># (subs.):
     1 %<saïketaþ>%;
     2 %<saüj¤à>%;
     3 %<iïgitam>%.

#<BECOME># (v. i.): %<bhavati>% (%<bhå>%, c. 1), what in the forest became of the deer-eyed (damsel) %<kimamavat vipine hariõãdç÷aþ>%, U. iii.
     2 %<sampadyate>% (%<pad>%, c. 4). (rare) Me. i. 16. N.B. This verb in connexion with adj. s, is (a) often expr. by verbs of motion with corres. sub. s.: became very sorry %<paraü viùàdamagamat>%. P. i. 2.; b. s an object of hatred to the people %<dveùyatàü yàti loke>%, P. i. 3.; b. s of no use %<vrajati vyarthakatàm>%, Si. xvi. 43. (b) and by verbs meaning to produce: b. ing very sorry %<samupajàta÷okà>%, K. (his) face became terrible %<ànanaü kråramajani>%, Si. xv. 8. (c) and sometimes by verbs meaning to obtain: became surprised %<vismayamàpede>%, K. (d) by inceptive verbs: to b. congealed %<ghanãbhavati>%.

#<BELAY>#:
     I To block up: q. v.
     II To fasten: q. v.

#<BELCH># (v.):
     1 %<ut-vamati>% (%<vam>%, c. l); %<ut-girati>% (%<gé>%, c. 6).

     1 (%<udvamaþ>%;
     2 %<udvamanam>%;
     3 %<udgàraþ>%;
     4 %<udgiraõam>%.

#<BELDAM>#: %<vçddhà>%: v. Old woman, hag.

#<BELIE># (v. t.):
     I To show to be false: expr. by
     1 %<vyanakti>% (%<vya¤j>%, c. 7);
     2 %<vi-vçõoti>% (%<vç>%, c. 5);
     3 %<prakà÷ayati>% (nomi.) etc. (=to show: q. v.) the (wanton sword of) language of bad men b. s their heart %<hçdayaü nigåhataþ sphurannasàdhorvivçõoti vàgasiþ>%, Ki. xiv. 12.
     II To calumniate, misrepresent: q. v.: %<apa-vadati>% (%<vad>%, c. l).

#<BELIEF># (subs.):
     I Credence:
     1 %<vi÷vàsaþ>%, worthy of b. %<vi÷vàsayogyaþ>% (%<gyà gyaü>%): v. Credible;
     2 %<pratyayaþ>%.
     II Religious faith:
     1 %<÷raddhà>%;
     2 %<vi÷vàsaþ>%;
     3 %<àstikyam>%;
     4 %<àstikyabuddhiþ>%
     III Doctrine, opinion: q. v. %<matam>%.
     IV The object of belief: expr. by the verb: ghosts are the belief of fools %<*mårkhà bhåteùu vi÷vasanti>%.

#<BELIEVE># (v. i.):
     I To have faith in:
     1 %<vi÷vasiti>% (%<÷vas>%, c. 2.) (with loc.) when does a virgin b. in man %<puüsi vi÷vasiti kutra kumàrã>%, N. v. 100.
     2 %<pratyeti>% (%<i>%, c. 2.) (with acc.) every body b. s in the existence of his self %<sarvo hyàtmàstitvaü pratyeti>%, S.
     II To think, suppose: q. v.:
     1 %<sambhàvayati>%;
     2 %<manyate>% (%<man>%, c. 4.).

#<BELIEVE># (v. t.):
     1 %<pratyeti>%, if you don't b. me %<yadi mama vacane na pratyeùi>%, Ra.;
     2 %<vi÷vasiti>%, so that his Highness would b. me %<yathà màü vi÷vased vibhuþ>%, A. r.;
     3 %<÷raddadhàti>% or %<÷raddhatte>% (%<dhà>%, c. 3) who will b. the real fact %<kaþ ÷raddhàsyati bhåtàrtham>%, Mr. iii.;
     4 %<sambhàvayati>% (c. of %<bhåþ>% =to think possible), who will b. that the Maurya king sold the ornament %<maurye bhåùaõavikrayaü narapatau ko nàma sambhàvayet>%, Mr. v. Ph. I dont b. this %<atra me'pratyayaþ>%.

     1 %<÷raddhàluþ>%;
     2 %<vi÷vàsin>% (m.);

     2 %<anvayaþ>%; Ph. proud of one's b. %<kulàbhimànin>% (f. %<nã>%), Ki.; of high b. %<abhijanavat>% (f. %<tã>%), Sa iii. The act of giving birth:
     1 %<prasavaþ>%;
     2 %<prajananam>%.
     IV That which is born: v. Creature.

     III Fig. v. To burn.

     I To b. the fire: %<dhamati sabhà- pra- upa->%, (%<dhmà>%, c. l.) M. iv. 53.

     II Destined: Ph. b. for Puri %<purãyàtrin>% (f. %<õã>%); where are you b. to %<kva gacchasi>%.
     III Equiv. to must: q. v.: you are b. to do this %<tvayedamava÷yaü kartavyam>%.

#<BOUNDARY>#: %<sãmà>% (f.) or %<sãman>% (m.): a dispute about b. s %<sãmàvivàdaþ>%; on the b. lines %<sãmàsandhiùu>%; b. marks %<sãmàliïgàni>%, M. viii. 6. 248. 249.

     2 %<cårõitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%) (%<bhavati>%), H. iv.

#<BREAK LOOSE>#:
     I Lit.: expr. by circumlo: it broke loose and got into the high street %<sa àlànastambhaü bhaüktvàràjamàrgamavatãrõaþ>% Mr. ii.
     II Fig.: of anger, etc.:
     1 %<uddãùyate>% (%<dãp>%, c. 4.);
     2 %<sphårjati>% (%<sphurj>%, c. l.).

#<BREAK OFF># (v. t.):
     I Lit.: %<bhanakti>%.
     II To put and end to: Ph. b. his journey for three nights %<triràtraü prayànabhaïgamakarot>%, P. i. p.; to b. a marriage %<vivàhabhaïgaü karoti>% (?) (comp. the Bengali idiom).

#<BREAK OFF># (v. i.): %<viramati>% (%<ram>%, c. l.) (=to cease: q. v.).

#<BREAK OPEN>#:
     1 %<bhanakti>%;
     2 %<troñayati>% (c. of %<truñ>%).

#<BREAK OUT>#:
     I To escape from restraint: v. To escape.
     II To arise suddenly:
     1 %<àvirbhavati>% or %<pràdurbhavati>% (%<bhå>%, c. l.);
     2 %<udeti>% (%<i>%, c. 2.):
     3 %<udgacchati>% (%<gam>%, c. l.).

#<BREAK UP># (v. t.): To break into pieces: q. v.
     II To abolish: q. v. to b. an assembly %<sabhàbhaïgaü karoti>% or %<sabhàü bhanakti>%, C.

#<BREAK UP># (v. i.):
     I To break into pieces: q. v.
     II To be dissolved: Ph. let us b. now %<svaü svaü sthànamidànãü gacchàmaþ>%.

#<BREAK UPON>#: Ph. the waves b. the rocks %<upalàhatàstaraïgà vibhedaü>% or %<vilayaü gacchanti>% (after Ki. and Si.).

#<BREAK WITH>#: %<vivadate>% (%<vad>%, c. l.): v. To quarrel.

     I An interruption:
     1 %<vicchedaþ>%;
     2 %<chedaþ>%.
     II An opening made by fracture: %<bhaïgaþ>%. III. B. of day: v. Dawn.

     I One who breaks: %<bha¤jakaþ>%: v. To break for the different senses.
     II A wave breaking upon a sand-bank, etc.: %<bhaïgaþ>% or %<bhaïgiþ>%.

#<BREATH>#:
     I Lit.:
     1 %<÷vàsaþ>%, to take b. %<÷vasiti>%;

#<BRING>#:
     I To fekS or cause to come:
     1 %<ànayati>% (%<nã>%, c. l.), b. my darling here %<dayitamihànaya>%, Ki. x. 47.;

     II To cause the obtaining of:
     1 by verbs of motion or verbs signifying to obtain and the ins. or abl. of the cause: poverty b. s shame %<dàridryàddhriyameti>%, Mr. i.; disgrace b. s despondency %<paribhavànnirvedamàpadyate>%, Mr. i.;

     2 %<caturaþ>% (%<rà raü>%) (=clever, sharp): v. Lively.

Ph. his life was nothing else b. a tissue of atrocious deeds %<*bãbhatsakarmasantatireva tasya jãvitamàsãt>%; b. for the king, which of your younger brothers would forgive %<ràjà nacenniùeddhà syàt kaþ kùameta tavànujaþ>%, Ve. i.; all b. finished %<sampårõapràyaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%), in the last page b. one, %<*upàntyapçùñhàyàm>%; b. by going to London, %<*laõóanamagatvà>%.

     1 %<tu>% (never at the beginning of a clause), deep anxiety grinds my heart, b. it does not burst into two parts %<dalati hçdayaü gàóhodvego dvidhà na tu bhidyate>%, U. iii.;
     2 %<tu>% is often ommitted, by sweet, b. false words %<madhuràbhirançtavàgbhiþ>%, Sa. v.; of what avail is (a servant) loyal, b. unwise and timid %<apràj¤ena ca kàtareõa ca guõaþ syàt sànuràgeõa kaþ>%, Mu. i.; internal heat is burning my body, b. does not reduce it to ashes %<jvalayati tanumantardàhaþ karoti na bhasmasàt>%, U. iii.;
     3 %<kintu>% or %<parantu>% (at the beginning) your union is easy. B. the report is, she said... %<samàgamo vàmayatnasàdhyaþ kintu sà kila samagirat..>%. D. ii.;
     4 %<punaþ>%, it is like it, b. not the same %<sadç÷a eùaþ | na punaþ saþ>%, Mr. Ph. (a) b. also:
     1 %<api>% (indecl.): not only he who speaks ill of the great, b. also he who hears is a participator of the sin %<na kevalaü yo mahato'pabhàùate ÷çõoti tasmàdapiyaþ sapàpabhàk>%, Ku. v. 83.;
     2 %<apitu>% (rare), U. ii.;
     3 %<kintu>% (rare), not only to bring, b. also to bend (the bow) %<na kevalamànayanàya kintvànamanàya>%, Pr.;
     4 b. yet %<tathàpi>%, surely this is so, b. yet seeing the action of some foolish men %<vàóhamevaü tathàpi pravçttànyupalabhya keùà¤cinmandamatãnàm>%, S. IV. #<BY># (prep.):
     I Of place: (a) = near: q. v.: esp. by comp. with %<upa>%, b. the Ganges %<upagaïgam>%: Ph. b. the side of (her) father %<pituþ pàr÷ve>% Ku.; (b)=past:
     1 %<atãtya>%;
     2 %<atikramyaþ>% Ph. flows b. the city of Oude %<vahatyayodhyàmanu ràjadhànãm>%, R.; b. this road %<anena màrgeõa>%; (c) =on: by the ins.: b. land and water %<sthalena jalena ca>%.
     II Of time: (a) not later than: Ph.: b. this time, the day was complete %<anena samayena pariüõato divasaþ>%, K.; by the 1st of Vaisàkha %<vai÷àkhasya prathamadivasàt pårvam>% (?); (b) of succession: Ph. day b. day %<anudinam>%; month b. month %<màse màse>%.
     III Of other relations: (a) of an agent after pass. verb: by the ins.: should be forgiven b. you %<bhavatà marùa yitavyaþ>%, Sa. iv.; Bali was asked land by Vamana %<vàmanena valiryayàce vasudhàm>%, S. k.; (b) Of the instrument: by the ins.: b. fans made of lotus-leaves %<nalinãdalatàlavçntaiþ>%, Sa. iii.; b. king's command %<ràjàj¤ayà>%; b. force %<prasahya>%; (c) Of the cause, means, made, etc.: gen. by the ins., sometimes by part. s: b. reading Shàstras %<÷àstràõyadhãtya>%; b. hook or b. crook %<yena kena prakàreõa>%; b. name Sutikshna, of peaceful character %<nàmnà sutãkùõa÷caritena dàntaþ>%, R. xiii. 41.; b. heart %<kaõñhasthaþ>% (%<sthà sthaü>%), Bo.; b. nature %<prakçtyà>% or %<svabhàvataþ>%; b. stealth %<caurikayà>%; to sell b. weight %<tolayitvà vikrãõãte>% (?); to sell b. the yard %<gajasaükhyayà vikrãõãte>% (?); b. one's self %<ekakaþ>% (%<kà kaü>%): v. Solitary; b. degrees %<krama÷aþ>%; b. thousands %<sahasra÷aþ>%; b. crowds %<saïgha÷aþ>%; one b. one %<ekaika÷aþ>%; man b. man %<pratipuruùam>%: v. God %<ã÷varaü sàkùãkçtya>%; I swear b. my sacerdotal thread %<÷apàmi brahmasåtreõa>%, Ra. ii.

(a) Do not use 2 and 3 in the pass.; (b) could can also be idiomatically expressed by %<vidhiliï>%: I. c. deprive even øiva of his fortitude %<kuryàü harasyàpi pinàkapàõerdhairyacyutim>%, Ku. iii. 10.; (c) cannot be --is best expressed by part. adj. s- %<tavya anãya>% and %<ya>%; what cannot be accomplished or cured %<asàdhyaþ>% (%<dhyà dhyaü>%); what cannot be measured %<aparimeyaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%); (d) cannot but- is expressed by %<ava÷yaü>% or circumlo.: I cannot but remark %<mayàva÷yaü vaktavyam>%; I cannot but weep %<rodanaü nivàrayituü na ÷aknomi>%.

#<CERTAINLY>#:
     I Assuredly:
     1 %<ava÷yam>% (without failure), what would c. take place %<ava÷yambhàvin>% (f. %<nã>%). H;
     2 %<dhruvam>% (=unalterably), would c. have victory %<dhruvaü jayàþ>% (%<bhavanti>%) (with gen.), Ka. xv. 12,
     3 %<nånam>% (=surely), c. he is not as his dress (i. e. as he looks) %<nånaü tathà naiùa yathàsya veùaþ>%, Ki.;
     4 %<asaü÷ayam>%: v. Undoubtedly;
     5 %<niyatam>% (fixedly); would c. give permission %<niyatamanuj¤àsyati>%, D.;
     6 %<ni÷citam>%, N. com.
     II In replies, to denote emphatic assent: expr. by repetition: is this your resolution? c. %<eùa te ni÷cayaþ? bàóham eùa me sthiro ni÷cayaþ>%, Mu. i.

     2 %<aparàjità>% (a plant used as a c.), Sa.;

     1 by the adj.: v. C.ing;
     2 %<manoharatvam>% etc., collecting the scattered c. s %<bahudhàgatàü kamanãyatàü samabhihçtya>%, Ki. Ph.: c. of beauty: %<råpalàvaõyam; råpasampad>% (f.), K.

     VI Dense, compact: q. v.: %<ghanaþ>% (%<nà naü>%).
     VII Adjoining, near: q. v.: %<sannihitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%), are always c. at hand: %<haste nityasànnidhyàni>%, D.
     VIII Of style: v. Concise.
     IX Intimate:
     1 %<ghanaþ>% (%<nà naü>%);
     2 %<nivióaþ>% (%<óà óaü>%), very c. friendship: %<nivióatamà maitrã>%, Bha.
     X Accurate, careful: q. v.

#<CLOSE># (adv.):
     I Densely: q. v.
     II Near: q. v.:
     1 %<upànte>%;
     2 %<samãpataþ>%.

#<CLOSE># (subs.):
     I An enclosure: q. v.: %<vçtiþ>%.
     II End, termination: q. v.: %<avasànam>%, c. of the day: %<divàvasànam>%, R.
     III Junction: q. v.

#<CLOSE-FISTED, CLOSE-HANDED>#: %<baddhamuùñi>% (mfn.), your c. ness in giving me a look: %<dçùñidàne tava baddhamuùñità>%, N.

#<CLOSELY>#: v. Densely; nearly; strictly; accurately; firmly; secretly.

#<CLOSENESS>#:
     I Compact: q. v.: %<ghanatà>%.
     II Nearness: q. v.: %<naikañyam>%.
     III Niggardliness: q. v.

     VIII Secrecy: q. v.

     2 %<ghanãbhavati>%. C. ted hair: %<jañà -jåñaþ>%.

#<CLOTH>#:
     I Lit.:
     1 %<vastram>%, coarse c. %<sthålavastram>%, P. ii. 5.; fine c.: %<såkùmavastram>%, N. com.;
     2 %<pañaþ>% or %<paññaþ>%, making of different kinds of c.: %<anekavidhapañaracanà>%, P. ii. 5.: v. Also clothes.
     II A profession: q. v.

#<CLOTHE># (v.):
     I To put on c. s: c. ing herself: %<gçhãtavastrà>%, Ku.; c. ing himself: %<paridhàya vàsasã>%, K.: v. To put on clothes.
     II To invest with raiment: %<vastraü>% etc. %<paridhàpayati>% (c. of %<dhà>%) or %<vàsayati>% (c. of %<vas>%).
     III To provide with c. s: but should feed and c. her: %<gràsàcchàdanantu deyameva>%, K. b.
     IV To cover or invest: q. v.

#<CLOTHES, CLOTHING>#:
     1 %<vasanam>%, when (her) c. were being drawn off: %<àkçùyamàõe vasane>%, Mah.;
     2 %<vastram>%, taking off c.: %<vastràõi mocayitvà>%, P.;
     3 %<vàsas>% (n.), Basantasenà's c. are wet: %<klinne vàsasã vasantasenàyàþ>%, Mr.;
     4 %<aü÷ukam>%;
     5 %<ambaram>% (rare);
     6 %<paricchadaþ>%, pretty c. %<kamanãyaparicchadaþ>%, Ki.;
     7 %<paridhànam>% (=under-c.), by whom even her c. was taken away: %<yenàsyàþ paridhànamapyapahçtam>%, Ve. N.B. The first five words gen. = a single piece of cloth and their dual is often used to denote a suit of c. as the Hindu's dress consisted only of two pieces of garment: v. Dress.

#<COLD># (adj.):
     I Lit:
     1 %<÷ãtaþ>% (%<tà taü>%), c. weather: %<÷ãtakàlaþ>%, Ri. vi. 7.;
     2 %<÷ãtalaþ>% (%<là laü>%) (gen. = cool), c. nights: %<÷ãtalà ràtrayaþ>%, Ri. V. 4.;
     3 %<÷i÷iraþ>% (%<rà raü>%), c. as ice: %<tuùàra÷i÷iraþ>% (%<rà raü>%) K.;
     4 %<himaþ>% (%<mà maü>%) (rare);
     5 %<tuùàraþ>% (%<rà raü>%) (rare);
     6 %<niruùõaþ>% (%<ùõà ùõaü>%), %<agharmaþ>% (%<rmà. rmaü>%) etc. (poet). C. season:
     1 %<hemanta>% (mn.) (from about the middle of November to about the m. of January);
     2 %<÷i÷ira>% (mn.) (from a. the m. of J. to a. the m. of March). Ph. I am c. %<÷ãtaü me>%, P. iii. 7.
     III Fig.: indifferent, reserved: q. v.

     2 %<àde÷a>%: or %<nide÷aþ>%, receiving their master's c.: %<bharturàde÷aü samavàpya>%, Ki. vi. 43,;

#<CONCURRENT>#:

     II Equal: q. v.: %<samànaþ>% (%<nà naü>%).

#<CONCURRENTLY>#:
     1 %<samameva>%, Ku. iv. 22.;
     2 %<sahaiva>%, Ki. xiv. 56.

#<CONCUSSION>#: %<saükùomaþ>%: v. Agitation, shock.

     1 %<daõóàrhaþ>% (%<rhà rhaü>%) (=deserving of punishment);

     II To enchant: %<mohayati>% (c. of %<muh>%), c. ing the king af Màlava by my c. ing art: %<indrajàlavidyayà màlavendra mohayan>%, D. C. up: %<utthàpayati>% (c. of %<sthà>%).

     1 %<àlàpaþ saülàpaþ>%, our c. was in one verse: %<àvayoràsãdekayàryayà saülàpaþ>%, D. vi.;
     2 %<sambhàùà sambhàùaõam>%, to hold c. with women: %<strãbhiþ saha sambhàùaõaü karoti; strãbhiþ sambhàùàü samàcarati>%, M. viii. 360-1.;
     3 %<saïkathà>%, we had some c. about news of the country %<saïkathà ca de÷avàrtànuviddhà kàcanàvayorabhåt>%, D. v.;
     4 %<saüvàdaþ>% (rare), Mah;
     5 %<kathopakathanam>% or %<kathànukathanam>%, N. IV. Sexual intercourse: %<saïgamaþ>%.

     II To vitiate:

     2 %<nà÷ayati>% (c. of %<na÷>%) (=to destroy), great addiction to sensual pleasures c. s men: %<nà÷ayati puruùamatyàsaïgo viùayeùu>%, K.;

     4 %<vikaroti>% (%<kç>%, c. 8.), whose minds are not c. ed in presence of c. ing agencies: %<vikàrahetau sati vikriyante yepàüna cetàüsi>%, Ku.

#<CUT># (subs.):
     I A wound:

#<CUT># (v. t.):
     I Lit.:
     1 %<chinatti>% (%<chid>%, c. 5.) (best equiv.), to c. the øami tree: %<÷amãlatàü chettum>%, Sa.; to c. nails: %<nakhàni chinatti>%, M. iv. 69.; c. ing the heart: %<bharmacchid>% (mfn.), Ki. xi. 49.;
     2 %<lunàti>% (%<lå>%, c. 9.), with hair c.: %<lånake÷aþ>%, K. b.; c. ting of corn: %<vrãhilavanam>%, S. c.;
     3 %<kçntati>% (%<kçt>%, c. 6.) %<ni->%, to cut one's own throat: %<svasya kaõñhaü nikçntati>%, Mah.;
     4 %<vç÷cati>% (%<vra÷ca>%, c. l.) (rare), c. one another: %<parasparaü vavra÷cuþ>%, B.;
     5 %<dyati>% (%<do>%, c. 4.) (rare). Ph.: the dart was c. into three pieces: %<tridhà kçtà ÷aktiþ>%, Ve. iv.
     II To carve: q. v.
     III To intersect: q. v.
     IV To castrate: q. v. Ph.:
     1 to c. cards: %<*tàsaü kçntati>%;
     2 to c. a figure: %<pratiùñhàü pràpnoti>%;

     6 c. -glass: %<*saüskçtakàcaþ>%.

#<DARKNESS>#:
     I Physical or moral:
     1 %<andhakàra>% (mn.), d. came on the plain: %<andhakàramudavàpa samàni>%, Ki. ix. 11.;
     2 %<tamas>% (n.), d. -dispelling: %<tamopahaþ>% (%<hà haü>%), D.;

     6 Ph.: %<dhvàntam>%: to enter the land of d.: %<dãrghataraü tamaþ pravi÷ati>%, Ki. xiii. 30.
     II Secrecy: q. v.

#<DAY>#:
     1 %<dinam>%
     2 %<divasa>% (mn);
     3 %<vàsaram>%;
     4 %<ahan>% (n.). A d. of the week: %<vàraþ>%. A lunar d.: %<tithiþ>%. D. to d. %<dine dine>%: v. Daily (adv). D. and night (adv.):
     1 %<aharni÷am>%;
     2 %<divàni÷am>%;
     3 %<divaràtram>%;
     4 %<ràtrindivam>%. A whole d. i. e. a d. and night: %<ahoràtraþ>%. The d. before: %<pårvedyuþ>%. The next d.: %<paredyaþ>%. Another d.: %<anyedyuþ>%. Both d. s: %<ubhayedyuþ>%. By d.: %<divà>%. Late in the d.: %<vaikàle>%. Even to this d.: %<adyàpi>%. Every other d.: %<dvitãye dvitãye divase>%. A d. 's hire: %<dainikã>%. In his d.: %<tatkàle>%: v. Time. The last of a Hindu month: %<saükràntiþ>%. Gained the d.: %<vijayaü lebhe>% (%<labh>%, c. l): v. Victory.

@<[Page 199]>@

#<DILUTE>#:
     I To thin, weaken, or dissolve: q. v.
     II To mix with water: %<jalena mi÷rayati>% (%<mi÷ra>%, c. 10.) or %<saüsçjati>% (%<sçj>%, c. 6.), M.

#<DILUTION>#:
     I Attenuation, dissolution: q. v.
     II With water: %<jalena mi÷raõam>%.
     III A mixture: %<tanåkçtaþ>% (%<tà taü>%) (?).

#<DILUVIAL>#: %<nadyotsçùñaþ>% (%<ùñà ùñaü>%), Vri.; strictly %<àplàvajaþ>% (%<jà jaü>%).

#<DIM># (adj.):
     I Obscure:
     1 %<malinaprabhaþ>% (%<bhà bhaü>%);
     2 %<mandakàntaþ>% (%<ntà ntaü>%);
     3 %<mandadyuti>% (mfn.).
     II Of sight: Ph.: his eyes are d.: %<na sa sutaràü pa÷yati>% or %<aspaùñaü pa÷yati>%.
     III Dull: %<sthålaþ>% (%<là laü>%).

#<DIM># (v.): %<timirayati>% (nomi.).

#<DIVINE># (adj.):
     1 %<divyaþ>% (%<vyà vyaü>%) (best equiv.), d. hide: %<divyamajinam>%, S. p.; d. bed: %<÷ayanaü divyam>%, Mah.;

     3 by comp, d. intellect: %<devadhãþ>%, B.;
     4 %<amànuùaþ>% (%<ùã ùaü>%) (= not human); %<apàrthivaþ>% (%<vã vaü>%) (not earthly), R.

#<DIVINE># (subs.): %<vedavid>% (mfn.): v. Theologian.

#<DIVINE># (v.):
     I To foresee: q. v.: %<pa÷yati>% (%<dç÷>%, c. 1.) (= to see) or %<jànàti>% (%<j¤à>%, c. 7.) (= to know) (the context determining the exact sense).
     II To guess: %<åhate>% (%<uhå>%, c. 1.).
     III To practise divination: %<anàgataü>% or %<bhaviùyantaü vakti>% (%<vac>%, c. 1.) or %<vadati>% (%<vad>%, c. 1.): v. Also augury.

#<DIVINELY>#:
     I Lit.: %<devavat>%: v. Extremely.
     II Providentially: %<ã÷varecchayà niyatyà>%.

     1 %<daivaj¤aþ>% (= astrologer);

     III Theology: %<vedaþ>%.

#<DO># (v. t.):
     I To effect:
     1 %<karoti kurute>% (%<kç>%, c. 8.) (the best equiv.), command us what shall we d.: %<÷àdhi naþ karavàma kim>%, Ku. vi. 24.; what is to be done to Sthàvaraka: %<sthàvarakasya kiü kriyatàm>%, Mr. x.; not knowing what to d.: %<kiükartavyavimåóhaþ>% (%<óhà óhaü>%), K.; to d. penance: %<tapàüsi karoti>%, Ki.;
     2 %<vi-dadhàti>% or %<dhatte>% (%<dhà>%, c. 3.), what is to be done with this wealth: %<kiü vidheyamanayàrthasampadà>%, Si.; does both good and bad to animals: %<÷ubha¤ca vidadhatya÷ubha¤ca jantoþ>%, Ma. i.;
     3 %<anutiùñhati>% (%<sthà>%, c. 1.) (= to perform), this was done by fate: %<daivenedamanuùñhitam>%, Mu. iii.;
     4 %<niùpàdayati>% (= to accomplish: q. v.).
     II When standing for another verb, expr. by it or circumlo.: 'I have much to ask about it.' 'Do so calmly,': %<'bahu praùñavyamatra' | 'vi÷rabdhaü pçccha'>% Nu. iii.; address me as you have been accustomed to d.: %<yathàmyastamabhidhãyatàm>%, U. i.; 'listen and feel sure of', 'I will do both'.: %<'÷råyatàmavadhàryatà¤ca' | 'ubhayamapi kriyate'>%, Mu. (in this last ex. %<kriyate>% does not stand for the principal verbs, but %<ubhayaü>% means %<÷ravaõaü>% and %<avadhàraõam>%).
     III As simple auxiliary verb, not expressed: sir, d. assist me in trouble: %<kliùñasya me kriyatàmarthasàhàyyakam>%, D. viii. N. B. (a) When emphatic, expr. by words given under truly, surly, indeed. (b) In interrogative sentences, expr. by %<api kaccit>%, etc., do you set to penances according to your capability: %<api sva÷attayà tapasi pravartase>%, Ku.
     IV To be done: as of meat, etc. %<sidhyati>% (%<sidh>%, c. 4.) Bha.
     V To deceive: q. v.

     I To clothe: q. v.:
     1 %<veùayati>% (c. of %<viù>%) (= to d. another), d. ing Sàmba with female d.: %<sàmbaü strãveùairveùayitvà>%, B. p.;

     3 %<veùaü vibharti>% (%<bhç>%, c. 3.), (= to d. one's self), R. Ph.: d. ed as Vàsavadattà: %<vàsavadattàve÷adhàriõã>%, Ra. iii.

     3 %<saüskaroti>% (%<kç>%, c. 8.).
     III Of food, etc.; %<saüskaroti>%, I also know how to d. food: %<annasaüskàramapi jànàmi>%, Mah.

     2 %<måóha>% (%<óhà óhaü>%) (= stupid).
     II Of colours, etc.:

     2 %<malinaþ>% (%<nà naü>%) (= dark).
     III Blunt: q. v.: %<nistejas>% (mfn.).
     IV Sad, melancholy: q. v.: %<viùaõõa>% (f. %<õõà>%).
     V Flat, insipid: q. v.: %<arasaþ>% (%<sà saü>%).

#<END># (subs.):
     I Extreme point: %<antaþ>%, (rarely %<paryantaþ pràntaþ upàntaþ>%) at the e. of the journey: %<adhvano'nte>%, R. xvi. 35.; e. of a martle: %<aü÷ukàntaþ>%, J.
     II Termination:
     1 %<antaþ>% or %<paryantaþ>%, at the e. of the year: %<saüvatsarànte>%, Mat.; distressing in the e.: %<paryantaparitàpin>% (f. %<nã>%), Ki.;
     2 %<avasànam>%, at the e. of the day: %<dinàvasàne>%, Sa.;
     3 %<pariõàmaþ>% or %<pariõatiþ>%, pleasing in the e.: %<pariõàmasukhaþ>% (%<khà khaü>%), Ki.
     III Conclusion:

#<EQUAL># (adj.):
     I A like:
     1 %<samaþ>% (%<mà maü>%), I do not see any one greater than or e. to Ràma: %<pa÷yàmi ràmàdadhikaü samaü và nànyam>%, B.; e. share: %<samabhàgaþ>%, Da.;
     2 %<samànaþ>% (%<nà naü>%), e. in caste and number: %<samànà jàtisaükhyayà>%, Da.; to (men) of e. valour, lineage, and manliness: %<samànavãryànvayapauruùeùu>%, Ki.;
     3 %<tulyaþ>% (%<lyà lyaü>%) (= makSing, like), of e. strength: %<tulya÷kti>% (mfn.), M. n.;
     4 %<sadç÷aþ>% (%<÷ã ÷aü>%) (= %<tulya>%), with those, who are not his e. s: %<anàtmasadç÷eùu>%, Mu.
     II Adequate:

     1 %<prakçùyate>% or %<ut->% (pass. of %<kçù>%) (= to be drawn up) (with abl.), no body e.s Vishvàmitra in greatness: %<na khalu vi÷vàmitrànmahatvena ka÷cidaparaþ prakçùyate>%, Vi. i.;
     2 %<ativartate>% (%<vçt>%, c. 1.) (= to be beyond), what is eulogy to you whose dignity e.s the range of eulogy: %<kà te stutiþ stutipathàdativçttadhàmnaþ>%, Vi.;
     3 %<ati÷ete>% (%<÷ã>%, c. 2.) (= to lie beyond), in this your Excellency e. s your ancestors: %<pårvàn mahàbhàgatayàti÷eùe>%, R. v. 14;
     4 %<atiricyate>% (pass. of %<ric>%) (to be more) (with abl.); truth e. s even thousand horsesacrifices: %<a÷vamedhasahasràddhi satyamevàtiricyate>%, H. iv.;
     5 %<adharayati>% (nomi.) (= put down: q. v.), e. ling the sages in his pure acts: %<caritairmunãnadharayan ÷ucibhiþ>%, Ki. vi. 24.;
     6 %<tiraskaroti>% (= to eclipse: q. v.), M. n;
     7 %<abhibhavati>% (%<bhå>%, c. 1.) (= to humble: q. v.), e. ling the fragrance of other flowers: %<abhibhåtànyakusumaparimalam>%, K.;
     8 %<jayati>% (%<ji>%, c. 1.) (= to conquer: q. v.), Si. i. 19.;

#<EXCELLENCE>#:
     I Superiority:
     1 %<utkarùaþ>% or %<prakarùaþ>%;

#<EXIST>#:
     I To be: q. v.: %<asti>% (%<as>%, c. 2.), everybody would believe that he does not e.: %<sarvo loko nàyamastãti pratãyàt>%, S.;
     2 %<vartate>% (%<vçt>%, c. 1.), H.

#<FACTIOUS>#:
     I Given to faction:
     1 %<kalahapriyaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%) (= quarrelsome),
     2 %<upajàpin>% (f. %<nã>%) (=intriguing).
     II Belonging to a f.: expr. by comp. or gen.

#<FACTIOUSNESS>#:
     1 %<kalahapriyatà>%;
     2 %<upajàpità>%.

#<FACTITIOUS>#: %<kçtrimaþ>% (%<mà maü>%): v. Artificial, unnatural.

#<FACTITIVE>#: Ph.: f. object: %<gauõaü karman>% (n.).

#<FACTOR>#:
     I A manager, agent: q.v.
     II In arith: expr. by circumlo: two is a f. of ten: %<da÷a dvàbhyàü bhàjyaþ>%.

#<FACTORAGE>#: %<pàritoùikam>% (= reward): v. Also commission.

#<FACTORY>#: %<*karmasthànam>%.

#<FACULTY>#:
     I Power: q.v.: %<÷aktiþ>%.
     II Authority: %<kùamatà>%.
     III A body of men: %<samàjaþ>%, f. of medicine: %<*cikitsàsamàjaþ>%.

     I To decay, droop: q.v.: %<avasãdati>% (%<sad>%, c. 1.).

     2 %<malinãbhavati>%, the f. ing garland: %<màlàü malinãbhavantãm>%, N.

#<FALL># (v.i.):
     I In gen.:
     1 %<patati ni->%, (rarely %<pra- pari- vini- à- saü->%,) (%<pat>%, c. l.,) Putanà fell on the ground: %<papàta påtanà bhåmau>%, v. p.; with the dress fell into the water: %<savàsàþ pràpatajjale>%, Mah.; to fall on the knees: %<jànubhyàü>% (ins.) %<patati>%, Mah.; the glittering scimitar fell from his hand: %<jvalannasistasya papàta pàõeþ>%; Ki. xvii. 58.; rivers f. ing into the ocean: %<abhburà÷iü patantãrnadãþ>%, Si. iii. 75. (This use of %<pat>% is rare. Gen. expr. by %<pravi÷ati>%, M. n. or %<upaiti>%, Mah. or %<prayàti>%, Ri., etc.); flower-rain fell from the sky: %<viyataþ puùpavarùaü papàta>%, Vi.: v. Rain; we suddenly fell on Vindhyaketu: %<atarkità eva vindhyaketorupari nipatitàþ sma>%, Pri.: v. To assail, some rise and f.: %<ko'pyutthitaþ patati>%, Mr.: v. To decline, the refuge of the f. en: %<patita÷araõyà>%, J.; something else has f. en there: %<anyat kimapyarthàntaraü tatra patitam>%, Ana. iv. v.: To happen; this kingdom had f. en into the hands of Vasantabhànu: %<vasantabhànorhaste ràjyamidaü patitam>%, D.;
     2 %<bhra÷yati -te>% or %<bhraü÷ate pari->%, (%<bhraü÷>%, c. 4. and 1.) (gen. in fig. senses), f. en on the ground: %<urvyàü bhraùñaþ>% (%<ùñà ùñaü>%), R.; did not f. from truth: %<satyànnàbhra÷yata>%, R.;
     3 %<cyavate vi- pra- pari->%, (%<cyu>%, c. 1.) (gen. fig.), has f. en from the top of the tree: %<taru÷ikharàdasmàtparicyutaþ>%, K.; f. en from the path: %<patha÷cyutaþ>% (%<tà taü>%), Ki.
     II To cease: q.v.: %<÷àmyati>% (%<÷am>%, c. 4.), when the wind fell: %<vàte ÷amatàü gate>%, Mah.
     III To decrease: q.v.: %<hnàsamupaiti>% (%<i>%, c. 2.). Ph.: to f. asleep: v. Asleep; to fall calm, i.e. to become calm.: v. Calm; to f. foul: v. To attack; to f. short: %<nyånãbhavatiþ>% v. Deficient.

#<FALSE># (subs.):
     I Not true, not real:
     1 %<mithyà>%. in comp., f. reply: %<mithyottaram>%; to speak f.: %<mithyà vadati>%, M.;
     2 %<alãkaþ>% (%<kà kaü>%), f. prowess %<alãkavikramaþ>%, Pr. i.; f. Nala: %<alãkanalaþ>%, N.;

#<FAULT>#:
     1 %<doùaþ>%, this is not your f.: %<na te doùo'yam>%, P. i. 16.; will not find f. with it: %<doùaü na grahãùyati>%, Sa.; these are f.s of language: %<vàkye'pi doùàþ santyete>%, Kav.;
     2 %<aparàdhaþ>% (not physical), how can a slave be without f.: %<kathaü nu dàso niraparàdhaþ>%, V. ii.; it is not the f. of a stump if a blind man does not see it: %<naiùa sthàõoraparàdho yadenamandho na pa÷yati>%, Say. To find f. with: %<dåùayati>% (c. of %<duù>%), bad men in a moment find f. with the excellencies of good men: %<durjano dåùayatyeva satàü guõagaõaü kùaõàt>%, J.

#<FAULT-FINDER>#: %<doùadç÷>% (mfn.), a mere f.: %<doùaikadç÷>% (mfn.)

     1 %<sadoùam>%;
     2 %<sàdhaparàdhama>%;

     3 %<adoùaþ>% (%<ùà ùaü>%): v. Also blameless, innocent, correct.

     2 %<doùa÷ånyatà>%; etc.

#<FEMALE># (adj.): Not male:
     1 by a feminine termination %<à>% or %<ã>%: f. preceptor: %<upàdhyàyà>%; a f. monkey: %<vànarã>%; a f. dove: %<kapotikà>%;
     2 by %<vadhå>% affixed (denoting the f. of a couple), the f. Chakra: %<cakravàkavadhåþ>%, M.n.
     II Belonging to a woman: expr. by comp.: f. form: %<strãråpam>%.

#<FEMININE>#:
     I As opposed to manly: %<straiõa>% (f. %<õã>%), hesitates from f. (consideration): %<straiõena vicikitsati>%, Vi. i. 37.: v. Also effeminate.
     II In gram.: %<strã>%, f. gender: %<strãliïgam>% (the word); %<iùudhi>% is also f.: %<iùudhiþ strã ca>%, S.k.; the five words %<ap>% etc. are f. and (used in the) plural: %<abàdãnàü pa¤cànàü srãtvaü bahutvaü ca>%, S.k.

#<FEN>#:
     1 %<anåpaþ>%;
     2 %<kacchabhåþ>%: v. Marsh.

     I Lit.: v. To form.
     II To depict: q.v.: %<råpayati>% (%<råp>%, c. 10.).
     III To calculate: q.v.: %<gaõayati>% (%<gaõ>%, c. 10.).
     IV To indicate: q.v.: %<såcayati>% (%<såc>%, c. 10.).
     V To image: %<kalpayati>% (%<këp>%, c. 10.). F.d.: i.e. adorned with f. s: %<citraþ>% (%<trà traü>%). F. out: %<gaõayati>%. F. up: %<saükalayati>% (%<kal>%, c. 10.): v. To add.

     1 %<prathamaþ>% (%<mà maü>%) (of time, place, or rank), on the f. day. of Ashàóha: %<àùaóhasya prathamadivase>%, Me. i. 1.; in the f. court: %<prathame prakoùñhe>%, Mr. iv.; f. of those, who share in sacrifices: %<makhàü÷abhàjàü prathamaþ>%, R. iii. 44.: v. Also chief;

     1 %<tatprathamam>%, Si xv. 42.;

     1 %<màüsam>%, abstaining from f. and wine: %<nivçttaþ màüsamadyayoþ>%, Pa.; horse -f. is sweet (and) light: %<a÷vamàüsaü madhuraü ladhuraü laghu>%, Bha.;
     2 %<àmiùam>%, the f. of buffalo is sweet: %<mahiùasyàmiùaü svàdu>%, Mah.;
     3 %<pi÷itam>% (rare), f.-eater: %<pi÷ità÷in>% (f. %<nã>%), R.
     II Body: q.v.: %<màüsam>%.
     III Mankind: q.v.
     IV Kindness: q.v.: perh. %<màüsam>%. v. Carnality: %<kàmaþ>%.

     VII Of fruit: %<vãjam>%.

     1 by abl., f. want of combustibles: %<dàhyàbhàvàt>%, Mu. i. 11.; tied for hundred (rupees): %<÷atàdbaddhaþ>%, S.k.;

     1 by dat., f. appeasing the fears of the distressed: %<àrtabhayopa÷àntaye>%, R. viii. 31.;

#<FORTIFICATION>#:
     I The works:
     1 %<guptiþ>% (= defences), the f.s are most inaccessible: %<alaïghyatamà guptiþ>%, D.;
     2 %<durgam>% (= fort), f. s naturally strong: %<prakçtyà viùamaü durgam>%, Mah.;
     3 %<pràkàraparikhàdi>% (n.).
     II The operation: %<guptiþ; durgakarman>% (n.), Mah. s. 86. 3.

     2 by circumlo.: %<"purã samantàdvihità sapatàkà satoraõà | sacakrà sahuóà caiva sayantrakhanakà tathà ||.......saükramà bheditàþ sarve nàva÷ca pratiùedhitàþ | parikhà÷càpi kaukhya kãlaiþ sunicitàþ kçtàþ || udapànàþ kuru÷reùñha tathaivàpyambarãùakàþ | samantàt ko÷amàtra¤ca kàrità viùamà ca bhåþ ||">%, Mah. iii. 156.

     I At liberty:
     1 %<svàdhãnaþ>% (%<nà naü>%), he is f.: %<svàdhãno'yam>%, K., "f. town": %<*svàdhãnanagaram>%;
     2 %<svatantra>% (f. %<ntrà>%), who being f. sells himself: %<vikrãõãte svatantraþ sannàtmànaü yaþ>%, N.s.; "f. country". %<svatantraràjyam>%. Ph.: according to one's f. will: %<svecchayà>%; she should be made f.: %<sàdàsã kartavyà>%, Kat.: v. Slave; f. agency, %<svacchandatà>%.
     II Liberated: %<muktaþ>% (%<ktà ktaü>%), %<vi- nir-; mokùitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%), %<vi->%.
     III Unrestrained: %<niryantraõa>% (f. %<õà>%); %<ayantritaþ>% (%<tà taü>%).
     IV %<muktahastaþ>% (%<stà staü>%).
     V Not obstructed, open: %<muktaþ>% (%<ktà ktaü>%).
     VI Gratuitous: expr. by %<vinà mulyena>%.
     VII Unreserved: %<asaüvçtaþ>% (%<tà taü>%).

#<FREE FROM>#:
     1 by %<nir>% or %<a>% pref., f. f. all care: %<ni÷cintaþ>% (%<ntà ntaü>%), f. f. debt: %<ançõaþ>% (%<õà õaü>%);
     2 %<gataþ vigataþ vãtaþ>%, etc. pref., f. f. desire: %<gataspçhaþ>% (%<hà haü>%), Si.;
     3 %<varjitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%), %<vi->%, f. f. the possession of pride: %<smayàve÷avivarjitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%), R.: v. Also devoid of.

     I To set free:
     1 %<mokùayati vi->%, (%<mokù>%, c. 10.), how to f. a slave: %<kathaü dàsasya mokùaþ>%, Viv.; f. s from danger of life: %<mokùayet pràõasaü÷ayàt>%, M. p.;

#<FROM>#:
     I Of place: (a) by abl. f. its top: %<tasyàgrabhàgàt>%, Sa.; rose f. the seat: %<pãñhàdudattiùñhat>%, Si. i. 12.; (b) sometimes by tat. comp., fallen f. the mouth of a hawk: %<÷yenamukhaparibhraùñaþ>% (%<ùñà ùñaü>%), K.
     II Of distance: by abl.: the village is a rojana f. the forest: %<vanàdgràmo yojanam>%, S. k.; not far f. here: %<ito nàtidåre>%, K.
     III Of time; (a) by abl. and %<prabhçti>% or %<àrabhya>%, f. the time of seeing: %<dar÷anàt prabhçti>%, K.; f. today: %<adyaprabhçti>%, Ki.; (b) by comp. with %<-avadhi>% or %<à>%, f. today: %<adyàvadhi>%; f. birth: %<àjanmanaþ>%, Sa. v.
     IV Of source, origin: (a) by abl., the Ganges rises f. the Himalayas: %<himavato gaïgà prabhavati>%; men are sprung f. God: %<trahmaõaþ prajàþ prajàyante>%, S. k.
     V Denoting cause, occasion, etc.: (a) by abl. not f. exhaustion: %<na khedàt>%, Mu. i.; and f. nonperception of others: %<itareùà¤cànupalabdheþ>%, S.; (b) by ins. in the case of feminine nouns, f. a diesire to see: %<didçkùayà>%, Ki.: f. fragrance: %<surabhitayà>%, K.
     VI Of material: v. Of.
     VII Of persons: expr. by %<sakà÷àt>% and gen., f. Raghu: %<roghoþ sakà÷àt>%, R. v. 24. Miscell: f. day to day. %<dine dine>%, Ku. i. 25.: f. country: to country: %<de÷àt de÷am>% or %<de÷àntaram>%, D. vi.; wandered f. house to house: %<gçhàdgçhaü pravi÷yàbhramat>%, D.; f. the beginning: %<àmålàt>% or %<àditaþ>%, Mu. ii.; f. a boy: %<bàla eva>% or %<bàlyàt prabhçtiþ>%, Vi.; f. behind: %<pçùñhenàgatya>% or %<pa÷càdetya>%,
     V iii.; f. humanity to corporeal beings ending in God: %<manuùyatvàdàrabhya brahmànteùu dehavatsu>%, S.; f. God to columns: %<àbrahmastambhaparyantam>%, S. p. b.; speaking of the difference of happiness f. humanity upwards, speaks of it among the lower (beings): %<manuùyatvàdårdhvagateùu sukhasya tàratamyamuktavà'dhogateùu tadàha>%, S. com.; told (her) all f. the conquest: %<vijayàdàrabhya sarvamàcacakùe>%, K.; f. me (=for me): %<madvacanàt>%, Sa.; the sixth king f.      I To obtain:
     1 %<labhate>% (%<labh>%, c. 1.), man g. s what he is to g.: %<pràptavyamarthaü labhate manuùyaþ>%, P. ii. 4.; to g. sleep: %<nidràü labhate>%, A.r.; dividing (we) g. 72.: %<bhaktà labdham>% 72, Li.; or he might g. three fortnights: %<labhotàsau tripakùaü và>%, Kat.;

     2 %<utpadyate sam->%, (%<pad>%, c. 4.) (same cons.), Ra.
     III To induce: expr. by causal v., to g. food cooked: %<bhaktàni pàcayati>%, Mah.; to g. work done: %<karma kàrayati>%, M.

#<GET># (v.i.):
     I To become: q.v.: to g. angry: %<kopaü gacchati>%; to g. disunited: %<vi÷leùam eti>%, Ki.; to g. red: %<lohitàyate>% (nomi.), to g. cloudy: %<durdinàyate>%; to g. clear: %<sudinàyate>%, S.k.
     II To arrive: q.v.: %<pràpnoti>% (with acc.), got to the town: %<nagaraü pràpuþ>%, K.s.

#<GET ABROAD>#:
     1 %<prasarati>% (%<sç>%, c. 1.), D. iii.;
     2 %<prasarpati>% (%<sçp>%, c. 1.), the rumour got abroad on all sides: %<pratidi÷aü lokavàdaþ pràsarpat>%, D. viii.;
     3 %<bahulãmavati>% (%<bhå>%, c. 1.), Sa. vi.;
     4 %<prathate>% (%<prath>%, c. 1.) (= to be known), the fame of Dhanamitra got abroad: %<dhanamitrasya kãrtiraprathata>%, D. ii.

#<GET ACROSS>#: %<pàraü gacchati>% (to go) or %<nayati>% (to take).

#<GET AHEAD>#: %<agre bhavati>% or %<agrasahãbhavati>% (with gen.): v. Also to advance.

#<GET ALONG>#: v. To proceed. G. a.!: %<antaramantaram>%, Mr.

#<GET AMONG>#: %<madhye bhavati>%, g. ing among them unperceived: %<tatraiva janànulãnaþ>%, D. iv.

#<GET AT>#: %<pràpnoti>% (%<àp>%, c. 5.) (with acc.): v. To reach.

#<GET AWAY>#: %<apasarati>% (%<sç>%, c. 1.): v. To go away, escape.

#<GET BACK>#:
     I Intrans.: %<punaþ pràpnoti>%, Ku.: v. To return.
     II Trans.:
     1 %<punarlaübhate>%, Ki.;
     2 by sim. get: q.v.: he got back youth: %<yauvanaü pratipede saþ>%, Mat.

#<GLARINGLY>#:
     1 %<suspaùñam>%;
     2 %<parisphuñam>%: v. Clearly.

#<GLASS># (subs.):
     I The material:
     1 %<kàcaþ>%;
     2 %<sphañikaþ>% (= crystal).
     II A mirror: q.v.: %<darpaõaþ>%.
     III A g. instrument: perh. %<kàcayantramþ>% v. Telescope, microscope, etc.
     IV A drinking. g.: %<caùaka>% (mn.) (= cup); wine-g.: %<*kàcanirmitaü bhadyapànapàtram>%. V. Glassware: %<*kàcapàtràõi>% (n. pl.).

#<GLASS># (adj.):
     1 by comp.; g.-bottle: %<kàcakåpã>%;
     2 %<sphàñikaþ>% (%<kã kaü>%) (= crystal ?), g.-door: %<sphàñikaü dvàram>%, Mah. ii. 47. 11.

     I In gen.:

     2 %<yàti>% (%<yà>%, c. 2.), and you go to another (man): %<apara¤ca yàsi>%, Mr. iv.; the man will go one month: %<màsamekaü naro yàti>%, H.; moonlight goes (away) with the moon: %<÷a÷inà saha yàti kaumudã>%, Ku.;

Ph.: go in: %<abhyantaraü pravi÷a>%, Mr. i.; he has gone too far: %<atibhåmimayaü gataþ>%, K.; he is going (lit. wishes) to say something: %<kimapyayaü vivakùuþ>%, Ku.; or %<vaktukàmaþ>%, Sa.; (I am) going to ask something: %<ki¤cit praùñumanàþ>%, Ku.; as the story goes: %<kila>% (enclitic); to go for nothing: %<viphalãbhavati>%.

#<GOAT>#:
     1 %<ajaþ>%;
     2 %<chàgaþ>%;
     3 %<chàgalaþ>%. She-g.:
     1 %<ajà>%;
     2 %<chàgã>%. A flock of g.s: %<àjakam>%. G. herd:

#<GRACEFUL>#:
     1 %<làvaõyavat>% (f. %<tã>%) (= pretty);
     2 %<÷obhanaþ>% (%<nà naü>%) (= fine);
     3 %<ramaõãyaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%) (= lovely, pleasant).

#<GRACEFULLY>#:
     1 %<÷obhanam>%: v. Beautifully,;
     2 %<madhuram>%: v. Sweetly.

#<GRACEFULNESS>#:
     1 %<càrutà>%: v. Beauty,
     2 %<màdhuryyam>%: v. Sweetness.

#<GRACELESS>#: %<naùñaþ>% (%<ùñà ùñaü>%): v. Depraved, corrupt.

#<GRACIOUS>#:
     I Merciful: q.v.:
     1 %<prasannaþ>% (%<nnà nnaü>%);
     2 %<dayàmayaþ>% (%<yã yaü>%), To be g.: %<prasãdati>% (%<sad>%, c. 1.).
     II Excellent: q.v.: %<vi÷iùñaþ>% (%<ùñà ùñàü>%).
     III Beautiful: q.v.

     1 %<sànugraham>% (= favourable);
     2 %<sadayam>%: v. Kindly.

     2 %<dayà>%: v. Kindness,
     3 %<audàryam>%: v. Liberality.

#<GREAT>#:
     1 %<mahat>% (f. %<tã>%): in most senses: (a) of size: a g. forest: %<mahàvanam>%, Mu.: v. Large. (b) of quantity: g. collection: %<mahànnicayaþ>%, Ki.; a g. crowd: %<mahàjanasamåhaþ>%, Ku. (c) of weight: g. news: %<mahatã vàrttà>%, H.; for g. result: %<mahate phalàya>%, Ki.: v. Important. (d) eminent, noble: of the g.: %<mahatàm>%, Ki.; g. man: %<mahàjanaþ>%, Mah.; g. -minded: %<mahàtman>% (mfn.), K.: v. Principal, chief. (e) of degree, etc.: a g. while: %<mahàn kàlaþ>%, K.; g. effort: %<mahàn yanñaþ>%, R.; g. sinner: %<mahàpàtakin>%, Vi.; of g. price: %<mahàrha>% (f. %<rhà>%), Ku.; g. interval: %<mahandataram>%. P.;
     2 %<su>% (= good) or %<ati>% (= very) prefixed (to intensify the meaning), to a g. distance: %<suñåram>%, K.; g. many: %<subahu>% (mfn.), K.; to a g. degree: %<atyartham>%, Ki.;
     3 %<adhikaþ>% (%<kà kaü>%) (when there is comparison), the g. animals did not harass the little: %<ånaü na sattveùvadhiko babàdhe>%, R. ii. 14.; g. er devotion: %<adhikà bhaktiþ>%, K.: v. More.

#<GREATEST>#: in degree: %<paramaþ>% (%<mà maü>%): v. Extreme. In the g. degree: %<param>%: v. Extremely.

#<GREATLY>#:
     I Much, exceedingly: q.v.:
     1 %<ati->% or %<su->% in comp.;
     2 %<ati÷ayam>%;
     3 %<bhç÷am>%. Very g.: %<sutaràm nitaràm>%, or %<atitaràm>%, his love was very g. implanted: %<sutaràmàropitaprãtirabhavat>%, K.

#<HE>#:
     I Pron.:
     1 %<tad>% (= that), I am he: %<eùo'smi saþ>%, Mu. vii. 4.; here is he: %<ayaü saþ>%, Sa.; he also: %<so'pi>%, D.;
     2 %<adas>%, which of them is he: %<katamo'sau>%, D.; what he would have done to you: %<tvayyasau yadakariùyat>%, K.

     5 not expr. when the meaning is clear, moreover he is cruel: %<apara¤ca kråraþ>%, P. Ph.: things he is a øudra: %<÷ådro'hamiti manyate>%, G. p.: v. That.

#<HEAD># (subs.):
     I Lit.:
     1 %<÷iras>% (n.), the h. aches: %<÷iro rujati>%, Sr.; with a shake of the h.: %<sa÷iraþkampam>%, Ve.;
     2 %<mårddhan>% (m.), three-h. ed: %<trimårddhan>% (mfn.), Vi.;
     3 %<mastakam>%, I will hash your h.: %<mastakaü te kuññayiùyàmi>%, Mr.;
     4 %<÷ãrùam>%, with the frightful h. s. cut off: %<chinnaiþ ÷ãrùairbhayaïkaraiþ>%, A. r.;
     5 %<muõóam>% (in contempt), shaving the h.: %<muõóaü muõóayitvà>%, Mu.;
     6 %<tuõóam>% (rare), the h. is grey: %<palitaü tuõóam>%, J.
     II Chief, leader: q.v.: %<agraõã>%. Ph.: the h. of the atheists: %<nàstika÷iromaõiþ>%, Da.
     III Of things: %<agram>%. Ph.: at the h. of a battle: %<raõa÷irasi raõamårddhani>%, etc.; h. of a mount: %<girimårddhà>%; h. of a wound: %<vraõamukham>%, Ki.
     IV Source: q.v.
     V A topic of discourse: %<viùayaþ>%.
     VI Intellect: q.v.:

     IV Utmost degree: expr. by adj.: in the h. of fever: %<prabale jvare>%; the h. of wisdom: %<paramaü j¤ànam>%: v. Extreme, acme.

     4 %<vivaram>% (rare), in other's h. s.: %<parasya vivare>%, Ki.
     II A cave, den: q.v.: %<vivaram>%.
     III A hovel: perh. %<vivaram>%.

#<IF>#:
     1 %<yadi>%, if you are not delighted with the tremulous glances.......: %<lolàpàïgairyadi na ramase>%, Me.; if so, I am fortunate: %<yadyevaü daddhanyo'ham>%, P.; or if you again get your place: %<tvayàthavà yadi labdhaü punaràtmanaþ padam>%, Ki.; even if his union was doubtful: %<sandigdho'pyasya samàgamo yadi syàt>%, K.; if (he) had not wagered: %<yadi paõaü nàkariùyat>%, V.; then again if .....: %<punaraparaü yadi>%, K.;
     2 %<cet>% (never at the beginning of a sentence), if not: %<no cet>%, H. v. Otherwise; if on the other hand, you are waiting for time: %<atha cedavadhiþ pratãkùyate>%, Ki.; but if I could not find out some means here: %<api tu na cediha kamapyupàyamudbhàvayituü ÷aknuyàm>%, D. N.B. Note the use of %<vidhiliï>% when the sentence implies that something may or might happen and of %<ëï>% when it implies that something would have happened. %<lañ luñ>% and %<ëñ>% are used when it deals with facts actual or assumed, the first with present and the last two with future facts.

#<IGNEOUS>#:
     1 %<àgne yaþ>% (%<yã yaü>%);
     2 %<vahrimayaþ>% (%<yã yaü>%).

     2 %<ahàryatà>%; etc.

#<IMPRACTICABLE>#:
     I Impossible: %<dçþsàdhya>% (f. %<dhyà>%).
     II Intractable: %<durdamaþ>% (%<mà maü>%).
     III Impassable: %<durgamaþ>% (%<mà maü>%).
     IV Inexorable: %<anivàrya>% (f. %<ryà>%).

#<IMPRECATE>#:
     1 %<stauti>% or %<stavãti>% (%<stu>%, c. 1.) (= to pray);
     2 %<÷apati-te>% (%<÷ap>%, c. 1.) (= to curse: q.v.)

#<IMPRECATION>#: %<abhicàraþ>%, like the sharp i. s of the Atharva (Veda): %<atharvaõastãvra ivàbhicàraþ>%, Vi. i. 62.: v. Also curse.

#<IMPRECATORY>#: %<àbhicàrikaþ>% (%<kã kaü>%), i. action: %<àbhicàrikã kriyà>%, Ki. iii. 56.

#<IMPREGNABLE>#:
     1 %<alaïghya>% (f. %<ïghyà>%), the defences are most i.: %<alaïghyatamà guptiþ>%, D.;
     2 %<ajeyaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%) (= inevitable).

@<[Page 367]>@

#<IMPREGNATE># (v.):
     I To make preganant: %<garbhavatãü karotiþ>% v. Pregant.
     II To fertilize: q.v.
     III To infuse: perh. %<nive÷ayati>% (c. of. %<vi÷>%).

#<IMPREGNATE># (adj.): "i. with disease": %<rogagarbha>% (f. %<rbhà>%) (?).

#<IMPREGNATION>#:
     I Lit.: %<garbhàdhànam>%.
     II Infusion: %<sammi÷raõam>%.

#<IMPRESS># (v.):
     I To press: %<aïkayati>% (%<aïk>%, c. 10.).
     II To implant: q.v.: %<nidadhàti>% (%<dhà>%, c. 3.).
     III To produce an effect on: %<harati>% (%<hç>%, c. l.) (to allure).
     IV To take by force for public service:
     1 %<dharati>% (%<dhç>%, c. 1.) (in Assamese);
     2 %<balàd gçhõàti>% (%<grah>%, c. 9.).

#<IMPRESS># (subs.):
     I Mark: q.v.: %<cihnam>%.
     II Seal: q.v.: %<mudrà>%.

#<IMPRESSIBLE>#: expr. by verb: v. To impress.

#<IMPRESSION>#:
     I Marking: %<aïkanam>%.
     II Mark: q.v.: %<cihnam>%.
     III Mental: Ph.: it made no i. on him. %<tasya hçdayaü na jagràha>% or %<jahàra>% or %<tasya hçdaye sthànaü na lebhe>%.
     IV Idea: %<anumavaþ>%.
     V An edition, copy: %<*anulipiþ>%.

#<IMPRESSIVE>#:
     1 %<hçdayagràhin>% (f. %<õã>%), Ki.;
     2 %<hçdayahàrin>% (f. %<õã>%);
     3 %<hçdayaspç÷>% (mfn.).

#<IMPRESSIVELY>#: expr. by adj. he speaks i.: %<tasya bhàratã hçdayagràhiõã>%.

#<IMPRESSIVENESS>#:
     1 %<hçdayagràhità>%;
     2 %<hçdayahàrità>%.

#<IMPRINT>#: v. Impress.

#<IMPRISON>#: (v.):
     I Lit.: %<kàràyàü niruõaddhi>% (%<rudh>%, c. 7.): v. Jail, to confine.
     II To restrain.

#<IMPRISONAMENT>#:
     1 %<kàràvàsaþ>%;
     2 %<kàràgàraniùevaõam>%, Bha, and sim. comp.s.;
     3 %<nirodhanam>%. (= confinement), M. viii. 310.

#<IMPROBABILITY>#:
     I The quality:
     1 %<asambhavatà>%;
     2 %<asammàvyatà>%.
     II Anything improbable: %<asammavam>%.

#<IMPROBABLE>#:
     1 %<asammavaþ>% (%<và vaü>%), birth of a golden deer is i.: %<asambhavaü hemamçgasya janma>%, H.;
     2 %<asammàvanãyaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%) or %<asambhàvya>% (f. %<vyà>%), this is i. even in Bhãshma or in (our) preceptor Droõa: %<bhãùbhe'pyasambhàvyamidaü gurau và>%, Ki. xvi. 23.

#<IMPROBABLY>#: expr. by adj., to talk i.: %<asammavaü vakti>%.

#<IMPROBITY>#: %<a÷ucità>%: v. Dishonesty, Probity.

#<IMPROMPTU>#: v. Extempore.

#<IMPROPER>#:
     1 %<anucitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%), i. language: %<anucitaü vacaþ>%, K. s. xi. 2;
     2 %<ayuktaþ>% (%<ktà ktaü>%), etc.: v. Proper, not.

#<IMPROPERLY>#:
     1 %<anucitam>%;
     2 %<ayuktam>%;
     3 often by comp.

#<IMPROPRIATE>#: (%<gràbhyajana->%) %<haste nidadhàti>% (%<dhà>%, c. 3.) (??).

#<IMPROVE># (v. t.):
     I To make better:
     1 expr. by adj.: v. Good;

     3 %<ut-karùati pra->%, (%<kçù>%, c. 1.) (rare).
     II To employ to good purpose: %<sadravyavahàraü karoti>% (with gen.).

#<IMPROVE># (v. i.): i.e. to become better:
     1 by adj.;
     2 %<vardhate>% (%<vçdh>%, c. 1.): v. To increase;
     3 %<ut-kçùyate pra->%, (pass. of %<kçù>%) (rare). Ph.: I. See (she is) almost i. ing on Iràvati: %<atikràmantãmiveràvatãü prekùe>%, Mal. i.

#<IMPROVEMENT>#:
     1 %<utkarùaþ>% (= excellence);
     2 %<unnatiþ>% (= advancement);
     3 %<vçddhiþ>% (= increase).

#<IMPROVIDENCE>#:
     1 %<asamãkùyakàrità>%;
     2 %<pramattatà>% (= carelessness).

     2 %<sapramàdam>% (= carelessly).

     2 %<dharùati>% (%<dhçù>%, c. 1.): v. To assail.

#<IMPUGNER>#: %<prativàdin>% (f. %<nã>%) (?); better by verb.

     I The act: %<praõo>% (%<co>%) %<danam>%.

     2 by verb %<praõo>% (%<co>%) %<dayati>%.

#<IMPULSIVE>#: of persons: %<yo màvagatyà kàryàõyavicàrya karoti>%.

#<IMPULSIVELY>#: expr. as above.

#<IMPUNITY>#: %<daõóamokùaþ>% (?). with i.: %<nirbàgham>%.

     2 %<a÷uci>% (mfn.); etc.: v. Pure.

#<IMPUTABLE>#: %<àropaõãyaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%), %<sam- adhi->%; better by verb.

#<IMPUTATION>#:
     I The act.: %<àropaõam>%.
     II Accusation, blame: q.v.: %<apavàdaþ>%.
     III Hint, notice: q.v.

#<IMPUTE>#:
     I To attribute: q.v.: %<aropayati>% (c. of %<ruh>%), %<sam->%.
     II To accuse: q.v.: %<apavadati>% (%<vad>%, c. 1.).
     III To reckon, regard: q.v.: %<vigaõayati>% (%<gaõ>%, c. 10.).

#<IN>#:
     I Denoting where: by loc., in the house of Vasudeva: %<vasudevasadmani>%, Si.; in (the work) Yogapradipa: %<yogapradãpe>%,
     V p. com.; in the first chapter: %<prathamepàde>%, S. Ph.: in one place: %<ekatra>%, Vi.; in my presence: %<pa÷yato me>%; in the hearing of Sugriva: %<÷çõvataþ sugrãvasya>%, Ram.
     II Denoting when: by loc., in childhood: %<÷ai÷ave>%, R.; in the first or the third year: %<prathame'bde tçtãye và>%, M.
     III Denoting by what time: by ins., (he) studied Anuvàka in a day: %<ahnànuvàko'dhãtaþ>%, S. K.; in twenty years: %<viü÷tyà vatsaraiþ>%, Raj. Ph.: in a short time: %<acireõa>%, K.
     IV Denoting how: by ins., passing in a balloon: %<vimànena vigàhamànaþ>%, R.; resolving in his mind: %<manasà ni÷citya>%, K.; in Anuùñubh metre: %<ànuùñubhena chandasà>%, U.; in the style of butterflies: %<÷àlabhena vidhinà>%, Mu.; in what manner: %<kena prakàreõa>%. Vet.: in rage: %<krudhà>%, Si. Ph.: in short: %<kiü bahunà>%, K. V., of direction:
     1 by ins., 16 miles in breadth: %<vistàreõa yojanadvayam>%, Mat.;
     2 better by comp.: v. Length, breadth.
     VI To denote other circumstances: by loc., in deciding: %<nirõaye>%, Mr.
     VII The interior: %<abhyantaram>%, took him in: %<tamabhyantaraü ninye>%, C.; go or come in: %<abhyantaraü pravi÷a>%, Vi., Mr. Ph.: in most cases: %<bahu÷aþ>%; in all likelihood: %<pràyeõa>%, Sa.; "not in man" i.e. not the nature of man: v. Nature; in that: v. Because; in consequence of: v. On account of; in the name of (i.e. on behalf of): %<-arthe>% or %<-vacanàt>%.

     2 %<sihlaþ>% (rare).
