#<INCESSANT>#:
     1 %<avirataþ>% or %<anavarata>% or %<anàrataþ>% (%<tà taü>%);
     2 %<avi÷rànta>% or %<a÷rànta>% (f. %<ntà>%); v. Also continuous.

#<INCESSANTLY>#:
     1 %<avoratam>%;
     2 %<anavaratam>%;
     3 %<a÷ràntam>%;
     4 %<avitatam>%: v. Also continually, always.

#<INCEST>#:
     1 %<agamyàgamanam>% (of men), V.;
     2 %<gamanam>% (when the sense is clear), i. with a mother: %<màtçgamanam>%.

#<INCESTUOUS>#:
     I Of men:
     1 %<agamyàgàmã>%;
     2 %<agamyàgantç>% (m.).
     II Of acts: by comp., for i. intercourse: %<agamyàgamanàrtham>% or %<agamyàrtham>%, N. xvii. 15.

#<INCESTUOUSLY>#: expr. by adj or by circumlo.

#<INCH>#: %<sàrddhàïgulaþ>% (%<aïgula>% = 2/3 of an i.). By i. es: %<alpàlpa÷aþ>%: v. Gradually.

#<INCHOATE>#: %<asampårõa>% (f. %<rõà>%) (= incomplete); %<asamàptaþ>% (= unfinished); %<pràrabdha>% (f. %<bdhà>%) (= begun).

#<INCIDENCE>#: %<patanam>% or %<pàtaþ>% (?), angle of i.: %<*pàtakoõaþ>%.

#<INCIDENT># (adj.):
     I Carnal: q.v.:
     II Attaching to: %<ànupaïgika>% (f. %<kã>%).

#<INCIDENT># (subs.):
     I Event: q.v.: %<vçttam>%.
     II Episode: %<upakathà>%.

#<INCIDENTAL>#:
     I Accidental: q.v.: %<yàdçcchika>% (f. %<kã>%).
     II Occasionally: expr. by adv.

#<INCIDENTALLY>#:
     I Accidentatlly: q.v.: %<samàpattyà>%.
     II Occasionally:
     1 %<prasaïgàt>%;
     2 %<kathàprasaïgena>%, Ki. i. 24.

#<INCIPIENCE, INCIPIENCY>#: %<pràrambhaþ>%: v. Beginning.

#<INCIPIENT>#:
     1 %<prathamaþ>% (%<mà maü>%) (= first);
     2 by subs.

#<INCISED>#: i. wound: %<chinnam>% or %<chinnaü vraõam>%, Ni.

     1 %<chedaþ>%;
     2 %<chinnam>%: v. Cut.

#<INCISIVE>#: %<atitãkùõa>% (f. %<kùõà>%) (= very sharp: q.v.).

#<INCISOR>#: %<ràjadantaþ>%, N. vii. 46.

#<INCITE>#: %<utsàhayati pra- sam->%, c. of. %<sah>%), i. ing Bhànuvarman: %<bhànuvarmàõaü protsàhya>%, D.: v. Also to impel, encourage.

#<INCITEMENT>#:
     1 %<protsàhaþ -nam>%;
     2 by verb.

#<INCITER>#: %<protsàhaka>% (f. %<hikà>%) or %<protsàhayitç>% (f. %<trã>%).

     2 %<vinayàparàdhaþ>%, Vi.

#<INCLEMENCY>#: perh. %<karka÷atà>% or %<raukùyam>% (= harshness).

#<INCIEMENT>#:
     I Harsh, cruel: %<niùñhuraþ>% (%<rà raü>%).
     II Of weather: perh. %<karka÷aþ>% (%<÷àm ÷aü>%); %<durdinam>% or %<vàrdalam>% (of cloudy weather).

     I Leaning: %<natiþ>%.
     II Fancy: q.v.: %<màvaþ>%.
     III Desire: q.v.: %<chandas>% (n.).

#<INCLINE>#: (subs.): %<utsarpiõã>% (= ascending) or %<avasarpiõã>% (= descending) %<bhåmiþ>%, Mat.

#<INCLINE># (v. i.):
     I To lean: %<namati>% (%<nam>%, c. 1.).
     II To be disposed: expr. by %<-pravaõa>% (f. %<õà>%) in comp. or by %<abhilàùaþ>% (= desire), however my mind is i. d: %<yathàvidho me manaso'bhilàùaþ>%, R.

     I To bend: q.v.: %<namayati>% (c. of %<nam>%).
     II To dispose: expr. as above: v. Also to induce.

     I Disposed: %<-pravaõa>% (f. %<õà>%) in comp.
     II In. math, %<nataþ>% (%<tà taü>%).

#<INCLUSIVE>#: expr. by ins. or with %<sah>% there i. of self: %<àtmanà tçtãyaþ>%, vi. i.; from Monday to Saturday i.: %<somavàramàrabhya sa÷anivàraparyantam>% (?).

     1 %<anupamaþ>% (%<mà maü>%): v. Incomparable;
     2 %<asàdhàraõa>% (f. %<õà>%): v. Uncommon;
     3 %<nànukaraõãyaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%) (rare).

#<INIMITABLY>#: by adj. or circumlo.

#<INIQUITOUS>#: %<anyàyya>% (f. %<yyà>%): v. Unjust, wicked.

#<INIQUITOUSLY>#: %<anyàyataþ>% or %<anyàyenaþ>% v. Wickedly.

#<INIQUITY>#:
     1 %<anyàyaþ>%;
     2 %<anyàyyatà>%: v. Wickedness.

#<INITIAL># (adj.): %<àdi->% in comp.: v. First.

#<INITIAL># (subs.): %<àdyakùaram>%;
     2 %<àdivarõaþ>%, etc.

#<INITIATE>#:
     I To begin: q.v.: %<àrabhate>% (%<rabh>%, c. 1.).
     II To instruct: q.v.: %<upadi÷ati>% (%<di÷>%, c. 6.). I. d.: %<dãkùitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%) (?).
     III To admit: q.v.: %<parigçhvàti>% (%<grah>%, c. 9.).

#<INITIATION>#:
     I Beginning: q.v.: %<àrambhaþ>%.
     III Instruction:
     1 %<upade÷aþ>%;
     2 %<dãkùà>% (in sacrifices);
     3 %<upanayaþ -nam>% (of the first three castes with customary thread).

#<INITIATORY>#: expr. by comp.

#<INJECT>#:
     1 %<prave÷ayati>% (c. of %<vi÷>%);
     2 %<nikùipati>% (%<kùip>%, c. 6.): v. To throw.

#<INJECTION>#:
     I The act: %<prave÷anam>%.
     II A clyster: %<vastiþ>% (??).

#<INJUDICIOUS>#: %<avivekaþ>% (%<kà kaü>%) (= imprudent: q.v.).

#<INJUDICIOUSLY>#:
     1 %<avicàrya>%;
     2 %<avivecya>%.

#<INJUDICIOUSNESS>#: %<avivekità>%: v. Imprudence.

#<INJUNCTION>#: %<÷àsanam>%: v. Order, command.

#<INJURE>#:
     1 %<apakaroti>% (%<kç>%, c. 8.);
     2 %<kùataü karoti>%, Kat.;
     3 %<pãóayati>% (%<pãó>%, c. 10.), who i. their own nest-trees: %<nijanãóadrumapãóinaþ>%, N.;
     4 %<hinasti>% (%<hiüs>%, c. 7.) (a much stronger term: often = to kill), he i. s all enemies of the Vedas: %<brahmadviùo hye ùa hinasti sarvàn>%, Vi. i. 62.

#<INJURER>#:
     1 %<apakartç>% (f. %<trã>%) or %<apakàrasya kàraka>% (f. %<rikà>%), Y.;
     2 %<aniùñakàrin>% (f. %<õã>%);
     3 %<pãóayitç>% (f. %<trã>%) or %<pãóaka>% (f. %<óikà>%).

#<INJURIOUS>#:
     1 %<aniùñakaraþ>% (%<rã raü>%) (= causing evil);
     2 %<hànikaraþ>% (%<rã raü>%) (= causing loss):
     1 %<pãóàkaraþ>% (%<rã raü>%), throwing i things on a house: %<gçhe pãóàkaraü dravyaü prakùipan>%, V. s.;
     4 %<bàdhaka>% (f. %<dhikà>%), slightly i.: %<alpabàdhaþ>% (%<dhà dhaü>%), N. s.

#<INJURIOUSLY>#: expr. by pres. part or circumlo.

#<INJURIOUSNESS>#:
     1 %<pãóàkaratà>%;
     2 %<bàdhakatà>%, etc.

     3 %<bàdhà>%.
     II Hurt: %<kùatam>% or %<kùatiþ>%.

#<INSTANCE># (subs.):

     II Solicitation: %<prarthanà>%.
     III Example: q.v.: %<udàharaõam>%, for i.: %<tathàhi>%; for i. Puråravas met destruction from a thirst after Bràhmin's money: %<tathàhi puråravà bràhmaõadhanatçùõayà vinanà÷a>%, Va.      II A day of the current month: on the 5th. i.: %<asya màsasya pa¤camadivase>% or %<àgàmini>% or %<gate pa¤came divase>% (according as it is coming or past).

#<INSTANTANEOUS>#:
     1 %<kùaõamàtrabhavaþ>% (%<và vaü>%), Si.;
     2 %<kùaõamàtrasthàyin>% (f. %<nã>%) M. n.

     1 %<kùaõena>%;
     2 %<muhårtamàtreõa>%;
     3 %<ekapade>%.

     3 %<saüvàdakàrakaþ>%.

#<INTERLOPER>#: %<*anadhikàraprave÷akaþ>% [%<àgantukaþ>% many gen. do].

#<INTERLUDE>#: %<*madhyaraïgaþ>% (after %<pårvaraïgaþ>%).

#<INTERLUNAR>#: %<amàvasyà->% in comp.

#<INTERMARRIAGE>#: expr. by %<vivàha>% (= marriage) and %<madhye>% (= between).

#<INTERMARRY>#: it is lawful to i. now: %<*adhunà minnajàtyàü vivàho na vidhiviruddhaþ>%.

#<INTERMEDDLE>#: you are not to i. in my work: %<mama niyogasya carcà tvayà na kartavyà>%, H. ii.; i. ing: %<paràdhikàracarcà>%.

#<INTERMEDIATE>#:
     1 %<madhyavartin>% (f. %<nã>%);
     2 %<antarvartin>% (f. %<nã>%): v. Middle.

#<INTERMENT>#: %<nidhànam>%: v. Burial.

#<INTERMINABLE>#:
     1 %<ananta>% (f. %<ntà>%);
     2 %<aparyanta>% (f. %<ntà>%);
     3 %<niravadhi>% (mfn.).

#<INTERMINABLY>#:
     1 %<anantam>%;
     2 %<aparyantam>%.

#<INTERMINGLE>#: %<mi÷rayati>% (%<mi÷ra>%, c. 10.): v. To mix.

#<INTERMISSION>#: %<viràmaþ>% or %<viratiþ>%: v. Cessation. Without i.: %<aviratam>%: v. Incessantly.

#<INTERMIT>#:
     I Trans.: %<nivartayati>% (c. of %<vçt>%).
     II Intrans: %<viramati>% (%<ram>%, c. 1.): v. To cease.

#<INTERMITIENT>#: That (fever) which is not at all i. is called continuous: %<santatyà yo'visargã syàt santataþ sa nigadyate>%, Sr.; high i. fever: %<viùamajvaraþ>%, Sr.

#<INTERMITTENTLY>#: coming i. (of fever): %<cirotthitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%), Bha.

#<INTERMIX>#: %<saümi÷rayati>% (%<mi÷ra>%, c. 10.): v. To mix.

#<INTERMIXTURE>#: %<saümi÷raõam>%: v. Mixture.

#<INTERNAL>#:
     1 %<antar>% in comp., i. heat: %<antardàhaþ>%, U., iii. 31.; arising from i. disaffection: %<antaþprakçtiprakopajaþ>% (%<jà jaü>%), Ki. ii. 61.;
     2 %<àbhyantara>% (f. %<rã>%) (rare), secretly fomenting external and i. discord: %<bàhyàbhyantaràn kopàn gåóhamutpàdya>%, D. viii.;
     3 %<antargataþ>% (%<tà taü>%) (what is in.), (but) as you know the i. feelings of animals: %<antargataü pràõabhçtàü hi veda sarvaü bhavàn bhàvam>%, R. ii. 43.;
     4 %<antaþstha>% (f. %<sthà>%) (what stands in);
     5 %<antarbhavaþ>% (%<và vaü>%) (what is born in).

#<INTERNALLY>#: %<antar>%, i. towards you: %<antastvàü prati>%, Vi. iii. 43.; externally and i.: %<bahiranta÷ca>%, Ki. ii. 53.

#<INTERNATIONAL>#: i. law: %<*ràùñràõàü paraspakhyavahàraþ>%.

#<INTERNECINE>#: perh. %<antardhvasin>% (f. %<nã>%): v. Destructive.

#<INTERNUNCIO>#: of the pope: %<*anudåtaþ>%.

#<INTERPOLATE>#: %<svakçtenànyagranthobdhçtena và ÷lokàdinà granthaü dåùayati>% (c. of %<duù>%) (?).

#<INTERPOLATION>#: expr. as above. The Bombay edition uses %<àdhikyam>% (= excess) for the i. s of the Mah.

#<INTERPOLATOR>#: %<granthadåùakaþ>% (?).

#<INTERPOSE>#:
     I To introduce: %<nikùipati>% (%<kùip>%, c. 6.): v. To cast.
     II To interfere: expr. by %<madhye tiùñhati>% (%<sthà>%, c. 1.) or %<màdhyasthyaü karoti>%.
     III To intrude: q.v.

#<INTERPOSITION>#:
     I A coming between: %<madhyavartità>%.
     II Mediation: %<màdhyastham>%.

#<INTERPRET>#: %<vyàkhyàti>% (%<khyà>%, c. 2.): v. To explain.

#<INTERPRETATION>#: %<vyàkhyà>%: v. Explanation, meaning.

#<INTERPRETER>#:
     I An. expositor: %<vyàkhyàtç>% (m.).
     II A translator: Persian i.: %<*pàrasikamàùàbodhakaþ>%.

#<INTERREGNUM>#: in the i.: %<÷ånye siühàsane>%: v. Regent.

#<INTERROGATE>#: %<pra÷naü karotiþ>% v. To enquire, question.

#<INTERROGATION>#: expr. by verb. Note of i.: %<*pra÷nacihnam>%.

#<INTERROGATIVE>#: %<pra÷nàrthakaþ>% (%<kà kaü>%), "who" is i.: %<kiü pra÷ne>%.

#<INTERROGATIVELY>#: %<pra÷nakrameõa>%. (?); %<pra÷naråpeõa>% (?).

#<INTERROGATOR>#: %<prà÷nikaþ>%, Mah. i.

#<INTERROGATORY>#:
     I Subs.: v. Question.
     II Adj.: v. Interrogative.

#<INTERRUPT>#:
     1 %<pratibadhnàti>% (%<bandh>%, c. 9.), do not i. him: %<mainamantarà pratibadhnãtam>%, Sa.;
     2 %<upa-ruõaddhi ni->%, (%<rudh>%, c. 7.) (= to check), to i. his progress: %<tatprasaraü niroddhum>%, Vi. iv. 6.;

     2 %<uparodhaþ>%, i. of business: %<kàryoparoghaþ>%, Sa.;

#<INTERSECT>#: %<sampàtaü karoti>%, K.d.; %<antarà chinatti>% (%<chid>%, c. 7.).

#<INTERSECTION>#: %<sampàtaþ>%, K. d.; %<chedaþ>% (the context determining the meaning).

#<INTERSPERSE>#: the forest is i. d. with cocoanut trees: %<vànasyàntaràntarà nàrikelapàdapàþ>%, after K.

#<INTERVAL>#:
     1 %<antaram>%;

#<INTERVENE>#:
     I To interpose: %<madhye tiùñhati>% (%<sthà>%, c. 1.).

     V ii.;

     1 %<adç÷yatà>%;
     2 %<adar÷anãyatà>%; etc.

#<INVISIBLE>#:
     1 %<adç÷ya>% (f. %<÷yà>%) (best equiv.), i. forms. %<tanåraddç÷yàþ>%, Ki. xiv. 60.;
     2 %<dçùñipathàtãtaþ>% (%<tà taü>%) and sim. comp.s. To become i.: i.e. to disapper: q.v.: %<antardhãyate>% (pass. of %<dhà>%).

#<INVISIBLY>#: expr. by adj. or comp., to strike i.: %<adç÷yaþ praharati>%.

#<INVITATION>#: %<nimantraõam upa->%, in not keeping i.: %<nimantraõàtikrame>%,
     V s.

#<INVITE># (v.):
     I Lit.: %<nimantrayati upa->% (%<mantr>%, c. 10.), I will i. a Brahmin: %<ahaü bràhnaõamupanimantrayàmi>%, Mr.; an i. d (person) and eating after saying "very well" [i.e. after accepting an invitation]: %<nimantritastathetyuktvà bhå¤jànaþ>%, V. s.
     II Fig.: %<àhvayati>% (%<hve>%, c. 1.), as if. i. d by the cries of swans: %<kalahaüsànaü kolàhalairàhåyamàna iva>%, K.

#<INVITER>#: %<nimantrayitç>% (f. %<trã>%), and double food to the i.: %<nimantrayitu÷va dviguõamannam>%, V. s.

#<JASMINE>#:
     1 %<mallika>% (= Arabian j.);

     5 %<kundaþ>% (= j. pubescens);
     6 %<hemapuùpikà>% (= yellow j.). N. B. These also indicate the flowers, except (5), for which use neuter.

#<JURIST>#: %<dharma÷àstraku÷alaþ>% (%<là laü>%), %<-kovidaþ>% (%<dà daü>%), etc.; (precisely) %<*vyavahàradharmaj¤a>% (f. %<j¤à>%).

#<JUROR, JURY-MAN>#:
     1 %<sabhyaþ>%, the j. s are the examiners of actions: %<sabhyàþ kàryaparãkùakàþ>%, Vri.;
     2 %<sabhàsad>% (m.), P. i. iv.

#<JUST># (adj.):
     I Of men:
     1 %<dhàrmika>% (f. %<kã>%);
     2 %<nyàyaparàyaõa>% (f. %<õà>%); etc.
     II Of action, etc.:
     1 %<nyàyya>% (f. %<yyà>%);
     2 %<nyàyasaïgata>% (f. %<tà>%);
     3 %<dhàrmya>% (f. %<rmyà>%); etc.
     III Exact, proper: q.v.

#<JUST># (adv.):
     I In gen.: by %<-eva>%, j. so: %<evameva>%; j. now: %<idànãmeva>%; j. here: %<ihaiva>%, Sa. i.; j. the same feature: %<saivàkçtiþ>%, U., iv. 23.; complaisance is j. proper for affection: %<ucitameva dàkùiõyaü snehasya>%, U. iii.; j. at this moment: %<asminneva kùaõe>%, D. v.; j. before sunrise: %<anukùita eva bhàskare>%.
     II Only: j. wait a moment: %<muhårtaü tàvattiùñha>%, Sa.; so much sunshine as is sufficient for lotus-blowing: %<tàvantamevàtapaü tanoti yàvanmàtreõa kamalonmeùo sàdhyate>%, Ku. ii. 23.
     III = instantly; now: q.v.

#<LAY ASIDE>#:
     I Not to retain:
     1 %<apa-asyati nir->% (%<as>%, c. 4.), how all that was suddenly l. d a: %<sarvaü tadekapadameva kathaü nirastam>%, Vi. iii. 13.;
     2 %<vimu¤cati>% (%<muc>%, c. 6.) (= to leave: q. v.), l. ing a. (her) necklace: %<hàraü vimucya>%, Ku. v. 8.
     II To reserve: q. v.:

#<LAY BEFORE>#: %<upanyasyati>% (%<as>%, c. 4.) (?).

     I To abandon: q. v.: %<mu¤cati vi->%, (%<muc>%, c. 6.), l. d d. arms: %<÷astràõi mumoca>%, Ki. ii. 9.

     I Of corpses: l. d out the corpse of Bàli on the litter: %<àropya ÷ivikàyàü tu bàlinaü naùñajãvitam>% (%<vàsasàcchàdayàmàsa màlyenàvacakàra ca>%), Ram.

#<LEMON>#:
     I The tree:
     1 %<jambãraþ>%;
     2 %<nimbåþ>%
     II The fruit:
     1 %<jambãram>% or %<jambãraphalam>%;
     2 %<nimbåphalam>%.

#<LEMONADE>#: %<pànãyavi÷eùaþ; jambãrajalam>%.

#<LENGTH>#:
     1 %<dairghyam>%:, another cloth 3(1/2) cubits in l. %<dairdhye sàrdhakaratrayàparapañã>%, Li.; whose breadth is five cubits, l. eight cubits: %<yadvistçtiþ pa¤cakaràùñahastaü dairghyaü ca>%, Li.;
     2 %<àyatiþ>% or %<àyàmaþ>% (rare);
     3 %<parimàõam>% (= measure: as of time).

#<LIGHT># (subs.):

     1 %<àlokaþ>%, to give l.: %<àlokaü dadàti>%, Si. xx. 38.;
     2 %<prakà÷aþ>%, like l. and darkness: %<tamaþprakà÷avat>%, S.; by the l. of plants: %<oùadhiprakà÷ena>%, Ku. vi. 43.;
     3 %<prabhà>% (= shining l.), l. of the moon: %<induprabhà>% Su.;
     4 %<jyotis>% (n (= 3);
     5 %<tejas>% (rare), Par.
     II That which gives 1.:
     1 %<àlokaþ>%, I noticed a l. in the street: %<ràjavãthyàmàlokamalakùayam>%, D. ii.;
     2 %<pradãpaþ>% (gen. =lamp), l. of knowledge: %<j¤ànapradãpaþ>%, D. III. A window: q. v.: %<àlokamàrgaþ>%, R. vii. 6.

     VII Construction: according to one's l.: %<svavyàkhyànusàreõa>%. VIII. A noteworthy: %<tejas>% (n.) (?). Ph.: l. of countenance i. e. favour: %<prasàdaþ>%.

     I Not heavy: %<laghu>% (f. %<dhvã>%).
     II Of food: %<laghu>% (f. %<dhvã>%), goat-flesh is l.: %<chàgamàüsaü laghu>%, Bha.

     II The place: %<avekùàsthànam>%.

#<LOOM># (subs.):
     1 %<tantram>%;
     2 %<tantravàpaþ>%.

     I Lit.: %<lakùyate>% (pass. of %<lakù>%): v. To appear, look.
     II Fig.: %<÷obhate>% (%<÷ubh>%, c. l.): v. To shine.

#<LOON>#: I. A rascal: %<dhårtaþ>%. II. A bird: %<jàlapàdaþ pakùibhedaþ>%.

     2 %<chidram>% (= hole).

#<LOOSE># (adj.):
     I Not tight:
     1 %<÷ithilaþ>% (%<là laü>%), l. tie: %<÷ithilabandhanam>%, M. n.
     2 %<÷lathaþ>% (%<thà thaü>%), %<pari- pra->%.

     III Unrestrained, dissolute: q. v.: %<ucchçïhvalaþ>% (%<là laü>%).
     IV Of bowels: %<÷ithilaþ>% (%<là laü>%).
     V Of soil: %<÷ithilaþ>% (%<là laü>%).

     1 %<÷ithilãkaroti>%, etc.;

#<LORN>#: %<anàthaþ>% (%<thà thaü>%): v. Forlorn.

#<LOSE>#: I. To cause to be taken: %<hàrayati apa->%, (c. of %<hç>%), I. lost ten sovereigns in gambling: %<da÷asuvarõaü dyåte hàritam>%, Mr.; to l. wife: %<patnãü hàrayati>%, Vi. v. 23.
     II To be deprived of: %<viyujyate>% (pass. of %<yuj>%): v. To deprive, devoid of.

     IV Opposed to win: %<paràjayate>% (%<ji>%, c. l.) (rare), what you first lost: %<kinnu pårvaü paràjaiùãþ>%, Mah. ii. 67. 7.
     IV To miss.: expr. with %<na÷yati>% (%<na÷>%, c. 4.), %<pra->%, one who has lost his way: %<pranaùñavartman>% (mfn.), K.; Vasantasenà is lost: %<naùñà vasantasenà>%, Mr. i. V. To ruin, destroy: q. v.: %<nà÷ayati>% (c. of %<na÷>%).
     VI Of time: v. To spend, waste. Ph.: to l. oneself: %<buddhya parityajyate>%, Mr.

#<LOVE># (subs.):
     I Affection: q. v.:
     1 %<preman>% (n.), man's l. for woman is inconstant: %<dayitàsvanavasthitaü nçõàü.. prema>%, Ku. iv. 28.;
     2 %<praõayaþ>%, are you attached to, or in l. or friendship with her daughter: %<asti bhavato'syà duhitrà saha prasaktiþ praõayaþ prãtirvà>%, Mr. ix.;
     3 %<anuràgaþ>% (= fondness), mutual l. is the best thing in matches: %<itaretarànuràgo dàrakarmaõi paràrddhaü maïgalam>%, Ma. ii.;
     4 %<kàmaþ>% (= amorous l.), for he whom you look would fall in l. with you: %<yaü hi tvamabhivãkùethàþ sa kàmava÷ago bhavet>%, Mah.; l.-sick: %<kàmàrta>% (f. %<rtà>%), Me.; %<kàmàturaþ>% (%<rà raü>%), D.; Kalahansaka makes l. to Mandàrikà: %<kalahaüsako mandàrikàü kàmayate>% Ma. i.; l. is cross: %<kàmo vàmaþ>%, Mr.; l. -stricken: %<madanaparava÷aþ>% (%<÷à ÷aü>%), %<manmathamathyamàna>% (f. %<nà>%), etc.
     II = darling: %<priya>% (f. %<yà>%).
     III Kindness: %<dayà>%, universal benevolence is l.: %<dayà sarvasukhaiùitvam>%, Mah.
     IV God of love:
     1 %<kàmaþ>%;
     2 %<madanaþ>%;
     3 %<manmathaþ>%;
     4 %<kandarpaþ>%;
     5 %<anaïgaþ>%.

     2 %<vidadhàti>%, m. ing friend guards: %<vidhàya rakùàn paritaþ paretaràn>%, Ki.
     IV To do:
     1 %<karoti>%, to m. effort: %<udyamaü karoti>%; to m. peace: %<sandhiü karoti>%, Ve.; to m. a sound: %<÷abdaü karoti>%, P.; to m. account of: %<gaõanàü karoti>%; to m. bold: %<sàhasaü karoti>%; to m. doubt: %<sandehaü karoti>%; to m. an oath: %<÷apathaü karoti>%, D.; m. s suit to: %<àràdhanàü karoti>% (with gen.); m. use of: %<prayogaü karoti>%;
     2 %<vidadhàti>%, to m. abode: %<vasatiü vidadhàti>%, Ch.
     V To gain: %<karoti>%, m. ing a lac of money: %<lakùasaükhyàni dhanàni kçtvà>%, H. iv.
     VI To cause:
     1 by causal verb, to m. (to) revolve: %<bhràmayati>%,
     V p.; to m. (to) believe: %<vi÷vàsayati>%, Ki.;
     2 %<kàrayati>% (c. of %<kç>%), as I have made their friendship: %<yathànayoþ sauhàrdaü mayà kàritam>%, H. VII. To compel: q. v.
     VIII To m. up: q. v.
     IX To arrive at: q. v.
     X To pass: %<gacchati>% (%<gam>%, c. l.), to m. a distance: %<adhvànaü gacchati>%, K. XI. To represent: q. v.
     XII To become: %<bhavati>%, m. merry: %<hçùño bhavati>%, Ph.: a made man: %<vçddhiü gato naraþ>%; m. much of: %<bahu bhanyate>%; m. light of: %<laghu manyate tçõàya manyate>%; m. way: %<÷rantaraü dadàti>% (to give way) or %<sthànaü karoti>% (to clear the way); m. free with: %<vinà saïkocena vyavaharati>%.

#<MAKE># (v. i.):
     I To move: q. v.
     II To become: q. v.: %<bhavati>%, m. against: %<pratikålo bhavati>%; m. bold: %<sàhasaü karoti>%.
     III With, as if = to pretend: %<bhàvayati>% (c. of %<bhå>%), D. ii.
     IV To increase: q. v.

     II To favour: q. v.

     1 %<màdhyàhrikaþ>% (%<kã kaü>%);
     2 %<màdhyandinaþ>% (%<nã naü>%);
     3 better by comp., m. meal: %<madhyàhrabhojanam>%.

#<MIDDLE># (adj.):
     1 %<madhyaþ>% (%<dhyà dhyaü>%), the m. men leave off, beset with obstacles: %<vighnanihatà viramanti madhyàþ>%, Mu.;
     2 %<madhyamaþ>% (%<mà maü>%), following a m. course: %<puraskçtamadhyamakramaþ>%, R.; the m. world (i. e. the earth): %<madhyamalokaþ>%, Vi.;
     3 %<madhyasthaþ>% (%<sthà sthaü>%) (= on the m.);
     4 %<madhyamãyaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%) (rare). The m. age: %<*madhyayugam>% or %<madhyakàlaþ>%.

#<MIDDLE># (subs.):
     1 %<madhyam>%, the m. of the sky: %<vyomamadhyam>%, V.; in the m. of the ocean: %<madhyesamudram>%, Si.; in the m. of the army: %<sainyasya madhye>%, K.; making the m. (= waist) slender: %<madhyaü tanåkçtya>%, N. vii. 81.;
     2 %<madhyabhàgaþ>%, and there in the m.: %<tatra ca madhyamàge>%, K.

#<MIRTHFUL>#: %<harùàkulaþ>% (%<là laü>%) and sim. comp.s.: v. Also glad, cheerful.

     1 %<prahçùñaþ>% (%<ùñà ùñaü>%);
     2 %<saharùam>%;
     3 %<sollàsam>%.

#<MIRTHFULNESS>#:
     1 %<prahçùñatà>%;
     2 %<sollàsatàþ>% v. Mirth.

#<MIRY>#: %<païkilaþ>% (%<là laü>%): v. Muddy.

#<MISADVENTURE>#: %<durghañanà>%: v. Also misfortune, calamity.

#<MISALLIANCE>#: in marriage:
     1 %<kusambandhaþ>%;
     2 %<kuvivàhaþ>%.

     2 %<vijàtaþ>% (%<tà taü>%).

     2 %<durvçttiþ>%;
     3 %<avinayaþ>%.

#<MISCALL>#: v. To call, improperly. M. ed: %<mithyàbhihitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%).

#<MISCARRIAGE>#:
     I Abortion: q. v.: %<garbhapàtaþ>%.
     II Failure: q. v.

#<MISCARRY>#:
     I To have a miscarriage: %<garmaþ sravati>% (%<sru>%, c. l.), %<patati>% (%<pat>%, c. l.), etc. (with gen.).
     II Not to succeed: %<na sidhyati>% (%<sidh>%, c. 4.).
     II Of letters, etc.: %<mriyate>% (%<mç>%, c. 6.) (used in Bengali).

#<MISCELLANEOUS>#: %<prakãrõa>% (f. %<rõà>%), -%<kaþ>% (%<kà kaü>%), R.: v. Also promiscuous, various, mix(ed).

     1 %<prakãrõam>%;
     2 by adj.

#<MISCHANCE>#: %<durghañanà>%: v. Misfortune, calamity.

#<MISCHIEF>#:
     I Harm, injury:
     1 %<apakàraþ>%;
     2 %<hiüsà>% (in old writers): if cattle commit m. to crops: %<dhànyaü vihiüsyuþ pa÷avo yadi>%, M. Ph.: m. to (lit. destruction of) crops by cattle, etc.: %<÷asyaghàto gavàdimiþ>%, N.s.
     II Damage, loss: q. v.: %<hàniþ>%.

#<MISCHIEF-MAKER>#: expr. by circumlo. with: %<bhedaþ>% (= separation), %<vivàdaþ>% (= dispute) or %<anarthaþ>% (= evil), he was the m.: %<*sa bhedaü janayàmàsa>%.

#<MISCHIEF-MAKING>#: (adj. or subs.): expr. by circumlo. as above.

     V p.; even m.ies met in the Daõóakà: %<pràptàni duþkhànyapi daõóakàyàm>%, R. xiv. 25.;

#<MISS># (v.):
     I Not to hit:
     1 %<moghãbhavati>% (= be frustrated: q. v.);

     V To feel the want of: expr. by circumlo., I m. him very much: %<*tasya viprayogaduþkhaü nitaràmanubhavàmiþ>% v. Also anxious.

#<MISTRESS># (subs.):
     I Of a house:
     1 %<gçhiõã>% (also %<gehinã>%), I will call and ask the m. of the house: %<gçhiõãmàhåya pçcchàmi>%, Mr. i.;
     2 %<svàminã>%, the m. of the whole seraglio: %<nikhilàntaþpurasvàminã>%, K.;
     3 %<bhaññinã>% (with ref. to servants);
     4 %<kuñumbinã>% (matron);
     5 %<ã÷varã>% (= lady), m. of life: %<jãvite÷varã>%, Sa. iv.
     II A kept woman:
     1 %<upapatnã>%;
     2 %<bandhakã>%, gamblers have m.es in their house: %<bhavanti gehe bandhakyaþ kitavànàm>%, Mah.;
     3 %<avarodhaþ>% (when the sense is clear), %<kàmapi gaõikàmavarodhamakarot>%, D. III. A sweetheart: %<priyà>% or %<priyatamà>%: v. Darling, woman.
     IV A teacher: q. v.: %<÷ikùayitrã>%.
     V Skilled: q. v.: %<ku÷alà pravãõà>%, etc.
     VI As title: %<÷rãmatã>%.

#<MIX># (v. t.):
     I Lit.:
     1 %<mi÷rayati>% (%<mi÷r>%, c. 10.) %<saü- vi- vyà->%;

     1 %<mi÷rãbhavati>%, m.ed with the jingling of the wires of a lute: %<vãõàtantrãbhaïkàrami÷ra>% (f. %<÷rà>%), K.;
     2 %<milati>% (%<mil>%, c. 6.) (fig.): v. To unite.

#<MIXEDLY>#: %<sammi÷reõa>%: v. Promiscuously.

#<MIXTURE>#:
     I Mixing:
     1 %<mi÷raõam sam->%;
     2 %<saüyogaþ>% (= union: q. v.).
     II The compound:
     1 %<mi÷ram>%;
     2 %<saü-mi÷reõa jàtaþ>% (%<tà taü>%).

     1 %<saïkaraþ>%;
     2 %<sannipàtaþ>%.

#<MODE>#:
     I Manner: q. v.
     II Fashion: q. v.
     III Variety: %<prakàraþ>%.
     IV In logic: %<råpam>% (?).
     V In music: %<ràgaþ>% (f. %<ràgiõã>%).

#<MODEL># (adj.): m. school: %<*àdar÷avidyàlayaþ>%.

#<MODEL># (subs.): %<àdar÷aþ>%: v. Pattern, standard.

#<MODEL># (v.): expr. by subs., m. house: %<*àdar÷agçhaü kurå>%.

#<MODELLER>#: %<*àdar÷akàrin>% (f. %<õã>%).

#<MODERATE># (adj.):
     I Within due measure: %<mitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%), %<pari->%, one whose expenses are m.: %<mitavyayin>% (f. %<nã>%); whose language is m. (for the sake of) truth: %<satyàya mitabhàùiõàm>%, R. i. 7.
     II Of a middle rate: expr. with negative, of m. height: %<anatidãrgha>% (f. %<rghà>%); of m. abilities: %<anatitãkùõabuddhi>% (mfn); etc.

#<MODERATE># (v.):
     I To mitigate: %<laghayati>% (nomi.).
     II To control, restrain: q. v.: %<saüyacchati>% (%<yam>%, c. 1.).
     III To preside over a meeting: %<adhitiùñhati>% (%<sthà>%, c. 1.).

     I In due measure: %<mitam pari->%.
     II In a medium degree: v. Moderate (II).

#<MORNING># (subs.):
     I Lit.: %<prabhàtam>% or %<vibhàtam>%, tomorrow m.: %<÷vaþ prabhàte>%, A.r., good m. to you: %<*supramàtaü te>%: v.      II Forenoon: %<pårvàhõaþ>%, in the m.: %<pårvàhõe>%, M.

     I Abs:
     1 %<iyat>% (f. %<tã>%), and for cooking so m. rice so m. fuel is sufficient: %<iyata÷caudanasya pàkàyaitàvadindhanaü paryàptam>%, D. viii.;
     2 %<etàvat>% (f. %<tã>%), if the motion of the moon is so m. in one day: %<yadyekena dinenaitàvatã candragatiþ>%, Gan.
     II In correlation with as much: %<tàvat>% (f. %<tã>%). N.B. Use the neuter acc. sing. for adv.

#<MUCH, THAT>#: %<tàvat>% (f. %<tã>%), Ku. v. 10.

#<MUCH LESS, MUCH MORE>#:
     1 %<kimuta>%, even my parents do not recognise me, m. less others: %<pitaràvapimàü na pratisaüvidàte kimutetaraþ>%, D.: he is master even of my body, m. more of (my) house, of (my) fortune, and of (my) dependants: %<÷arãrasyàpyayameva prabhuþ kimuta bhavanasya vibhavasya parijanasya và>%, K.;
     2 %<kimu>%, m. less kings: %<kimu ràjakam>%, Ki. ii. 43.;
     3 %<kiü punar>%, m. more one who is so high: %<kiü punaryastathoccaiþ>%, Me.

#<MUCILAGE>#: no equiv.: %<rasaþ>% may be used.

#<MUCK>#: %<malam>%: v. Dirt, dung.

#<MUCK-HEAP, MUCK-HILL>#: %<malarà÷iþ>% and sim. comp.s.

#<MUD>#:
     1 %<païkaþ>%, to remove m.: %<païkaü harati>%, V. p. v. 10. 14.; stuck in deep m.: %<mahàpaïke nimagnaþ>%, H. (Also poet. of any turbid liquid, %<apåri païkairiva kuïkumasya>%, N.);
     2 %<kardamaþ>%, thick m.: %<sàndrakardamaþ>%, Ki.;

     II Fig., a rich man: %<*nabàbaþ; bhogapatiþ>%.

#<NACRE, NAKER>#: %<÷uktyudaram>% (?).

#<NADIR>#: %<harijatalam>% (?).

#<NAG>#:
     I A horse: q. v.: %<a÷vakaþ>%.
     II A paramour: %<jàraþ>%.

#<NAIAD>#: %<jaladevatà; apsaras>% (f.) (usually in the pl.) (= heavenly nymph).

#<NAIL># (subs.):
     I Lit.:
     1 %<nakhaþ>%, to keep n.s: %<nakhàni bimarti>%, M. vi. 6.; having n.s: %<nakhin>% (f. %<nã>%), H.; n. -brush: %<*nakhamàrjanã>%;
     2 %<nakharaþ>%, striking with n.s (claws): %<nakhaprahàraþ>%, Mah. iii. Ph.: tooth and n.: %<àke÷àgràdànakhàntàt>%, At.; on the n.: (= immediately) %<tatkùaõàt>%.
     II Of metal: %<kãlakaþ>%. Ph.: to hit n. on the head: %<marmaõi vidhyati>% (%<vyadh>%, c. 4.).

#<NAIL># (v.): %<kãlayati>% (%<kãl>%, c. 10.): v. To fasten.

#<NAIVE>#:
     1 %<saralaþ>% (%<là laü>%): v. øimple, ingenuous;
     2 %<prakçtimadhuraþ>% (%<rà raü>%), K.

#<NAIVELY>#: %<sahajasaralatayà; svamàvasaujanyena>%.

#<NAIVETE>#:
     1 %<sahajasaralatà>%;
     2 %<svabhàvasujanatà>%;
     3 %<prakçtimadhuratà>%.

#<NAKED>#:
     I Lit.:
     1 %<nagna>% (f. %<gnà>%), what are you looking, n. woman: %<kiü nirãkùase nagnike>%, P. iv. 62.;
     2 %<anàvçtaþ>% (%<tà taü>%) (= not covered, bare), Mah.;
     3 %<vivastra>% (f. %<strà>%) and sim. comp.s. (= without clothes), Mah.;
     4 %<digambaraþ>% (%<rà raü>%) (poet), made n.: %<cakre digambaraþ>%, K. s. xiii. 147.
     II Fig.: open, plain: %<anàvçtaþ>% (%<tà taü>%).
     III Mere, simple: %<kevalaþ>% (%<là laü>%).

#<NAKEDLY>#:
     I Lit.: expr. by adj.
     II Fig., openly: %<spaùñam>%.

#<NAKEDNESS>#:
     I Lit.:
     1 %<nagnatvam>%, n. of øiva: %<nagnatvaü nãlakaõñhasya>%, H. i.;
     2 %<digambaratvam>%, Ku.; etc.
     II Openness, exposure: %<anàvçtatà>%.

#<NAME># (subs.):
     I Of person or thing:
     1 %<nàman>% (n.), only the n. of Duryodhana remains: %<nàmaikaü dhàrtaràùñrasya ÷eùam>%, Vi.; who bear the mere n.: %<kevalaü nàmadhàrakàþ>%, Pa.; with (their) father's n.: %<pitçnàmaikapårvakam>%, Y.: kept the n. of the son Chandràpióa: %<såno÷candràpãóa iti nàma cakàra>%, K.; to call by n.: %<nàmagràhamàhvayati>%, S. k.;
     2 %<nàmadheyam>%, asking the n.s of trees: %<nàmadheyàni pçcchantau  .÷àkhinàü>%, R.; do (you) know them by n.: %<api j¤àyante nàmagheyataþ>%, Mu.
     3 %<abhidhànam>%, who is this girl and what is her n.: %<keyaü kanyakà kimamidhànà>%, K. II. Reputation, renown: q. v.: %<nàman>%, whose n. even enemies approve: %<nàma yasyàbhinandanti dviùo'pi>%, Ki. xi. 73.; bad n.: %<durnàma>%; "men of n.": %<nàma÷àlinaþ>% or %<khyàtanàmànaþ>%.
     III Authority: %<vacanam>%, go and in my n. rebuke: %<gaccha madvacanàt . upàlamasva>%, Sa. vi.
     IV In adjuration: in the n. of gods: %<devàn sàkùãkçtya>%.

#<NAME># (v. t.):
     I To call: q. v.: %<nàma karoti>% or %<kuråte>% (with gen.), and then should n. (him): %<tata÷ca nàma kurvãta>%, V. p.; therefore n.d him Aja after God: %<ato brahmaõo nàmnà tamajaü cakàra>%, R. v. 36.
     II To mention by n.: %<nàma karoti gçhnàti>% (%<grah>%, c. 9.) or %<bravãti>% (%<brå>%, c. 2.), etc.; still n.s that wretch: %<adyàpi tasyaiva pàpasya nàma gçhvàti>%, Mr. viii.
     III To appoint, fix.: %<nàmnà nirdi÷ati>% (%<di÷>%, c. 6.).

#<NAMED># (adj.):
     1 %<nàma>% (rarely %<nàmnà>% = by name); n. Vimardaka: %<vimardako nàma>%, D. ii.; a town n. Valabhi: %<valamã nàma nagarã>%, D. vi.;
     2 by comp., of a swan n. Karpårakeli: %<karpårakelinàmno ràjahaüsasya>%, H.: v. Also to call.

#<NAMELESS>#:
     1 %<anàmakaþ>% (%<kà kaü>%);
     2 %<nàmahãnaþ>% (%<nà naü>%) and sim. comp.s.: v. Name.

#<NAMELY>#: animals are of two kinds, n., worldly and free: %<jãvà dvividhàþ saüsàriõo muktà÷ca>%, D. s. iii.; some say truths are seven, n., animate and inanimate beings, allurement, bond, control, casting off and emancipation: %<kecana sapta tattvànãti varõayanti tadàha jãvàjãvàsravabandhasaüvaranirjaramokùàstattvànãti>%, D. s.; there are two ways of correcting disaffective people, n., favour and chastisement: %<iha khalu viraktànàü prakçtãnàü dvividhaü pratividhànam tadyathànugraho nigraha÷ce ti>%; it is of two kinds, n., visible and invisible: %<tad dvividhaü dçùñàdçùñabhedàt>%, D. s. xi.

#<NATIVE># (adj.):

     II Born with one:
     1 %<sahajaþ>% (%<jà jaü>%), n. unsteadiness: %<sahajacàpalam>%, Si.;

#<NATURAL># (adj.):
     I In gen.:
     1 %<svàbhàvikaþ>% (%<kã kaü>%), n. fragrance: %<svàbhàvikaü sauramyam>%, R.;
     2 %<naisargikaþ>% (%<kã kaü>%), n. opposition: %<naisargiko virodhaþ>%, R. vi. 46.;
     3 %<sahajaþ>% (%<jà jaü>%) (= born with one), n. affection: %<sahajasnehaþ>%, Ki.;
     4 %<prakçtisiddha>% (f. %<ddhà>%), this is n. for great men: %<prakçtisiddhamidaü hi mahàtmanàm>%, H.;
     5 %<nisargajaþ>% (%<jà jaü>%), etc. (rare), n. friend: %<svabhàvajaü mitram>%, H.; n. death: %<svàmàvikamçtyuþ>%; n. caves or reservoir: %<devakhàtam>%. Ph.: it is n. for... better expr. by subs.: v. Nature (V). II. Of the nature: %<pràkçtikaþ>% (%<kã kaü>%); %<prakçti->% in comp.
     III Resembling the object imitated: %<svaråpa->% in comp.: v. True.
     IV Illegitimate:
     1 %<gåóhajaþ>% (%<jà jaü>%) (born in private), Y.;
     2 %<*bãjajaþ>% (%<jà jaü>%) (after %<kùetrajaþ>%). Miscell.: n. history: %<*pràõitattvam>%; n. philosophy: %<*padàrthavij¤ànam>%; n. theology: %<*pràkçtaü brahmadar÷anam>%; n. order: %<*prakçta÷reõiþ>%.

#<NATURALIZE>#:
     I To make as if native: %<de÷ãyaü>% (f. %<yàü>%) %<karoti>% (?); n.d German: %<*labdhajarmanàdhikàraþ; jarmanãkçtaþ>%.
     II To adopt: %<svãkaroti>%.
     III To adapt: %<upayuktaü>% (f. %<ktàü>%) %<karoti>%.

#<NATURALLY>#:
     I By nature:
     1 by comp., for bad men are n. not friend of the good: %<prakçtyamitrà hi satàmasàdhavaþ>%, Ki.; n. complaisant: %<nisargadakùiõa>% (f. %<õà>%), Si. xv. 68.;
     2 %<svamàvataþ>%;
     3 %<prakçtyà>%;
     4 %<nisargeõa>%.
     II By birth: q. v.: %<janmanà>%.
     III Without addition: a new cloud is n. beautiful: %<kevalo'pi subhago navàmbudaþ>%, R. ii. 80.; pearls are n. pleasing to the eye: %<pràgeva muktà nayanàbhiràmàþ>%, R. xvi. 69.
     IV Spontaneously: %<svataþ>%, good men are n. bent for others: %<svata eva satàü paràrthatà>%, N. ii. 61. V. As a natural consequence: perh. %<svata eva>%: v. Indisputably, necessarily.

#<NATURE>#:
     I The creation, the universe: q. v.: %<sçùñiþ>%.
     II The original cause: %<prakçtiþ>%.
     III Kind, sort: q. v.: %<prakàraþ>%.
     IV Substance, purport: q. v.: %<bhàvaþ>%. V. Natural constitution:
     1 %<svabhàvaþ>%, for n. is at the head above all qualities: %<atãtya hi guõàn sarvàn svamàvo mårdhni vartate>%, H.;
     2 %<prakçtiþ>%, it is the n. of the great: %<prakçtiþ khalu sà mahãyasaþ>%, Ki.;
     3 %<nisargaþ>% (mostly as =adv.), this grove is beautiful by n.: %<nisargaramaõãyo'yamàràmaþ>%, Pra.;
     4 %<bhàvaþ>% in comp., of impure n.: %<a÷uddhabhàvaþ>% (%<và vaü>%) Mah.;
     5 %<÷ãlam>% (mostly in comp.), for it is the n. of inebriety and insanity: %<÷ãlaü hi madonmàdayoþ>%, D. ii.; bad n.d: %<duþ÷ãlaþ>% (%<là laü>%).
     VI Essential n.: %<svaråpam>%, n. of the soul: %<àtmasvaråpam>%, S. vii. Ph.: to attend to, satisfy a call of n.: %<maitraü karoti>%, V. p. iii. 13. 8.; %<÷aucaü karoti>%, Mah. s. 193. 4.

     1 %<upa->% in comp., n. Bhaimã: %<upabhaimi>%, N.;

#<NEAR># (adj.):
     I In time: %<àsanna>% (f. %<nnà>%), "n. death": %<àsannamçtyu>% (mfn.), M. n.: v. Approaching.
     II In place:
     1 %<nikañastha>% (f. %<sthà>%);
     2 %<samãpavartin>% (f. %<nã>%), very n. the fire of heartache: %<*samãpataravarti hçdaya÷okàgneþ>%, K.;
     3 %<àsanna>% (f. %<nnà>%), %<prati->%, at heart, yet not n.: %<hçdayasthamanàsannama>%, R.;
     4 %<sannihitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%), and here (her) superior is not n.: %<na ca sannihito'tra gurujanaþ>%, Sa.;
     5 %<sannikçùñaþ>% (%<ùñà ùñaü>%);
     6 %<abhyarõa>% (f. %<rõà>%) (rare);
     7 %<upoóha>% (f. %<óhà>%) (rare).
     III Intimate, dear: q. v.: %<àsanna>% (f. %<nnà>%) (?), does not admit me in n. concerns: %<na màmàsannakàryeùvabhyantarãkaroti>%, D. viii.
     IV Of roads: perh. %<àsanna>% (f. %<nnà>%); %<sannihita>% (f. %<tà>%): v. Straight.
     V Of relation: %<nikañaþ>% (%<ñà ñaü>%), n. relation: %<nikañabandhuþ>%.
     VI Close-fisted: q. v.

#<NEAR># (adv.):
     I Not remote: to be n.: %<samãpe vartate>%, Sa.; came n. the king: %<ràjàntikamàjagàma>%, K.; caming n.er and n.er: %<antikàntikagataþ>% (%<tà taü>%), Ki. ix. 21.; keep him n.: %<taü pàr÷ve karoti>%, K.; n. situated: %<nikañastha>% (f. %<sthà>%). N.B. Note the use of acc. after verbs of motion and of loc. after other verbs.
     II Nearly: q. v.

#<NEAR># (v.): %<upasarati>% (%<sç>%, c. 1.), K.: v. To approach.

     I Within a little:
     1 %<pràyaþ>% (= almost: q. v.), n. dead: %<mçtapràyaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%);

     II Closely: expr. with adj.: v. Near (VI)
     III Pressingly: %<bhç÷am>%.

     2 %<gorakùakaþ>%: v. Cowherd.

#<NEATNESS>#:
     1 %<÷obhanatà>%: v. Fineness, elegance;
     2 %<÷uddhatà>%: v. Cleanness.

#<NEBULA>#: %<*gaganakalaïkaþ>%.

#<NECESSARIAN>#:
     1 %<daiùñikaþ>%;
     2 %<daivapramàõakaþ>% (= fatalist).

     2 %<*ava÷yambhavavàdaþ>%.

#<NECESSARILY>#:
     1 %<ava÷yam>%: v. Must;
     2 %<niyatam>%: v. Certainly.

#<NECESSARY># (adj.):
     I Subs., as must be:
     1 %<ava÷yambhàvin>% (f. %<nã>%);
     2 %<ava÷yamavya>% (f. %<vyà>%), in (all) n. (matters): %<ava÷yabhavyeùu>%, N. i. 120.
     II Indispensable, requisite:
     1 %<àva÷yakãyaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%), satisfying the n. calls of nature: %<÷aucamàva÷yakaü kçtvà>%, Mah. s. 193. 4.;
     2 %<prayojanãyaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%).
     III Not free: %<paravat>% (f. %<tã>%): v. Dependent.

#<NECESSARY># (subs.):
     I Anything n.: expr. by adj.
     II A privy: q. v.

#<NECESSITARIAN>#: %<*ava÷yambhavavàdin>% (f. %<nã>%): v. Necessarian.

#<NECESSITATE>#:
     I To compel: q. v.: expr. with %<balàt>%.
     II To make indispensable: expr. by adj.

#<NECESSITIOUS>#: %<niþsva>% (f. %<svà>%): v. Indigent.

     I Unavoidableness: %<ava÷yambhàvità>%.
     II Requisiteness: %<àva÷yakãyatà>%.
     III Indigence: %<dainyam>%.
     IV Anything necessary: %<prayojanam>%.
     V Fate, fatality:
     1 %<diùñam>%;
     2 %<mavitavyatà>%, V.;
     3 %<niyatiþ>%, J.

#<NECK>#:

     1 %<grãvà>%, long n.ed: %<dãrghagrãva>% (f. %<và>%), U.; with the n. turned up: %<udgrãva>% (f. %<và>%), Ki. vii. 22.;
     2 %<galaþ>%, putting his feet on our n.s: %<kçtvà padaü no gale>%, Mu. iii.; who will seize him by the n. (and turn him out): %<ya enaü galahastayati>%, H. iii. or %<arddhacandraü dattvà niþsàrayati>%, P. i. 3.;
     3 %<kaõañhaþ>% (= throat), like a medal on his n.: %<asya kaõñhe niùkamiva>%, Ku. ii. 49.;
     4 %<kandharà>% (rare);
     5 %<÷irodharà>% (poet.).
     II Of a vessel: %<galaþ>%.

     III Exactness, accuracy: %<vi÷uddhatà>%.
     IV Fineness, minuteness: %<såkùmatà>%: v. Fastidiousness: %<såkùmapriyatà>%.
     V Delicate management: perh. %<vaidagdhyam>%.

#<NICHE>#: perh. %<takram>% (comp. Bengali %<tàk>%).

#<NIGHT>#:

#<NO># (adv.): %<na>%, no, no, become the ornament of my lap: %<na na madutsaïgavibhåùaõaü bhava>%, N. ix. 114.; and to say 'no, no' to one like you would be rebuking: %<na neti ca tvàdç÷i vàg vigarhçõà>%, N. ix. 25.; to this we say 'no': %<atrocyate 'na'>%, S.; there is no greater fault than this: %<nàtaþ parataro doùaþ>%, H. N.B. Use 'yes' in Sanskrit for 'no' after negative interrogation, 'has not this come to Chandragupta's ears? No, Sir: %<na khalu vçùalasya ÷ravaõamupagato'yaü..àrya aya kim>%, Mu. iii.

     2 %<a>% (or %<an>% before vowels), if forced no evidence: %<balàtkàritamapramàõam>%, V.s.; paying no attention: %<anàdçtya>%, Sa.; seeing no other recourse; %<anyadupàyàntaramapa÷yan>%, K.

#<OF>#:
     I Denoting relation: expr. by gen. or tat. comp., daughter of the king of Kàsi: %<kà÷iràjaputrã>%, V.; speed of a chariot: %<rathasya vegaþ>%, Sa.; conquest of Tripura: %<tripuravijayaþ>%, Me. N. B. (a) do not use gen. when one subs. is in apposition with another: all of us: %<sarve vayam>%, K.; entered the city of Oudh: %<puramavi÷adayodhyàm>%, R.; the island of Ceylon: %<siühaladvãpaþ>%, Kar.; in the m. of Fàlguna or Chaitra: %<phàlgune caitre và màsi>%, K. b.; (b) expr. by an adj. or bah. when it introduces an attributive clause, a man of wealth: %<dhanã>%; of great strength: %<mahàbalaþ>% (%<là laü>%); of many kinds: %<nànàvidhaþ>% (%<dhà dhaü>%); (c) expr. by a deriv. when it indicates a man's abode: a man of Oudh: %<àyodhyikaþ>%, U.; nobody of this place: %<na ka÷cidihatyaþ>%, D.: v. Inhabitant; (d) part. in %<uka>% (except %<kàmuka>%) take an acc., killer of demons: %<daityàn ghàtukaþ>%, S. k.
     II About, concerning: q.v.: expr. by gen., what would one say of the other: %<kiü bhaõatveka ekasya>%, Sa.; do you remember of your master: %<kaccidbhartuþ smarasi>%, Me.
     III Made of: q.v.:
     1 by tat. comp., a house of crystal: %<yatra sphañikaharmyam>%, Ki.;
     2 %<-mayaþ>% (%<yã yaü>%), a vessel of clay: %<mçnmayaü pàtram>%, R.;
     3 by deriv., surely my heart is of iron: %<nånaü hçdayaü mamàyasam>%, Ram.
     IV In partitive sense:
     1 by gen., by one of which: %<yeùàmekatamena>%, P.;
     2 by loc., of the kingdoms you have seen: %<bhavaddyùñeùu ràùñreùu>%, D.;
     3 gen. expr. by comp. when of follows a superlative, best of men: %<puruùottamaþ>% (%<mà maü>%), A.r.; greatest of all: %<sarvamahat>% (f. %<tã>%), S. k. #<ON># (prep.):
     I In contact with:
     1 by loc., lying on a grass bed: %<saüviùñaþ ku÷a÷ayane>%, R.; putting on his head: %<÷irasyàropya>%; Vi.; to fall on the ground: %<bhåmau patati>%, Mr.;
     2 %<upari>% (= over: q.v.): (with gen.), to throw on Vairodhaka: %<vairodhakasyopari nipàtanàya>%, Mu. N. B. The ins. must be used after verbs of motion: to go on horse: %<a÷vena gacchati>%, S.; carrying on his shoulders: %<skandhenodåhya>%, D.; take me to (our) house on a fresh cloud: %<naya màü navena vasatiü payomucà>%, V. II. = at, near:
     1 by loc., a cow-station on the Ganges: %<gaïgàyàü ghoùaþ>%, Kav.; on the north: %<uttarasyàü di÷i>%, Ku.;
     2 by affix %<tas>%, on the right: %<dakùiõataþ>%; on the left: %<vàmataþ>%; on the rear: %<pçùñhataþ>%; on both sides: %<ubhayataþ>%.
     III At the time of: by loc., on the first of âshàóha: %<àùàóhasya prathamadivase>%, Me.; on the following day: %<parasminnahani>% (or commonly, %<paredyuþ>%).
     IV = after: q.v.: by loc. abs., on her departure: %<gatàyàü tasyàm>%, K. V. Denoting logical basis of connexion: expr. by ins., on one condition: %<ekenàbhisandhinà>%, Sa.; on oath: %<÷apathena>% (?).
     VI Concerning: q.v.: expr. by comp., a treatise on spheres: %<golaprabandhaþ>%, Go.
     VII To denote various relations: v. The several verbs after which it is used. Miscell.: on high: %<uccaiþ>%; on a sudden: %<sapadi>%; on the wing: v. To fly; on the alert: %<sàvadhànaþ>% (%<nà naü>%); on hand: %<hastagataþ>% (%<tà taü>%); the gods were on (the side of) Arjuna: %<devà arjunato'bhavan>%, S. k.

#<ON># (adv.):
     I After verbs: gen. not expr.
     II Attached to the body: %<aïge>%. Ph.: and so on: %<ityàdi>% (mfn.).

#<ONE>#:
     I In gen. sense:
     1 %<ekaþ>% (%<kà kaü>%), not o. of you: %<bhavatsu naikam>%, N. xiv. 44.; in o. hollow: %<ekasmin koñare>%, K.; one-horse carriage: %<ekà÷vayànam>% and sim. comp.s. (?);
     2 %<ekaikaþ>% (%<kà kaü>%) (distributive), takes one Dinàr every day: %<pratidinamekaikaü dãnàraü gçhõàti>%, P.; gave o. code to each: %<ekaikàü saühitàmaikakasmai dadau>%, B. p. One of two: %<ekataraþ>% (%<rà raü>%), one of many: %<ekatamaþ>% (%<mà mat>%), even by o. of which: %<yeùàmekatamenàpi>%, P. v. 3. One by one: %<ekaika÷aþ>%, A. r. O. day: %<ekadà>%, K. At o. time: %<ekasmin samaye>%, L.
     II In contrast to other or another: %<ekaþ>% (%<kà kaü>%), the o. brought the kings under subjection, the other . %<eko nçpatãn va÷amanayat | apara .>%, R. viii. 19.; one is grinding paints, another stringing flowers: %<ekà varõakaü pinaùñi | aparà sumanaso gumphati>%, Mr.; their clans are fourteen; one is derived from the mind of Brahmà, another from the Vedas, another from the fire: %<tàsàü caturda÷a kulàni | ekaü kamalayonermanasaþ samutpannam anyadvedvebhyaþ saübhåtam anyadagne rudbhåtam>%, K.; what will o. say of the other: %<kiü bhaõati eka ekasya>%, Sa.; on the o. hand . on the other: %<ekatra . ekatra>% (better %<anyatra>% or %<aparatra>%), K.; on the o. hand . on the other: %<ekataþ . anyataþ>%, Vi. Ph.: at one time . at another time: %<kadàcit . kadàcit>%, R. III. Denoting identity: expr. by %<tad>%, but not the o.: %<na punaþ saþ>%, Mr.; I am the o.: %<so'hamasmi>%, D.: v. Same. Ph.: all the ethical systems are at one that innocence is a cardinal virtue: %<dharma÷àstràõàmahiüsà paramo dharma ityatraikamatyam>%, H.; the great-minded are one in mind, in word, in action: %<manasyekaü vacasyekaü karmaõyekaü mahàtmanàm>%, H. i. 100.
     IV In connexion with rel. pro.: expr. by %<tad>%, I do not see o. whom she has not embraced: %<na hi taü pa÷yàmi yo'nayà nopagåóhaþ>%, K. V. Equiv. to some o., any o.: %<ka÷cit>%: v. Any, some.
     VI In an indefinite sense (= men) %<janaþ>% or %<lokaþ>%, one would say: %<jano>% or %<loko vadiùyati>%. Ph.: (a) little ones: %<÷i÷avaþ>%: v. Child; (b) one-eyed: %<ekàkùa>% (f. %<kùã>%) or gen. %<kàõa>% (f. %<õà>%).

     1 %<samçddhi÷àlin>% (f. %<nã>%): v. Rich.

#<OR>#:
     I In gen.: %<và>%, whether child or pupil: %<÷i÷urvà ÷iùyà và>%, U. iv. 11.; whether God is spoken of in this passage or not: %<kiü brahmàsmin vàkye'bhidhãyate na veti>%, S. ii. 15.; from fear of the king or of thieves: %<ràjabhayàccauramayàdvà>%, Mr. iii.; or else: %<kiü và>%, Vi. vi. 21. (when=otherwise: %<nocet>%, H.).
     II In interrogation direct or implied: is it a dream, an illusion, or delusion of my mind: %<svapno nu màyà nu matibhramo nu>%, Sa.; is my strength gone or am I another: %<dhvastaü nu me vãryamutàhamanyaþ>%, Ki.; or is (she) going to live with hinds: %<àho nivatsyati samaü hariõàïganàbhiþ>%, Sa.; shall I kill him, or is he dreaming: %<kiü vyàpàdayàmyutotsvapnàyate>%, Mr. iii.; I do not know whether this is becoming of (your) bark or (your) matted hair, whether it befits (your) penances or it is a part of (your) religious observances: %<na jàne kimidaü valkalànàü sadç÷amutàho jañànàü samucitaü kiü tapaso'nuråpamàhosviddharmakarmàpade÷àïgamidam>%, K. (N. B. %<nu>% is interro. and not used in such cases).
     III Beginning a sentence: %<athavà>%, or to injure tender things: %<athavà mçdu vastu hiüsitum>%, R. viii. 45.
     IV In definitions or explanations: by %<ca>% or not expr., is called a fratricide or a brother-killer: %<bhràtçhà bhràtçghàtã càbhidhãyate>%.

     I Bursting forth: %<udbhedaþ>%.
     II A disturbance: %<saükùobhaþ>%.

#<OUTCAST>#:
     I An exile: %<niùkàsitaþ>% (%<tà taü>%).
     II = excommunicated: %<apapàtritaþ>% (%<tà taü>%).
     III = vagabond: %<khaõóitavçtta>% (f. %<ttà>%).

#<PACE># (subs.):
     I A step: q. v.: %<padam -nyàsaþ>%.
     II Gait:
     1 %<gatiþ>%, p. of a horse: %<a÷vasya gatiþ>%, M. n.; at a quick p.: %<drutagatyà>%;
     2 %<dhàrà>% (of horses), %<"pårõavegà tathà cànyà pa¤ca dhàràþ prakãrtitàþ">%, M. n. Ph.: to keep or hold p. with: %<saha calati>% (%<cal>%, c. 1.) (used in Bengali).
     III A measure: perh. %<padam>%.

     II A representation: %<*måkàbhinayaþ; làsyam>% (?).

     I In law: %<vibhàgaþ>%, deed of p.: %<vibhàgapatram>%, Vri. or %<bhàgalekhyam>%, Da.

     IV A compartment: %<koùñhaþ>%.

#<PERSON>#:
     I A human being:
     1 %<puruùaþ>% (not of woman), like an ordinary p.: %<puruùaþ pràkçto yathà>%, Mah. iv. 46. 13.;
     2 %<janaþ>%, this p. (i. e. I Pàrvatã): %<jano'yam>%, K. v. 64.: v. People, man. Ph.: in p.: %<svayam>%: v. Self.; to one's p. (= face): %<samakùe>%.
     II Body: q. v.: %<÷arãram>%, beauty of p.: %<÷arãra÷obhà>%, N. III. Form, character: q. v.: %<råpam>%, in the p. of Brihannalà: %<vçhannalàråpamupetya>%, Mah. iv. 67. 15.
     IV In gram.: %<puråùaþ>%, the first p.: %<uttamapuruùaþ>%; the second p.: %<madhyamapuruùaþ>%; the third p.: %<prathamapuruùaþ>%.

     II Bodily: q. v.: %<÷arãra->% in comp., p. charms: %<÷arãra÷obhà>%, N. III. Belonging to persons: expr. by comp. or gen.
     IV Done in person: %<svayaükçta>% (f. %<tà>%). V. Own: q. v.: for p. attendance: %<àtmadar÷anàrtham>%.
     VI Concerning individual character: I donot like your p. observations: %<amukaü lakùãkçtya yaduktaü tanme na rocate>%. Ph.: p. pronous: %<puruùavàcakàni sarvanàmàni>% (n. pl.); p. property: %<asthàvarasampattiþ>%.

#<PITY># (subs.): %<karaõà>% or %<kàruõyam>%: v. Mercy, kindness. Ph.: it is a great p.: %<idamatãva duþkhàkaram>%: v. Distressing.

#<PITY># (v.):

     3 %<reõuþ>%.

     2 %<daivapramàõakaþ>%, M. n.

#<PREDESTINATION>#:
     I The act.: expr. by circumlo.
     II The theory:
     1 %<daiùñikatà>%;
     2 often by %<daivam>% (= fate): q. v.

#<PREDESTINATE, PREDESTINE>#: expr. by circumlo., how could you so cruelly p. my separation from my beloved: %<kathaü viyokùyase vallabhayeti nirgatà lipirlalàñantapaniùñhuràkùarà>%, N. i. 138.

#<PREDETERMINE>#: %<pårvaü ni÷cinoti>% (%<ci>%, c. 5.): v. To determine.

#<PREDICABLE>#: expr. by circumlo.: v. To predicate.

#<PREDICAMENT>#:
     I Logical: %<padàrthaþ>%, Par.
     II Condition: q. v.: %<da÷à>%.

#<PREDICATE>#:
     I Subs.:
     1 %<vidheyam>%, Kav.;
     2 %<vi÷eùaõam>%, M. n. on si. i. 48.
     II Verb: perh. %<anuvadati>% (%<vad>%, c. 1.: %<anuvàdya>% = subject, Kav.); %<uddi÷ya vadati>% (%<vad>%, c. 1.) or %<vakti>% (%<vac>%, c. 2.),

#<PREDICT>#:
     I To foretell: I. p. ed his death: %<tasya maraõaü mayà pårvameva kathitam>%: v. To tell, before.
     II To forbode: q. v.

#<PREDICTION>#: %<uktiþ>% (= saying: exact sense from context).

#<PREDILECTION>#: %<pakùapàtaþ>%: v. Liking, partiality.

#<PREDISPOSITION>#: %<bhàvaþ>%: v. Inclination.

     1 %<prabalatà>%;
     2 %<prabhutvam>% (= dominion);
     3 %<àdhikyam>% (in number).

     2 %<prabhaviùõu>% (mfn.: in power).

     1 %<sarva÷reùñha>%

#<PREFACE># (subs.): %<mukhabandhaþ>%. N. B. %<vij¤àpanam>% and %<upakramaõikà>% used by modern writers. S. p. b. has %<bhåmikà>%.

#<PREFER>#:
     I To offer, address: to p. a charge: %<abhiyogaü karoti>% or %<nivedayati>% (= to inform).
     II To advance, raise: q. v.: %<unnamayati>% (c. of %<nam>%), p. your friends: %<unnamaya svabandhuvargam>%, Ki.
     III To regard more: %<bahu>% (much) or %<adhikam>% (more) %<manyate>% (%<man>%, c. 4.): v. Also to excel.
     IV To like more: %<adhikaü rocate>% (%<ruc>%, c. 1.: with dat. of the person): v. Also better.

#<PREDERABLE>#: expr. with %<varam>%, a forest is p. to a life of poverty among friends: %<varaü vanaü......na bandhumadhye dhanahãnajãvitam>%, H.: v. Better (II), to prefer.

     III In law: perh. %<sambhàvanà anumànam>% (= inference).

#<PRESUMPTIVE>#: Perh. %<sambhàvita>% (f. %<tà>%); %<ànumànika>% (f. %<kã>%).

#<PRESUMPTIVELY>#: expr. by circumlo., p. he is guilty: %<sambhàvyate sa pàpã>%.

     1 %<sàhasika>% (f. %<kã>%): v. Bold;

     I To feign:

     1 %<rakùati saü- abhi- pari- prati->%, (%<rakù>%, c. 1.), shall always p. self even at the expense of wife and wealth: %<àtmànaü satataü rakùeddàrairapi dhanairapi>%, M. vii. 213;

     I Lit.:

     1 %<à÷rayaþ>%;
     2 %<÷araõam>%, how can I seek another for p.: %<kathaü prapatsye ÷araõàrthamanyam>%, R. xiv. 64.
     III In commerce: %<svade÷apaõyarakùàrthaü vide÷ãyapaõyànàmuparyadhika÷ulkasaüsthàpanam>%.

#<PROTECTIVE>#: expr. by comp., p. duties: %<*rakùà÷ulkàni>%.

#<PROTECTOR, PROTECTRESS>#:
     1 %<rakùaka>% (f. %<kùikà>%); %<saü- pari->%;
     2 %<rakùitç>% (f. %<trã>%), %<saü- pari->%;
     3 %<goptç>% (f. %<ptrã>%);
     4 %<gopàyaka>% (f. %<yikà>%).

#<PROTECTORATE>#: perh. %<÷àsanam>%, during his p.: %<÷àsati tasmin>%.

#<PROTEGE># (f. ee):
     1 %<à÷rita>% (f. %<tà>%);
     2 perh. %<pàlita>% (f. %<tà>%).

#<PROTEST># (v.)
     I To avow, assert: q. v,: %<pratijànãte>% (%<j¤à>%, c. 9.).
     II To p. against: %<viruddhaü vadati>% (%<vad>%, c. 1.: with gen.).

#<PROTEST># (subs.): perh. %<viruddhavàdaþ>% or %<prativàdaþ>%.

#<PROTESTANT>#: %<*romakamataprativàdin>% (f. %<nã>%).

#<PROTESTANTISM>#: %<*romakamataprativàdaþ>%.

#<PROTOCOL>#: perh. %<àdilekhaþ>%.

#<PROTOTYPE>#:
     I Lit.: %<àdar÷aþ>%.
     II Of men.: perh. %<guruþ>%.

#<PROTRACT>#:
     I To prolong: %<vitanoti>% (%<tan>%, c. 5.).
     II To delay: q. v.: %<vilambayati>% (c. of %<lamb>%). P. ed.: i. e. long: %<sudãrgha>% (f. %<rghà>%).

#<PROTRUDE>#:
     I Trans.:
     1 %<prasàrayati>% (c. of %<sç>%);
     2 perh. %<nirgamayati>% (c. of %<gam>%).
     II Intrans:
     1 %<udbhidyate>% (pass. of %<bhid>%);
     2 %<niþsarati>% (%<sç>%, c. 1.).

#<PROTRUSION>#:
     1 %<prasàraõam>% (= stretching);
     2 %<udbhedaþ>% (= coming out).

#<PROTUBERANCE>#:
     I Tumour: %<sphoñaþ>%.
     II Prominence, projection: q. v.

#<PROTUBERANT>#:
     1 %<unnata>% (f. %<tà>% = raised);
     2 %<pralamba>% (f. %<mbà>% = projecting.)

     I In good sense:

     2 %<mànavat>% (f. %<tã>%), %<abhi->%, Ki.

     2 %<dçpta>% (f. %<ptà>%);

     4 %<sagarva>% (f. %<rvà>%);
     5 %<darpavat>% (f. %<tã>%); etc.

#<PROUDLY>#:
     1 %<sagarvam>%;
     2 %<sadarpam>%;
     3 %<sàhaïkàram>%.

#<PROVE># (v. t.):
     I To test: q. v.: %<parãkùate>% (%<ãkù>%, c. 1.).
     II To establish: q. v.:
     1 %<pratipàdayati>% (c. of %<pad>%), in the first chapter, we have p. d that He is the soul of all us: %<prathame'dhyàye sa eva sarveùàü na àtmaitat pratipàditam>%, S. ii. 1.;
     2 %<sàdhayati>% (c. of %<sidh>%), a thing may be p. d without (regular) proof: %<asatàpi pramàõena vastu sudhyati>%, S. p. b.;
     3 %<vi-bhàvayati>% (c. l. of %<bhå>% rare), and does not p. what he asserts: %<ukta¤ca na vibhàvayet>%, M. viii. 56.: v. Also to shew.
     III To verify: %<pramàõayati>% (nomi.), p. ing what Yudhiùñhira said: %<pramàõayan vàkyamajàta÷atroþ>%, Ki. iii. 24.
     IV To suffer: q. v.: %<sahate>% (%<sah>%, c. 1.).

#<PROVE># (v. i.):
     1 often by %<bhavati>% (= to become);
     2 by circumlo., it has p. d to be false; %<tadavaimi kaitavam>%, Ku. iv. 9.: v. Also to turn out.

     V To burst out: %<udbhinatti>% (%<bhid>%, c. 7.).

#<PUSH ON>#:
     I Intrans., to hasten, proceed: q. v.: %<tvarate>% (%<tvar>%, c. 1.).
     II Trans., to urge, hasten: q. v.: %<praõodayati>% (c. of %<nud>%).

#<PUSH># (subs.):
     I A thrust: q. v.: %<àvedhaþ>%.
     II Any pressure or force applied: %<àdhàtaþ abhighàtaþ>%, or %<samàdhàtaþ>%.
     III P. ing aside: %<apasàraõam>%.
     IV Vigorous effort: %<abhiyogaþ>%. V. Extremity, emergency: %<saïkañam>%.

#<PUT>#:
     I To place:
     1 %<sthàpayati>% (= to place), p. it in the treasure box: %<koùapeñake sthàpayainam>%, V.;
     2 %<ni- dadhàti>% or %<dhatte>% (%<dhà>%, c. 3 (gen. on something low), p. ting your feet on (my) lap: %<aïke te caraõau nidhàya>%, Sa.;

     4 %<arpayati sam->%, (c. of %<ç>%) (= to give), p. s the noose on the necks: %<kaõñhe pà÷amarpayati>%, Na.;

     7 %<nive÷ayati saü->%, (c. of %<vi÷>% to lay), if I p. it in its proper place: %<yadadãmahameva yathàsthànaü nive÷ayàmi>%, Sa. iii.;
     8 %<nyasyati vi->%, (%<as>%, c. 4 = 7.), shall p. on the ground: %<bhåmau vinyaset>%, M. iii. 226.
     II To cause to be: to p. to death: %<vyàpàdayati>% (c. of %<pad>%): v.      III To incite, urge: q. v.: %<pravartayati>% (c. of %<vçt>%).

     1 %<pàdaþ>%, three q.s: %<pàdatrayam>%, Li.; with a third, a half and a q. of a quantity: %<rà÷itryaü÷asàrdhapàdaiþ>%, Li.;

     4 %<caturthabhàgaþ>%.
     II Of the heaven:
     1 %<di÷>% (f.: best equiv.), north-east q. (lit. of øiva): %<ai÷ànã dik>%, V. from various q.s.: %<nànàdigde÷àt>%, H.; in every q.: %<pratidi÷am>%, Ki. xiv. 64.; intermediate q.: %<vidi÷>% (rare);
     2 %<à÷à>% (f.), the eastern q. (lit. of Indra): %<vàsavà÷à>%, Si. xi. 16.;
     3 %<kàùñhà>%, the northern q.: %<udicã kàùñhà>%, Ki. iii. 55.;
     4 %<kakubh>% (f.), the q.s.: %<kakubhà¤cakravàlaþ>%, Si. xx. 14.;
     5 %<harit>% (f.).
     III A region: q. v.: %<de÷aþ>%.
     IV In pl., abode, residence:
     1 %<nivàsaþ>%, the lord's q. s. shone in tents: %<pramornivàsàþ pañave÷mabhirbabhuþ>%, Si. xii. 63.;
     2 %<nive÷aþ>% (of an army), the q.s. of an army: %<senànive÷àþ>%, M.n.;
     3 %<sthànam>% (= place: q. v.). Ph.: Head-q. s.: perh. %<pradhànasthalam>% and sim. comp.s.
     V Indulgence to an adversary: to give q.: perh. %<dayàü dar÷ayati>%; and shall give q. to (lit. not strike) those who do not fight or are eunuchs, or have no weapons, or are cowards or run away, or ask for q. (lit. say "we are yours"): %<nàyudhyamànaü hanyàcca na klãvaü na niràyudham | na bhãtaü na paràvçttaü na tavàsbãti vàdinam ||>%, M. vii. 91-3.
     VI Of the year:
     1 %<trimàsam>%;
     2 %<màsatrayam>%.
     VII Of the moon's period: expr. by %<÷ukla->% and %<kçùõaspakùaþ>% (light, dark fortnight),
     VIII Of an animal: no equiv.: %<pàdaþ>% may be used. Ph.: at close q. s.: %<mithaþ pratyàsanna>% (f. %<nnà>%), M. n.; came to close q.s.: %<bàhåbàhavi vyàsçjetàm>% (lit. engaged arm to arm), Si. xviii. 12.

#<QUOTE># (v.):
     1 %<uddharati>% or %<udàharati>% (%<hç>%, c. 1.);
     2 %<upanyasyati>% (%<as>%, c. 4.);
     3 %<avatàrayati>% (%<té>%, c. 10. = to being down), Yàska having q.d Vedic passages: %<yàskena vedavàkyànàmavatàritatvàt>%, Say.;

#<REALLY>#:
     I In truth:
     1 %<yathàrthataþ>%;
     2 %<paramàrthataþ>%;
     3 %<satyam>%.
     II In reality:
     1 %<tattvataþ>%;
     2 %<vastutaþ>% (= in fact), S. p. b. 1. 69.

#<REASON># (subs.):
     I The intellect;
     1 %<vivekaþ>% (good r.);
     2 %<buddhiþ>%: v. Intellect;
     3 %<matiþ>%: v. Mind;
     4 %<praj¤à>%: v. Wisdom;
     5 %<vyutpattiþ>%, of men endowed with r.: %<vyutpattimatàü puruùàõàm>%, S. II. Ground, motive, cause:
     1 %<hetuþ>%, speaks of its r. s in the (following) Såtras: %<atra hetånàha såtraiþ>%, S. p. b.;
     2 %<kàraõam>%: v. Cause;
     3 %<nimittam>% (= ground), say for what r.: %<kathaya kasminnimitte>%. Ph.: (a) for what r.: %<kinnimittam>%: v. Why; (b) without r.: %<akàraõam nirarthakam>%, (c) by r. of by abl.: v. Account of, on; (d) for that, this r.: %<tadartham etadartham>% or %<tannimittam etannimittam>%; (e) for some r. (lit. with some object): %<kenàpi kàmena>%, Ku. i. 57.
     III Argument:
     1 %<hetuþ>%, crushing the opponent's r. s: %<parapakùahetånunmathya>%, S.;
     2 %<yuktiþ>%, to prove some doctrine by mere r. s.: %<kevalàbhiryu ktibhiþ ka¤cit siddhàntaü sàdhayitum>%, S.;
     3 %<upapattiþ>%, r. s have been forcibly adduced: %<upapattirudàhçtà balàt>%, Ki. ii. 28.
     IV Justice, propriety: q. v.

     I To regain:
     1 %<labhate>% (%<labh>%, c. 1. = to gain: q. v.), spoke to her when she r. ed her consciousness: %<labdhacetànàmavàdãt>%, K.; let him r. his eye-sight: %<sa labdhacakùurbhavet>%, Mah. iii. 297. 27.; if you r. your possession: %<yadi labdhà punaràtmanaþ padam>%, Ki. ii. 17.;
     2 %<a÷nute sam->%, (%<a÷>%, c. 5.: rare), if (one) r. s his health: %<yadyarogitàü sama÷nute>%, Si. xiv. 13.
     II To cure: q. v.

     4 %<vyàkùepaþ>%;

     6 %<pratyàkhyànam>% (gainsaying).

#<REFUTE># (v.):
     1 %<niràkaroti>%, r. d evidence produced by a claimant by counter-evidence: %<vàdikçtaü pramàõamanyairniràkarot prabhàõaiþ>%, Si. xx. 18.;
     2 %<nirasyati ut- vyut->%, the weapon of the defeated is to be thus r. d: %<anena bhagnasyàstraü nirasanãyam>%, Khaõóana Khaõóa;
     3 %<prati-kùipati vi->%, (%<kùip>%, c. 6.), r. ing this doctrine: %<tamimaü pakùaü pratikùipantaþ>%, D. s. vii.;
     4 %<khaõóayati pari- vi->%, (%<khaõóa>%, c. 10. = to break, defeat);
     5 %<bàdhate pra->%, (%<bàdh>%, c. l. = to oppose), as it cannot be r. d by inference etc.: %<anumànàdibhirabàdhyatvàt>%, M. n. on Ki. xi. 39;
     6 %<pratyàkhyàti>% (%<khyà>%, c. 2.): v. To contradict.

#<REFUTER>#:
     1 %<niràkartç>% (f. %<rtrã>%);
     2 %<niràsakàrin>% (f. %<õã>%);

     2 better by adj. or circumlo.

#<RELIGIOUSNESS>#:

     4 %<prati>% (%<tã>%) %<kàraþ>% or %<-kriyà>% (= requital), in order to take r.: %<praticikãrùayà>%, Ki. xi. 74.; if unforgivingness had not supported r.: %<yadyamarùaþ pratãkàraü bhujàlambaü na lambhayet>%, Ki. xi. 57.

     2 %<va¤caka>% (f. %<¤cikà>% = cheat), where is the r. now: %<sa va¤cakaþ kvàste>%, H.;

     5 %<durjanaþ>% (= bad man).

     1 %<dhårtatà>%;
     2 %<khalatà>%;

#<ROLL># (v. t.):

     2 %<saüpuñãkaroti>%.

     1 %<gandhaþ>%, with the mere s.: %<gandhamàtreõa>%, Sa. iii.; sweet s. ed: %<sugandhin>% (mfn.), Bha.; therefore it is not consonant to implicate here even the s. of action: %<tasmàt kriyàyà gandhamàtrasyàpyanuprave÷a iha noppadyate>%, S.;

#<SENSATION>#:
     I In philo.: nearest word %<pratyakùam>%, s. is of six kinds involving smell, taste, sight, touch, hearing, and mind: %<ghràõajaü ràsanaü càkùuùaü spàr÷anaü ÷rautraü mànasamiti ùaóvidhaü pratyakùam>%, Par.
     II Consciousness: q. v.: %<cetanà>%.
     III Perception, knowledge: q. v.: %<upalabdhiþ>%.
     IV A great impression: expr. by circumlo.: it created s. at the time: %<*janamanastatkàlamàcakarùaitat>%.

#<SENSATIONAL>#: s. theory: %<pratyakùamatam>%; s. novel: %<*hçdayakùobhikàkhyàyikà>%.

#<SENSATIONALIST>#:
     1 %<pratyakùavàdin>% (f. %<nã>%).

#<SENSE>#:
     I Organ: %<indriyam>%, s. of touch: %<spar÷endriyam>%; s. of taste: %<rasanendriyam>%; etc. Ph.: to deprive one of the s. of sight: %<cakùuùã uddharati>% (with gen.), D.; and sound is the object of (the s. of) hearing: %<÷abdo'pi gocaraþ ÷ruteþ>%, Par. 53.
     II Perception, feeling: %<upalabdhiþ>%. Ph.: to have s. of: %<cetayate>%, D. viii. or %<pa÷yati>% (= to see: q. v.).
     III Soundness of the faculties: common s.: %<vivekaþ>%; moral s.: %<dharmabuddhiþ>% (?); to recover s. s: %<saüj¤àü labhate>%, Ma. ix.; loss of s. s: %<dhãvibhramaþ>%, Bha; one who has lost the s. of honour by decrepitude: %<jaràvaluptamànàvamànacitaþ>%, D. i.
     IV Meaning:
     1 %<artha:>%, otherwise the plural "daughters" has no s.: %<anyathà duhitara iti bahuvacanamanarthakam>%, Da. 141.; do not take the saying in its real sense: %<paramàrthena na gçhyatàü vacaþ>%, Sa. ii. 19.; have you comprehended its literal s.: %<api gçhãto bhavatàkùaràrthaþ>%, Sa. v.; as the word %<api>% is not described in the s. of %<eva: api÷abdasyaivakàràrthe'varõanàt>%, Da.; a vocabulary of words having various s. s: %<nànàrtha÷abdakoùaþ>%, Medini;
     2 by sim. loc. in lexicons, %<ratna>% conveys the s. of 'superior' as well as of 'gem': %<ratnaü ÷reùñhe bhaõàvapi>%, Vi÷va;
     3 %<màvaþ>%. (= purport).

#<SENSIBLE>#:
     I Perceptible:
     1 %<indriyagràhya>% (f. %<hyà>%);
     2 %<indriyagocara>% (f. %<rà>%); and sim. comp. s.
     II Capable of perceiving: %<viùayagràhin>% (f. %<õã>%) and sim. comp.s. To be s. of = to perceive, feel: q. v.
     III Intelligent, shrewd: q. v.: %<buddhimat>% (f. %<tã>%).
     IV As of replies: %<upayukta>% (f. %<ktà>%): v. Proper, suitable.

     II).

     II Carnal: expr. with %<viùaya>% or %<indriya>% in comp., became indifferent to s. pleasures: %<viùayeùu niþspçho'bhavat>%, R. viii. 10.; turning the mind from s. pleasures: %<nivartya viùayasukhebhyo manaþ>%, K.

     4 %<suratasevà>% (= lewdness); etc.

#<SENTENCE># (subs.):
     I Decision: q. v.: %<nirõayaþ>%.
     II Condemnation: %<daõóàj¤à>% and sim. comp. s. III. Maxim: %<såtram>%.
     IV Of words: %<vàkyam>%, complex s.: %<mahàvàkyam>%, Sah.

#<SENTENCE># (v.):
     1 %<àdi÷ati>% (%<di÷>%, c. 6. = to order: q. v., s. d him to death: %<tasya vadhamàdi÷at>%;
     2 %<÷àsti>% (%<÷às>%, c. 2. = to chastise), will be s. d to this punishment: %<etena daõóena ÷àsyate>%, Mr. x.: v. Punishment.

#<SERVANT>#:

     2 %<saüvasati>% (%<vas>%, c. 1.: rare).

     I In size:
     1 %<hasva>% (f. %<svà>%): very s. and having a s. face: %<kharvañàsyo'tihrasvakaþ>%, V. p. 1. 13. 34; s. tree: %<hnasvo vçkùaþ>%; s. hovel: %<hnasvà kuñã>%, Kà÷ikà:;

#<SO># (interj.): %<tiùñha>% or %<tiùñha tiùñha>% (from %<sthà>%).

#<SO># (adv. conj.):
     I In gen:
     1 %<tathà>%, as Vishnu alone is known as the best of men, so the sages know me (alone) to be the performer of hundred sacrifices: %<hariryathaikaþ puruùottamaþ smçtaþ tathà vidurmàü munayaþ ÷atakratum>%, R. iii. 49.; not so much before...as: %<tathà na pårvaü...yathà>%, Ki. viii. 41.; so scorched by the rays of the sun: %<tathàtitaptaü saviturgabhastibhiþ>%, Ku. v. 21.; you should act so that you are not laughed at by men: %<tathà prayatethà yathà nopahasyase janaiþ>%, K.; let him be entirely so: %<tathàvidhastàvada÷eùamastu saþ>%, Ku. v. 82.; be it so: %<tathàstu>%, Pra. iii.;
     2 %<evam>%, as sparks from burning fire are scattered in every direction, so: %<...yathàgnerjvalataþ sarvà di÷o visphuliïgà vipratiùñheran>%, S. 10.; and so of Vishnu: %<evaü hare÷ca>%, Li. 241.; my child, it is so or a (mere) joke: %<ayãdamevaü parihàso>% (%<và>%), Ku. v. 62.; don't say so: %<mà maivam>%, Mu. i.; it is so, but...: %<evabhetat kintu...>%, Vi. 6.; when the chief of divine sages said so (i. e. as described above): %<evamuktavati devaçùãndre>%, N. v. 37.;
     3 %<tadvat>% (= in like manner: gen with %<yadvat>%), S. iii. 3. 9.
     II Of degree: expr. by words meaning such: she is so pretty: %<ãdç÷aü råpalàvaõyam>%; so excellent: %<ãdçgguõopetaþ>% (%<tà taü>%), Ki. xi. 41.; so insufferable: %<ãdç÷aü suduþsaham>%, Ki. i. 43.; of so great-minded men: %<tàdç÷ànàü mahàtmanàm>%, K. N.B. so great, so little, is gen. expr. by sim. such, his erudition is so great: %<ãdç÷aü tasya pàõóityam>%; be so good as to... is expr. by %<anugçhnàti>% (= to favour) or %<bhadratayà>% (= out of goodness); ever so: v. However.
     III = So that: expr. by %<tathà...yathà>%, "were let loose, s. truth be in the field": %<tathà mucyeran yathà bhuvi satyamàvirbhavati>%: v. Also provided that.

#<SO FAR>#:
     I With as: %<yàvat>% (f. %<tã>%), so far as lies in my power: %<yàvacchaktitaþ>%, Ka.
     II Abs.: %<etàvat>% or %<iyat>% (f. %<tã>%), so far and no further: %<etàvannàdhikam>%.
     III With from expr. with %<àstàm>% (=let, alone) or %<dårataþ>%, far from seeing: %<dåre taddar÷anam>%, K. s. 25. 31.

#<SO FORTH>#: v. So on.

#<SO LONG>#:
     I Abs.: %<etàvatkàlam>%, and sim. comp.s.
     II With as or in cor. with as long as: expr. by %<yàvat...tàvat>%, so l. as I live, I wish %<...yàvat pràõimi tàvat...icchàmi>%, K.

     I Abs.:
     1 %<iyat>% (f. %<tã>%):
     2 %<etàvat>% (f. %<tã>%).

     1 %<tàvat>% (f. %<tã>%);
     2 %<tati>% (in pl. with %<yati>%: rare).

#<SO MUCH>#:
     I Adj.: v. Much, so
     II Adv.:
     1 %<ãdçk>%;
     2 %<etàdçk>%;
     3 %<tàdçk>% or %<tathà>% (in cor. with as: %<tàdçk>% with %<yàdçk>% and %<tathà>% with %<yathà>%), Arjuna did not regret so m. at the bad omen as for their emptiness: %<tenànimittena tathà na pàrthastayoryathà riktatayànutepe>%, Ki. xvii. 40.;
     4 by adj., those who ask do not feel so m. shame as those who give: %<na tàdç÷ã bhavati yàcamànànàü yàdç÷ã dadatàü lajjà>%, K. Ph.: so m. the better, the worse for him: perh. %<etattàvacchomanam a÷obhanameva>%.

     I Lit.:
     1 %<yàcaka>% (f. %<cikà>%);
     2 %<arthin>% (f. %<nã>%) %<pra- ami>%, although he expressed that he was a s.: %<arthitve prakañãkçte'pi>%, Vi. ii. 9.;
     3 %<abhyarthin>% (f. %<nã>%);
     4 %<pràrthayitç>% (f. %<trã>%);

     7 %<vanãyaka>% (f. %<yikà>%: rare).
     III In law: %<*samarthayitç>% (f. %<trã>%).

     1 %<dhvanati pra->% (%<dhvan>%, c. 1.), s. ed making the quarters re-s.: %<dadhvàna dhvanayannà÷àþ>%, Mah.; drums s. ed being beaten: %<paõavà dadhvanurhatàþ>%, Bh. xiv. 3.;

     IV Deep, profound: q. v.: %<gabhãra>% (f. %<rà>%).

#<SOUNDLY>#:

#<STIR># (v.):
     I Trans.:
     1 %<viloóayati à->%, (c. of %<luó>%), s. ring of the ocean: %<udadhiviloóanam>%, Ki. xiv. 83.;
     2 %<kùobhayati>% (c. of %<kùubh>% = agitate, excite: q. v.:).
     II Intrans.: %<kùumyati>% (%<kùubh>%, c. 4.): v. Agitated, to be.

#<STRENGTH>#:
     I In gen.:
     1 %<balam>%, for possessing s.: %<bala÷àlitayà>%, Ki.; to know from me the s. and weakness of the three objects: %<itastrivargabalalàghavaj¤ànam>%, D. ii.; these are the eight-fold s. (of a state): %<tadaùñàïgabalaü smçtam>%, Mah. xii. 121. 44.;

#<STUPEFY>#:
     1 %<jaóayati>% (nomi.), s. ies the mind: %<antarjaóayati>%, Ma. i. 31.; make even masters of speech dumb (i. e. s. them): %<vàgã÷à÷napi måkàn kårvate>% (%<jaóayantãtyarthaþ>%), M n. on Si. ii. 25.;

#<SUCK># (v.):
     I As children: %<stanam>% or %<stanyaü pibati>% (%<pà>%, c. 1.) or %<dhayati>% (%<dhe>%, c. 1.). thirst for s.ing: %<stanyapàne pipàsà>%, J.

(it) otherwise: %<anyathà gçhõanti gràmyàþ>%, C. vii.; do not t. advice: %<na gçhõantyupade÷am>%, K.; to t. all forms: %<vi÷varåpatvaü grahãtum>%, K.; to t. venerable men by service: %<grahãtumàryàn paricaryayà>%, Si. i. 17.; so long as Ràkshasa is not t.n: %<agçhãte ràkùase>%, Mu. i.; when they t.ing your signs: %<teùu gçhãtasaüj¤eùu>%, Mu. i.; are t.n as if by evils stars: %<grahairiva gçhyante>%, K.; t. the pride of killing a woman: %<gçhàõa vadhåvadhapauruùam>%, N. iv. 53.; His Majesty who has t.n his name well: %<tasya sugçhãtanàmno devasya>%, C. vii.;
     2 %<àdatte sam->%, (%<dà>%, c. 3.: physically), t.ing the girl by the hand: %<kanyàmàdadànaþ kareõa>%, Ku.; for t. ing is for spending: %<àdànaü hi visargàya>%, R.: v. Also to catch, hold, view, understand.
     II Special.      III As a writer: %<dãrghasåtra>% (f. %<trà>%).

#<TEDIOUSLY>#:
     I So as to tire:
     1 expr. by circumlo.;
     2 %<atidãrgham>% (= very long).
     II Slowly: %<mantharam>%.

#<TEADIOUSNESS>#:
     I Wearisomeness:
     1 %<khedajananatvam -tà>%;
     2 by circumlo.
     II Slowness: %<mantharatà>%.
     III As of writings: %<dãrghasåtratà>%.

#<TEEM># (v.): expr. with, %<pracuraþ>% (%<rà raü>%): v. To abound, abundant.

     1 %<kathayati>% (%<kath>%, c. 10.), learnt without being told: %<akathita÷ikùita>% (f. %<tà>%), K.; when I tell the history of (his) former life: %<janmàntaravçttantaü mayi kathayati>%, K.; that (my) internal wish is told by the eyes: %<yaccakùuùaiva hçdayàbhilàùa kathyate>%, K.; whom should I tell: %<kasya kathayàmi>%, K.;

#<THAN>#:
     1 by abl., the people of Mathurà are richer t. the people of Pàtnà: %<màthuràþ pàñalãputrabhya àóhyataràþ>%, S. k.; swifter t. the mind: %<manaso'pyà÷utaram>%, Ki. xiii. 22.; and the king who gave more t. was asked for: %<nçpo'rthikàmàdadhikaprada÷ca>%, R. v. 31.; dearer to you t. I.: %<mattaþ priyatarastava>%, K.;
     2 sometimes by comp., more t. twenty times: %<adhikaviü÷àn vàràn>%, Au.: v. Also more. N.B. In old books the ins. is often used for the abl.: %<ko'nvasti duþkhitataro mayà duùkçtakarmaõà>%, Ram. ii. 59. 30.

#<THANKLESS>#:
     I Of men: %<akçtaj¤a>% (f. %<j¤à>%): v. Ungrateful.
     II Of work. etc.: %<yaþ>% (%<yà yat>%) %<na pra÷asyate>%: v. To praise.

#<THANKLESSLY>#: expr. by circumlo.

#<THANKS>#: %<dhanyavàdaþ>% (?), thanksgiving: perh. %<stutipàñhaþ>%.

#<THAT>#:
     I Demonstrative pronoun: %<tad>%, t. object: %<so'rthaþ>%, D. iii.; in t. season: %<tasmin samaye>%, R. xvi. 53.; narrated all t.: %<tatsarvamàcakhyau>%, Mah.: v. Also this. Ph.: (a) t. is to say %<......: ityarthaþ tasya yåno'pi viùayavairàgyàdiguõasampattyà j¤ànato vçddhatvamàsãdityarthaþ>%, M.n. (N. B. Use......: %<iti yàvat>%, when a full explanation is not given, %<manãùiõo viduùo doùaj¤asyaiti yàvat>%, M. p.); (b) t. is not expr., by object t. is by sound etc. M.n.
     II Relative pronoun=who, which: q. v.
     III Conjunction, introducing clauses or sentences as object of the preceding verb.:
     1 expr. with %<iti>%, would think t. they adore him out of fear: %<maüsyati bhayàdarcanti màmiti>%, Mah. v. 88. 3. (note the use of direct speech); t. he might allow the race of Nimi......: %<di÷yatàü kulamidaü nimeriti>%, R. xi. 49.; we hear t. king has come to the Janasthàna: %<÷råyate ràjà janasthànamàgata iti>%, U. iii. (N.B. Sometimes %<iti>% is understood as t. in English: %<"÷råyate tau mahàtmànau naranàràyaõàvubhau | tapo ghoramanirde÷yaü tapyete gandhamàdane ||">%, Mah. v. 96. 14.):
     2 by acc. after trans. verbs, knowing t. his end was born: %<jànannapi jàtamantamàtmanaþ>%, Si. i. 67.; informed t. a golden shower had fallen from heaven: %<hiraõmayãü vçùñiü ÷a÷aüsuþ patitàü namastaþ>%, R. v. 29.;
     3 with %<yathà>% or %<yat>%, Va÷isñha said t. they would go and live in the hermitage of Vàlmãki: %<va÷iùñhasya vàcaþ 'yathà vàlmãkitapovanaü gatvà tatra vatsyàma iti'>%, U. ii.; this is new rule t. one repents after killing an enemy: %<ayaü nåtano nyàyo yadaràtiü hatvà saütàpaþ krãyate>%, H. ii. Ph.: granting t. expr. by: %<astu stàm santu>%.
     IV Introducing reason etc.: (a) so t.: %<yathà... tathà>%, do so t. (he) hears from your messenger: %<yathà tava sande÷aharàcchçõoti tathà vidhãyatàm>%, R. iii. 66.; (b) in order t.: %<yathà ..tathà>%: v. also for (II), to; (c) in t.= because: q. v. Ph.: oh that: expr. with %<kaccit>%: v. To wish.

#<THATCH>#:
     I Subs.:
     1 %<chadiþ>%;
     2 %<chàdanam>%;
     3 %<pañalam>%, A.
     II Verb.: (%<tçõàdinà>%) %<chàdayati à->%, (c. of %<chad>%), t.ed: %<tçõàcchàdita>% (f. %<tà>%) and sim. comp.s or simply %<tçõa->% in comp.

#<THAW># (v.):
     I Intrans.: %<dravati>% (%<du>%, c. 1.): v. To melt.
     II Trans.: %<dravãkaroti>%.
     III Subs.: %<himasrutiþ>% and sim. comp.s.

#<THE>#:
     I The definite article:
     1 not expr., I salute the parents of the world: %<jagataþ pitarau vande>%, R. i. 1.; the kind said: %<ràjovàca>%, H.; in the house of Vasudeva: %<vasudevasadmani>%, Si. i. 1.;
     2 by demonstrative pronouns, where shall I get the bird: %<kva pràpyate sa patagaþ>%, N. xiii. 40.; the day is advanced: %<kañhorãbhåto'yaü divasaþ>%, U. ii.
     II Of distinction: by %<tad>% or rarely %<adas>%, we are the Ràma and Lakshmaõa: %<àvàü tau ràmalakùmaõau>%, An v.; and you are the Lakshmaõa: %<tvaü punarasau lakùmaõaþ>%, Vi. v.
     III With comp. adv.s:
     1 with %<yathà yathà...... tathà tathà>%, the closer the sound of the drums came, the more excited the hostile army (became): %<upàgamadyathà yathà pañaharavaþ samãpatàü tathà tathà hçùitavapurdviùà¤camåþ>%, Si. xvii. 43.; %<"romakåpanivahaü yathà yathà naiùadhasya dçgapàttathà tathà citramàpadapatçùõatà na sà">%, N. xviii. 124.;
     2 with %<yàvat yàvat......tàvat tàvat>%, M.n. Ph.: the more so: %<vi÷eùataþ>% (= specially).

#<THEN>#:
     1 %<tadà>% (of time, rarely of cause), when...t.: %<yadà...tadà>%, Ku. v. 18.; t. (he) knew: %<tadà viveda>%, Ki. iii. 18.;
     2 %<tadànãm>% (of time), but t. by the narration of the story of her life: %<tadànãntu svavçttàntakathanena>%, K.;
     3 %<tataþ>% (of sequence and cause), t. when your Highness came away: %<tataþ khalvàgate deve>%, K.; what t.: %<tataþ kim>%, K.; first of all splendour, t. sound, t. dust: %<pratàpo'gre tataþ ÷abdaþ paràgastadantaram>%, R. iv. 30.; if she does not vanish from my sight, t. I shall ask her all these: %<tadyadi me dar÷anapathànnàpayàti tataþ...sarvametadenàü pçcchàmi>%, K.; and t. (as a question): %<tatastataþ>%, Mr. ii.;
     4 %<atha>% (of sequence at the head of a sentence), t. at the end of the song: %<atha gãtàvasàne>%, K.;

     6 %<tat>% (causal), t. how is the gentle Ràma now to be consoled: %<tat kathamidànãü ràmabhadra à÷vàsanãyaþ>%, U. ii.

     II To beat soundly: %<paruùaü praharati>% (%<hç>%, c. 1.), t. ing: %<paruùaprahàraþ>% and sim. comp.s.

#<THREAD># (subs.):
     1 %<såtram>%, golden t.: %<suvarõasåtram>%, Si.;

#<TIME># (subs.):

     1 %<kàlaþ>%, from t. to t.: %<kàle kàle>%, Me.; by this t.: %<iyatà kàlena>%, D. iii.; in the course of t.: %<kàlena>%, Ve. iii. or %<kàlakrameõa>%, Ku. or %<gacchati kàle>%, K.; t. should not be thrown away: %<na kàlaþ parikùeptavyaþ>%, Vi. ii.; without losing any t.: %<vihàya kàlaharaõam>%, Vi. iv.; I will not waste my t.: %<na kàlaü hàsyàmi>%, Sa. iii.; for a long t.      II Time of the day: %<velà>%, ascertain what is the t.: %<j¤àyatàü kà velà vartata iti>%, Mu. iv.; dinner t.: %<mojanavelà>%, P. iii.: v. Musical measure:

     2 %<tàlaþ>% (= beating t.).

     1 %<kàle>%;
     2 %<yathàkàlam>%;
     3 %<yathàsamayam>%.

#<TIMID>#:
     1 %<trasnu>% (mfn.);
     2 %<bhãru>% (f. also %<rå>%);

     2 %<vaïgam>%.

#<TO>#:
     I With verbs of motion: by acc., I was taken to the edifice of the princess: %<nãto'haü kanyakàniketanam>%, D. vii. (G. Par. 162-3).
     II Expressing indirect object: by dat., shewing to the queen: %<dar÷ayan patnyai>%, R. (G. Par. 180.).
     III With inf.: by inf., I have come to impart the knowledge: %<vidyàü dàtumupàgato'sbhi>%, Ki. v. 23. (G. Par. 279-83).
     IV With special verb: q. v. V. In comparison to: by gen., who are other archers to me: %<ke mama dhanvino'nye>%, Ku. iii. 10. (G. Par. 211, 209),
     VI Of direction: to the north-west of Kailàsa: %<kailàsàt pa÷cimodãcyàm>%, Mat.: to the north of Nishadha: %<niùadhasyottareõa>%, Mah. (G. Par. 207, 196).
     VII=towards: q. v.
     VIII=up to: q. v.: %<à>% with abl. or in comp., to the coast of the four oceans: %<à pàrebhya÷caturõàmambhodhãnàm>%, Mu. iii. 24.
     IX Expressing number: expr. by comp., to the number of five hundred: %<pa¤ca÷atasaükhyaka>% (f. %<kà>%).
     X In other senses; hand to hand: %<hastàhasti>%; to one's face: %<sammukhe>%; "to his ruin": %<svanà÷àya>%; "she to his image was made": %<sà tadanuråpà kçtà>%; "I have a king here to my flatterer": %<ayaü ràjà mama stàvakabhåmau vartate>%.

     IV Alternation: %<paryàyaþ>%, by t. s, in t.: %<paryàyeõa>% or %<paryàya->% in comp., Ki. xvii. 18.
     V Successive course: %<vàraþ>%, one day a hare's t. came: %<atha kadàciccha÷akasya vàraþ samàyàtaþ>%, H.
     VI Of mind: %<gatiþ>%: v. Also inclination.
     VII Of expression: %<bhaïgiþ(ïgã)>%: v. Also form.
     VIII Of requital: good t.: %<upakàraþ>%; ill t.: %<apakàraþ>%.
     IX A short walk: %<parikramaþ>%.
     X Course: q. v.: %<gatiþ>%.
     XI Occasion, opportunity: %<avasaraþ>%.

#<TURN># (v. t.):
     I To revolve, roll: q. v.: %<ghårõayati>% (c. of %<ghårõ>%).
     II To change: q. v.: %<parivartayati>% (c. of %<vçt>%).
     III To reverse: q. v.: %<viparyàsayati>% (c. of %<asa>%).
     IV To adopt, divert, utilize: q. v.: to t. into good account: %<saphalãkarotiþ>%; to t. into ashes: %<bhasmãkaroti>%; to. t. into some use: %<upayojayati>%; to t. one's eyes: %<netraü pàtayati>%; to t. one's attention: %<avadhànaü dadàti>%; to t. the back: %<pçùñhaü dar÷ayati>%: v. To shape, form: q. v.

#<TURN># (v. i.):
     I To revolve, roll: q. v.: %<ghårõate>% (%<ghårõa>%, c. 1.).
     II To change: q. v.:
     1 %<parivartate>% (%<vçt>%, c. 1.); by %<bhavati>%, to t. into red: %<raktãbhavati>%.
     III To t. out: q. v.

#<TURN ABOUT>#: from side to side: %<pàr÷va parivartanaü>% or %<vivartanaü karoti>%; by t. ing about in the bed: %<÷ayyopàntavivartanaiþ>%, Ta. vi. 4.

#<TURN AGAINST>#:
     I %<pratãpayati>% (nomi.).
     II Intrans.: %<pratikålãbhavati>%.

#<TURN AWAY>#:
     I To remove: q. v.: %<apanayati>% (%<nã>%, c. 1.).
     II Drive out, dispel: q. v.: %<dårãkaroti>%.
     III Intrans.: %<paràümukhãbhavati vimukhãbhavati>%; etc., (although) she generally t. s away from me: %<kàmaü na tiùñhati madànanasammukhãyam>%. Sa. i. 32; when I look she t. s away: %<abhimukhe mayi saühçtamãkùitam>%, Sa. ii. 12.

#<TURN BACK>#:
     I Trans.: %<paràvartayati>% (c. of %<vçt>%).
     II Intrans.: %<paràvartate>% (%<vçt>%, c. 1.).

#<TURN DOWN, TURN IN>#: v. To fold.

#<TURN OFF>#:
     I Divert: %<vivartayati>% (c. of %<vçt>%).
     II To dismiss, discharge: q. v.: %<dårãkaroti>%.

     2 %<alamya>% (f. %<bhyà>%);

#<UNDOUBTED>#:
     1 %<asandigdha>% (%<gdhà gdhaü>%);

     3 %<niþsaü÷ayaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%);
     4 %<asaü÷ayaþ>% (%<yà yaü>%);
     5 %<avimçùya>% (%<ùyàþ ùyaü>%): v. Certain.

#<UNDOUBTEDLY>#: %<asaü÷ayam>%;
     2 %<niþsaü÷ayam>%;
     3 %<niþsandeham>%;
     4 %<asandigdham>%.

#<UNDRAW>#: %<apasàrayati>% (c. of %<sç>%).

#<UNTIE>#:
     1 %<mocayati>% or %<mokùayati>% (%<muc>% or %<mukù>%, c. 10.=release), shall u. him: %<enaü mokùayet>%, Sr.;
     2 %<÷ithilayati>% or %<÷lathayati>% (nomi. = loosen), the tight knots being u. d by preceptors: %<guru÷lathãkçtadçóhagranthiþ>%, N. xxii. 154.;
     3 %<vigrathnàti>% (%<granth>%, c. 9.: rare), Sr.

#<UNTIL>#: %<yàvat>%, u. the day and whole night passed: %<yàvadapàsaradvàsaraþ ÷arvarã ca sarvà>%, D. vi.: v. Till.

#<VAIN>#:
     I In gen.:
     1 %<niùphala>% (f. %<là>% = fruitless: q. v.), one whose efforts are v.: %<niùphalaprayatna>% (f. %<tnà>%), M. n. on Ki. ix. 46.;

     3 %<vyartha>% (f. %<rthà>% = 2.);
     4 %<mogha>% (f. %<ghà>%), made her hand v.: %<tatpàõiü moghaü vitene>%, N. iii. 5.;
     5 %<vçthà->% in comp.: v. jest: %<vçthàparãhàsaþ>%, N. ix. 25.; (your) toils are v.: %<vçthà÷ramaþ>%, Ki. v. 45.
     II Proud: %<vçthàbhimànin>% (f. %<nã>%), and sim. comp. s.
     III Showy, ostentatious: q. v.
