#<VERTIGO>#: %<bhramaram>%: v. Dizziness.

#<VERY># (adj.):
     I Real, actual: q. v.: expr. by adv. %<satyam>% etc.
     II Same: q. v., he is the v. man: %<ayaü saþ>%.
     III Emphatic: expr. with %<eva>%, it is the v. same forest: %<etattadeva hi vanam>%, U. ii. 22.; these are the v. same mountains: %<ete ta eva girayaþ>%, U. ii. 23.; this very day: %<adyaiva>%, Ve. iv. 1.

#<VERY># (adv.):
     1 %<ati->% in comp., v. scarce: %<atidurlabha>% (f. %<bhà>%);
     2 %<su->% in comp. (= good), v. many (= good many): %<subahu>% (mfn.); v. far, (= good distance): %<sudåram>%; v. hot (= well heated): %<sutapta>% (f. %<ptà>%);
     3 by comp. or super., v. heavy rain: %<baühãyasã vçùñiþ>%, Si. iii. 6.; v. quick: %<kùepãyas>%, Vi. v. 15.; v. swift: %<drutatara>% (f. %<rà>%), Si. xi. 8.; v. big: %<vipulatara>% (f. %<rà>%), Si. xi. 5.: v. Also exceeding, extremely.

     I Lit.: %<koùakamaya>% (f. %<yã>%).

#<VITAL>#:
     I Lit.: by comp., v. air: %<pràõavàyuþ>% ; v. Life, spirit. Ph.: v. part: %<marman>% (n.).
     II Essential, necessary: q. v.

#<VITALITY>#:
     1 %<jãvanam>% (= life: q. v.);
     2 %<sajãvatvam>% (as of plants);
     3 %<spanditam>% (of limbs).

#<VITALLY>#:
     I Lit.: expr. by circumlo.
     II Essentially, particularly: q. v.

#<VITALS>#:
     I Lit.: %<marmàõi>% (n. pl.).
     II Fig.: %<àlambaþ>%: v. Support.

#<VITIATE>#: %<dåùayati>% (c. of %<duù>%): v. To corrupt, pollute, destroy.

#<VITIATION>#: %<dåùaõam>%: v. Corruption, pollution, destruction.

#<VITREOUS>#:
     1 %<kàcaja>% (f. %<jà>% etc. = produced from glass);
     2 %<kàcamaya>% (f. %<yã>% = consisting of glass.);
     3 %<kàcàma>% (f. %<bhà>% etc. = resembling glass).

#<VITRIFY>#: %<kàcãkaroti>% (?).

     I Blue:
     1 %<tuttham -kam>%;
     2 %<vitunnakam>% (rare).
     II Green:
     1 %<kàsã(÷ã)sam>%;
     2 %<puùpakam>% (rare).

#<VITUPERATION>#: %<àkùepaþ>%: v. Censure, reproach.

     2 %<tejasà>% (= vigorously).

     2 %<tejasvità>% (= vigorousness).

     2 %<rãtiþ>% (= fashion).

#<VOICE>#:
     I In gen.: %<svaraþ>%, the Brahmin's v. has been changed with fear: %<bhãtibhinnasvaro bràhmaõaþ>%; it seems to be the distressed v. of Màdhavya, %<aye màdhavyasyevàrtasvaraþ>%, Sa. vi.
     II Opinion: %<matam>%, with one v.: %<aikyamatyena>%; he has no v. in the matter: %<na taddhastagatamidam>%.

     2 to

#<WHETHER># (conj.): they w. tigers or lions: %<te vyàghro và siüho và>%, S. iii. 2. 9.; it is doubtful w. the word %<pràõa>% here refers to only air, or soul, or the supreme spirit: %<tatra saü÷ayaþ kimiha pràõa÷abdena vàyumàtramamidhãyate uta jãvaþ athavà paraü brahme ti>%, S. 28.; w. it is the supreme spirit or something else: %<tat kiü paraü brahma syàdàhosvidarthàntaram>%, S. iii. 1.: v. #<WHEY>#:
     1 %<mastu>% (n.);
     2 %<dadhimaõóa>% (mn.).

#<WHICH># (rel.): %<yat>%: v. Who, what. W. of two: %<yataraþ>% (%<rà t>%); w. of many: %<yatamaþ>% (%<mà -t>%).

#<WHICH># (inter.): %<kim>%: v. Who, what; w. of two: %<kataraþ>% (%<rà -t>%); w. of many: %<katamaþ>% (%<mà -t>%).

#<WHICHEVER>#: %<yo yaþ>% (%<yà yà yad yat>%): v. Whoever, whatever.

#<WHIFF>#:
     I Subs.: %<phutkàraþ>% or %<phutkçtam>%.
     II Verb: %<phutkaroti>%.

#<WHIG>#: no equiv.: %<*vigaþ>%.

#<WHILE># (subs.): for a little w.: %<kiyatkùaõam>% or %<ki¤citkàlam>%. After a long w.: %<cireõa>%: v. Time, moment. Ph.: not worth w.: %<niùphala>% (f. %<là>%): v. Vain.

#<WHILE, WHILST>#
     1 %<yadà>%: v. When; %<yàvat>% (as a conj.: with %<tàvat>%).

#<WHILE,># -AWAY: %<gamayati>% (c. of %<gam>%): v. To pass.

#<WHIM>#: %<kàmacàraþ>%: v. Caprice, freak.

#<WHIMPER>#: %<cåükaroti>%: v. To cry.

#<WHIMSICAL>#:
     1 %<kàmacàrin>% (f. %<õã>%);
     2 %<ca¤cala>% (f. %<là>%): v. Capricious, fickle.

#<WHINE>#:
     I Verb: v. To complain, murmur.
     II Subs.: v. Complaint, murmur.

     2 %<kranditam>% (= cry).

#<WING># (subs.):
     I Lit.:
     1 %<pakùaþ>%, protected me with his own w. s: %<svapakùàbhyàü màmarakùat>%, Vi. v. 5.; stretched the w. s and flew up to heaven: %<vitatya pakùau nabha utpapàta>%, Mah. i. 25. 17.; root of a w.: %<pakùatiþ>%, N. ii. 2.;

#<WITH>#:
     I Denoting instrument, means: by ins., to play w. dice: %<akùairdãvyati>%, Ve. i. 13.; not only w. (their) hearts: %<na kevalaü hçdayena>%, N. xi. 2.; he was looked w. greater respect: %<gauraveõa dadç÷etaràmasau>%, Si. xiv. 43.
     II Along w.: by ins. gen. with %<saha>% (or rarely) %<sàkaü sàrdham samam>%, to live w. Uddhava and Balavbhadra: %<sàrdhamuddhavasãribhyàm>%, Si. ii. 2.; w. your fame, your body is getting thin: %<paraiti kàr÷yaü ya÷asà samaü vapuþ>%, Ki. i. 39.
     III Denoting manner:
     1 by adv. with %<sa>%, w. pleasure: %<saharùam>%; w. alarm: %<sodvegam>%;
     2 by adj., w. great pleasure: %<mudà paramayà yutaþ>%; w. stick in hand: %<daõóahastaþ>%; etc.; the goddess w. ten arms: %<da÷abhujà>%.
     IV On the side of: the divine sages were w. the sons of Pàõóu: %<devarùãõàü gaõàþ pàõóavato'bhavan>%, Mah. viii. 87. 51.
     V In the opinion of: expr. w. %<matam>%, "w. the ancients": %<pràcàü mate>%.
     VI With verbs denoting resentment etc.: by dat. (G.). Ph.: one w. another:
     1 %<parasparam>%;
     2 %<anyo'nyam>%. N. B. w. with verbs is also expr. by %<sam->% in comp., to live w.: %<saüvasati>%.

#<WORK># (v. t.):
     I To manufacture, make: q. v.: %<karoti>%.
     II To make w.: %<karma kàrayatiþ>% v. Also to toil.
     III To move (as a machine): q. v.: %<càlayati>% (c. of %<cal>%).
     IV To embroider: q. v.

#<WORK OUT>#:
     I To accomplish: q. v.: %<niùpàdayati>% (c. of %<pad>%).
     II To invent: %<parikalpayati>% (c. of %<këp>%).
     III To efface: q. v.

#<WORK UP>#:
     I To raise: q. v.
     II To employ, use: %<prayuükte>% (%<yuj>%, c. 7.).

     1 %<spçhà>% (= longing);

     3 %<autsukyam>% (= eagerness).

     1 %<suràmaõóaþ>%;
     2 %<kiõva>% (mn.);
     3 %<abhiùavaþ>%.

#<YES>#:
     1 %<atha kim>%, do the Rishis bear message from Kaõva, y.: %<kiü kaõvasande÷ahàriõastapasvinaþ ? atha kim>%, Sa. v.; y. by your favour my mercantile business is not failing: %<atha kim àryasya prasàdena nàkhaõóità me vaõijyà>%, Mu. i.;
     2 %<vàóham>% (= very well, indeed);
     3 %<evam>% (= so, with %<eva>% = just so);
     4 by repetition of verb, y., I have heard of him: %<asti ÷råyate>%, Sa. i.; y., you have guessed all right: %<samyagupalakùitaü bhavatyà>%, Sa.

#<YESTERDAY>#:
     1 %<hyas>%, of y.: %<hyastana>% (f. %<nã>%);
     2 %<pårvedyåþ>% (= on the previous day);
     3 %<kalyam>% (= day gone by as well as day coming).

#<YESTERNIGHT>#:
     1 %<gataràtriþ>%;
     2 %<kalyaràtriþ>%; and sim. comp. s.

#<YET>#:
     I Nevertheless:
     1 %<tathàpi>%, yet I am desirous of hearing: %<tathàpi ÷u÷råùuraham>%, Si. i. 29.;
     2 not expr., although it is infested with fierce animals, y. it is frequented by sages: %<krårasattvàpi munijanasevità>%, K.;
     3 %<parantu>% (= but: q. v.).
     II Of time:
     1 %<adyàpi>%, I y. think of her: %<adyàpi tàü cintayàmi>%, J.;
     2 %<adhunàpi>%, where y. in the rainy season: %<adhunàpi yatra jaladharasamaye>%, K.;
     3 %<idànãmapi>%.
     III Further, over and above, y. blacker: %<adhikatarakçùõa>% (f. %<ùõà>%); y. another reason: %<aparamapi kàraõam>%: y. a little longer: %<etadadhikaü kiyatkùaõam>%.

#<YIELD>#:
     I To produce: q. v.
     1 %<såte>% (%<så>%, c. 2.), y. ed gems in mines, crops in fields and elephants in forests: %<khanibhiþ suùuve ratnaü kùetraü ÷asyairvanairgajàn>%, R. xvii. 66.;
     2 %<dadàti pra->% (%<dà>%, c. 3. give), y. ing every crop: %<sarva÷asyaprada>% (f. %<dà>%).
     II To give up, relinquish.
     II To concede, allow, permit: q. v.: %<anumanyate>% (%<man>%, c. 4.).

#<YIELD># (v. i.):
     I To give way: q. v.: %<va÷aü gacchati>% (%<gam>%, c. 1.), %<eti>% (%<i>%, c. 2.); etc.
     II To comply with: %<anumanyate>% (%<man>%, c. 4.: with acc.).
